original: yang srid par skye bar 'dod pa'i gang zag nyid kyi yang srid par skye bar 'dod pa'i dbang du byas te smon nas tshangs par spyad par spyod pa 'di ni log par bsgrub pa gnyis pa'o //üîΩphyi rol gyi rdzas sngar spangs pa rnams la lta ba dang bcas pas kun du chags pa'i gnas de'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: yang srid par skye bar 'dod pa'i gang zag nyid kyi yang srid par skye bar 'dod pa'i dbang du byas te smon nas tshangs par spyad par spyod pa 'di ni log par bsgrub pa gnyis pa'o // phyi rol gyi rdzas sngar spangs pa rnams la lta ba dang bcas pas kun du chags pa'i gnas de'i dbang du byas te /
translated: The second wrong practice is the practice of celibacy through aspiration, which is done by a person who wishes to be reborn in a future existence.

original: bslab pa phul nas nyams par 'gyur ba 'di ni log par sgrub par gsum pa'o //
analyzed: bslab pa phul nas nyams par 'gyur ba 'di ni log par sgrub par gsum pa'o //
translated: The third wrong practice is the degeneration of the precepts after giving them up, which is done by a person who is attached to the objects of the five kinds of sensual pleasure that were previously given up.

original: de ltar gyi dus kyi sgo nas rnyed pa dang / bkur stis dga' bar 'gyur la rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la lhag par zhen pa'i gang zag ni kun tu chags pa'i gnas de'i dbang du byas nas tshul khrims 'chal bar 'gyur ba nas rgyas par lung gong ltar kun du spyod pa'i bar du sbyar te /
analyzed: de ltar gyi dus kyi sgo nas rnyed pa dang / bkur stis dga' bar 'gyur la rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la lhag par zhen pa'i gang zag ni kun tu chags pa'i gnas de'i dbang du byas nas tshul khrims 'chal bar 'gyur ba nas rgyas par lung gong ltar kun du spyod pa'i bar du sbyar te /
translated: The fourth wrong practice is the practice of a person who is attached to the objects of the five kinds of sensual pleasure, who is pleased with gain and honor, and who, because of this attachment, becomes immoral, and so on, as in the above quotation.

original: de ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lta ba des bslab pa yang 'bul bar mi byed la gang gis 'chal ba'i tshul khrims 'chags par byed pa'i kha na ma thob la yang mi lta ba 'di ni log par sgrub pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lta ba des bslab pa yang 'bul bar mi byed la gang gis 'chal ba'i tshul khrims 'chags par byed pa'i kha na ma thob la yang mi lta ba 'di ni log par sgrub pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: This is the fourth wrong practice, which is not to give up the training because of the view of gain and honor, and not to see the fault in the immorality that is confessed.

original: dge slong don la mi mkhas pa ni don gcig la tshig gi rnam pa sna tshogs su 'dug pa'i gtam gzhan dag las thos na 'di la gang bden zhig gu snyam du yid gnyis za zhing ma rangs par 'gyur ra //

translated: Having focused on the internal and external sense bases, in order to abandon the consciousness that appropriates the four abodes of consciousness, they possess mindfulness belonging to the body, which is fully embraced by ≈õamatha and vipa≈õyanƒÅ.

translated: Just as he directs his attention to the first abode of consciousness in accordance with the way things really are, he should be understood to do the same in regard to the second, third, and fourth abodes of consciousness.

analyzed: snga ma bzhin du dbang po'i sgo ma bsdams pa'i gang zag nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa la mngon du phyogs pa 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i so sor brtags pa dang / bsgoms pa'i stobs dang / gnyen po med pa nyon mongs pa byung ba dang du len pa'i ngang tshul can la ni bdud kyis 'di ni dang du len pa'i ngang tshul can yin no snyam du rig nas yul rnyed pa'i tshul gyis 'ong bar 'gyur te /

translated: The person who does not guard the doors of the senses has little inclination for nirvana and little inclination for renunciation. He is like a house of reeds or dry grass, and Mara can set fire to the grass of the objects of desire there.

translated: Thus, seeing that river of existence as not at all peaceful, whether by contact, by the bank, by the bottom, by the middle, or by the surface, the great compassion that arises for the sentient beings who have fallen into it is called ‚Äúcompassionate impulse.‚ÄùüîΩOne who has that compassionate impulse is born in the palace of a king

original: khyim par 'dug bzhin du bdag nyid mngon par sgro ba skyes nas go 'phang gi mchog rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: khyim par 'dug bzhin du bdag nyid mngon par sgro ba skyes nas go 'phang gi mchog rtogs par bya ste /
translated: While living at home, one generates the aspiration to realize the supreme state,

original: bdag ni phyir ldog par mi bya'o //

original: tshangs par spyod pa'i mchog tu 'gro'o snyam pa 'di ni de'i bdag nyid kyi mngon par spro ba yin no //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa'i mchog tu 'gro'o snyam pa 'di ni de'i bdag nyid kyi mngon par spro ba yin no //

translated: Moreover, without leaving home, he goes alone to a secluded place, sits in the shade of an Indian fig tree, and enters the first meditative concentration.

original: de bdag dang gzhan la yang rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba'i chos can yin par yang dag par rtog cing bzod pa 'di ni de'i bdag nyid kyis chos spyod pa bzod pa yin no //

original: de sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa bas bskul ba dang / chos spyod pa bzod pa la mngon par spro ba de'i dbang du byas nas 'dod pa rgya chen po spangs te nges par byung nas tshangs par spyod pa bcas pa med bzhin du rang nyid kyis tshul khrims yang dag par len par byed do //
analyzed: de sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa bas bskul ba dang / chos spyod pa bzod pa la mngon par spro ba de'i dbang du byas nas 'dod pa rgya chen po spangs te nges par byung nas tshangs par spyod pa bcas pa med bzhin du rang nyid kyis tshul khrims yang dag par len par byed do //
translated: Urged on by his previous roots of virtue and inspired by his patience that is a natural result of Dharma practice, he renounces extensive desires, goes forth from home, and without being asked, himself takes up the moral precepts of pure conduct.

original: tshul khrims de dag la brten nas kyang 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar du snyoms par 'jug pa 'di ni de'i nges par 'byung ba zhes bya'o //

original: de mos par ma gyur nas 'jig rten pa'i lam de bor te /
analyzed: de mos par ma gyur nas 'jig rten pa'i lam de bor te /
translated: When he has not yet attained this, he abandons the worldly pathüîΩand, in order to go forth, he hears about the unsurpassed going forth from the former perfect Buddhas.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i phyir sngon gyi yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams las bla na med pa'i nges par 'byung thos nas mos par rgyud yongs su bsgom pa'i phyir byang chub kyi shing drung du song nas /

original: snga ma'i rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba'i brtags pa de 'ba' zhig lam yin par 'dzin cing de nyid la bden pa'i rnam par brtag par rtsom ste /

original: kye ma 'jig rten 'di ni nyam nga bar zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: kye ma 'jig rten 'di ni nyam nga bar zhugs pa yin te /

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩskye yang skye /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / skye yang skye /

original: rga yang rga /

translated: Even if I die, I will die, but these sentient beings do not know the true nature of the deliverance from old age and death.

translated: Thus, in due course, he attends to the truth of old age and death, the origin of old age and death, the cessation of old age and death, and the path that leads to the cessation of old age and death. translated: One attains the mundane meditative concentrations, liberations, meditative absorptions, and attainments, and one attains the ability to teach the Dharma in any way one wishes, using the various collections of names, words, and letters.

analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba la mngon par spro ba shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po'o //

analyzed: shes pa bcu'i stobs shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ni shes rab kyi dbang po bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: The cultivation of the faculty of wisdom is completed due to the extreme purity of the power of the ten knowledges.

original: de gnas drug po de dag bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa'i rgyus chos kyi rgyal po phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa drug brnyes pa'i rgyal por 'gyur te /

translated: By the cause of perfecting the meditation on those six topics, he becomes a king who has attained the six kinds of perfect sovereignty of a Dharma king.

original: 'phags pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi sgo nas ni nor gyi dbang phyug rgya chen po phun sum tshogs pa brnyes so //

analyzed: dbang po dag pa'i sgo nas ni gnas pa chen po phun sum tshogs pa brnyes so //
translated: By means of the pure faculties, he attains the perfect sovereignty of great stability.

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i sgo nas ni reg na bde ba'i mal stan phun sum tshogs pa brnyes so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i sgo nas ni reg na bde ba'i mal stan phun sum tshogs pa brnyes so //
translated: By means of the abandonment of the afflictions, he attains the perfect sovereignty of a bed and seat that are pleasant to touch.

analyzed: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa'i sgo nas ni gnas dang mal stan la gnas pa mchog tu gnod pa med cing bde bar gnas pa phun sum tshogs pa brnyes so //
translated: By means of abiding in happiness in this life, he attains the perfect sovereignty of abiding in a place and on a bed and seat that are supremely free from harm and comfortable.

original: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i sgo nas ni sems can thams cad kyi don sgrub pa'i rtse zhing dga' ba phun sum tshogs pa brnyes so //

translated: By means of the doors of meditative concentration, liberation, meditative absorption, and attainment, he has attained the perfection of the delight of the field of activity that accomplishes the aims of all sentient beings.

original: ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge'i tshogs la ci 'dod pa thob pa'i sgo nas ni gzhan dag la chos kyi dbang phyug gi bgo bsha' bya ba phun sum tshogs pa @232a * //

analyzed: brnyes te / 'di ni de'i gnas drug bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa la brten nas phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa drug brnyes pa zhes bya'o //

original: 'di lta ste /

translated: They are as follows:

original: bdag gi bdag gis rang bzhin gang yin zhes bya ba dang / ci bdag gi bdag rtag gam mi rtag gam zhes bya ba dang / ji ltar ni rtag ji ltar ni mi rtag ces bya ba dang / bdag gi bdag gang na gnas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gi bdag gis rang bzhin gang yin zhes bya ba dang / ci bdag gi bdag rtag gam mi rtag gam zhes bya ba dang / ji ltar ni rtag ji ltar ni mi rtag ces bya ba dang / bdag gi bdag gang na gnas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Where does the self of the self reside?

original: de yang mdor bsdu na bdag gi rnam pa bzhi yongs su tshol ba ste /
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na bdag gi rnam pa bzhi yongs su tshol ba ste /
translated: In brief, the four aspects of the self are sought:

original: rang bzhin dang / tshul dang / rgyu dang / gnas yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang / tshul dang / rgyu dang / gnas yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: its nature, its mode, its cause, and its location.

original: de la rnam pa gsum gyis ni 'du byed rnams gdags su rung ste /
analyzed: de la rnam pa gsum gyis ni 'du byed rnams gdags su rung ste /
translated: Among these, the first three aspects are suitable to be designated as formations.

original: gdags pa de yang phyin ci ma log pa yin no //
analyzed: gdags pa de yang phyin ci ma log pa yin no //
translated: And that designation is not erroneous.

original: rnam pa gcig gis ni gdags su ye mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig gis ni gdags su ye mi rung ngo //
translated: The fourth aspect is not suitable to be designated at all.

original: de la bdag gi rang bzhin gdags pa ni skye mched bcu gnyis las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa rnam pa drug tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa rnams dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: de la bdag gi rang bzhin gdags pa ni skye mched bcu gnyis las byung ba'i rnam par shes pa rnam pa drug tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa rnams dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The designation of the nature of the self is the six types of consciousness that arise from the twelve sense bases, along with feeling, perception, and volition.

original: de las gud na med do //
analyzed: de las gud na med do //
translated: It is not separate from those.

original: bdag de ni mi rtag ste skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag de ni mi rtag ste skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: That self is impermanent, because of birth, aging, and death.

original: 'du byed de rnams kyang gang gi phyir 'gro ba rnams su lus mngon par 'grub pa yongs su ma grub pas na sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'du byed de rnams kyang gang gi phyir 'gro ba rnams su lus mngon par 'grub pa yongs su ma grub pas na sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: Those formations are like an illusion, because of the non-establishment of the body in the various destinies.

original: 'du shes dang sems dang lta ba phyin ci log ste /
analyzed: 'du shes dang sems dang lta ba phyin ci log ste /
translated: Perception, thought, and view are inverted,

original: rmongs par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: rmongs par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pas na /
translated: because of the nature of delusion.

original: smig rgyu lta bu'i chos can no //
analyzed: smig rgyu lta bu'i chos can no //
translated: The nature of phenomena is like a mirage.

original: skye ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can yin pas na 'ong ba dang 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can yin pas na 'ong ba dang 'gro ba'o //
translated: Because of the nature of arising and destruction, there is coming and going.

original: skad cig pa yin pas na re zhig pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig pa yin pas na re zhig pa'o //
translated: Because of being momentary, there is a short time.

original: zhig go cog ni myur du de las gzhan du mtshams sbyor bas gnas pa yun thung ba'o //
analyzed: zhig go cog ni myur du de las gzhan du mtshams sbyor bas gnas pa yun thung ba'o //
translated: Because of quickly connecting with something else after destruction, there is a short duration.

original: gang nas kyang mi 'ong la gang du yang mi 'gro bas na med pa las 'byung ba dang / yod pa las phyir 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: gang nas kyang mi 'ong la gang du yang mi 'gro bas na med pa las 'byung ba dang / yod pa las phyir 'gro ba'o //
translated: Because of not coming from anywhere and not going anywhere, there is arising from non-existence and going back to existence.

original: de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa 'di rnams kyis skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud ba'i mi rtag pa nyid dang rgyu dang bcas pa dang / skad cig pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i mi rtag pa nyid dang rgyu dang bcas pa bstan te /
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa 'di rnams kyis skye ba gcig nas gcig tu brgyud ba'i mi rtag pa nyid dang rgyu dang bcas pa dang / skad cig pa gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i mi rtag pa nyid dang rgyu dang bcas pa bstan te /
translated: In brief, these aspects indicate the impermanence of the continuum of lives, along with its cause, and the impermanence of the continuum of instants, along with its cause.

original: de ltar @232b na rnam pa gsum po 'di dag gis ni bdag gis rang bzhin dang / tshul dang rgyu tshul bzhin du gdags par byas pa yin no /
analyzed: de ltar @232b na rnam pa gsum po 'di dag gis ni bdag gis rang bzhin dang / tshul dang rgyu tshul bzhin du gdags par byas pa yin no /
translated: Thus, through these three aspects, the self is imputed in a manner that accords with the nature, the mode, and the cause.

original: 'du byed rnams la bdag gis gnas gdags su ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams la bdag gis gnas gdags su ni mi rung ste /
translated: The self is not suitable to be imputed in relation to the formations.

original: de las gzhan pa'i 'du byed pa med pa dang / des na bdag gi don gzhan du gyur pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i 'du byed pa med pa dang / des na bdag gi don gzhan du gyur pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there are no formations other than that, and because the self is not a different object than that.

original: de bas na 'du byed rnams ni kun rdzob tu yang stong pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na 'du byed rnams ni kun rdzob tu yang stong pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the formations are empty even conventionally.

original: gdags su mi rung na don dam par lta ci smos te /
analyzed: gdags su mi rung na don dam par lta ci smos te /
translated: If they are not suitable to be imputed, then what need is there to mention their being ultimately real?

original: de bas na gcig tu nges par stong pa rnams la stong ngo snyam pa kho nar sems la tshul bzhin du thos pa brda sprad pa dang / bsams pas 'dzin du gzhug pa dang / bsgoms pas nges par rtog tu gzhug pas go rims bzhin du mgu bar bya zhing yang dag par mgu bar bya ste yongs su mgu bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gcig tu nges par stong pa rnams la stong ngo snyam pa kho nar sems la tshul bzhin du thos pa brda sprad pa dang / bsams pas 'dzin du gzhug pa dang / bsgoms pas nges par rtog tu gzhug pas go rims bzhin du mgu bar bya zhing yang dag par mgu bar bya ste yongs su mgu bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should please, truly please, and fully please those who are certain to be empty by thinking, ‚ÄúThey are empty,‚Äù in accordance with the sequence of hearing, reflecting, and meditating.üîΩThe summary:

original: sdom ni / 'dod chags shas ni che ba dang / gdams ngag dang ni sdug bsngal gnas //
analyzed: sdom ni / 'dod chags shas ni che ba dang / gdams ngag dang ni sdug bsngal gnas //
translated: Great desire, instruction, suffering,

original: dpyod pa dang ni nga rgyal med //
analyzed: dpyod pa dang ni nga rgyal med //
translated: analysis, absence of pride,üîΩunworthy of worship,üîΩknowledge, liberation, meditation,üîΩproclaiming selflessness,üîΩequipoise, seeing the Dharma,

original: bkur sti bya ba'i 'os min dang // rig pa rnam grol bsgom pa dang // bdag med par ni smra ba dang // mnyam par gzhag dang chos mthong dang // sdug bsngal ba ni tha ma yin //
analyzed: bkur sti bya ba'i 'os min dang // rig pa rnam grol bsgom pa dang // bdag med par ni smra ba dang // mnyam par gzhag dang chos mthong dang // sdug bsngal ba ni tha ma yin //
translated: and suffering are the last.

original: gang zag ni rgyu gsum gyis 'dod chags chen pos yul la kun du spyod de /
analyzed: gang zag ni rgyu gsum gyis 'dod chags chen pos yul la kun du spyod de /
translated: A person engages in objects with great desire for three reasons.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: nyams stobs dang ldan pa yin te nyam chung ba ma yin pa dang / byad bzang ba yin te byad ngan pa ma yin pa dang / 'dod chags kun du bsten pa yin te /
analyzed: nyams stobs dang ldan pa yin te nyam chung ba ma yin pa dang / byad bzang ba yin te byad ngan pa ma yin pa dang / 'dod chags kun du bsten pa yin te /
translated: He is handsome, not ugly.

original: 'dod chags btang snyoms su byas pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags btang snyoms su byas pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: He is devoted to desire, not indifferent to desire.

original: de ltar gang zag 'dod chags shas chen po yang gnyen po gsum gyis yongs su zin na ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la tshangs par spyod cing gnas pas sems dul zhing rnam par zhi bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar gang zag 'dod chags shas chen po yang gnyen po gsum gyis yongs su zin na ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la tshangs par spyod cing gnas pas sems dul zhing rnam par zhi bar 'gyur na /
translated: Thus, if a person with strong desire is also supported by the three remedies, then he will live and practice the holy life in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya, and his mind will be tamed and peaceful.

original: 'dod chags chung ngu dang 'bring ngam nyon mongs pa'i shas chung ba lta ci smos /
analyzed: 'dod chags chung ngu dang 'bring ngam nyon mongs pa'i shas chung ba lta ci smos /
translated: What need is there to mention those with little or middling desire or those with little defilement?

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa la brten nas 'dod pa'i bsod nams kyi mtha' rnam par spong ba dang / kha zas kyi tshod zin pa dang srod dang tho rangs la mi nyal ba la brten nas bdag nyid ngal bar byed pa'i mtha' rnam par spong ba dang /
analyzed: dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa la brten nas 'dod pa'i bsod nams kyi mtha' rnam par spong ba dang / kha zas kyi tshod zin pa dang srod dang tho rangs la mi nyal ba la brten nas bdag nyid ngal bar byed pa'i mtha' rnam par spong ba dang /
translated: On the basis of eating in moderation and not sleeping in the first and last watches of the night, one abandons the extreme of self mortification.

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin dam pa la brten nas dbu ma'i lam gyis nges par @233a * //
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin dam pa la brten nas dbu ma'i lam gyis nges par @233a * //
translated: On the basis of perfect mindfulness and introspection, one definitely attains the middle way.üîΩThe four establishments of mindfulness are:

original: 'gyur ba'o // de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la sems shin tu gnas pa ni rgyu zhing 'gro ba na yul mngon sum du gyur pa'i mtshan ma dang rtags nye bar bzung ba'i tshe tshor ba skye ba dang / gnas pa dang /üîΩ'gag pa yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa gang yin pa'am /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'o // de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi la sems shin tu gnas pa ni rgyu zhing 'gro ba na yul mngon sum du gyur pa'i mtshan ma dang rtags nye bar bzung ba'i tshe tshor ba skye ba dang / gnas pa dang /üîΩ'gag pa yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa gang yin pa'am /
translated: When one travels and sees an object, one correctly realizes the arising, abiding, and cessation of feeling that arises from the signs and indications of the object.

original: mtshan ma dang rtags nye bar bzung bas 'du shes rnams skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gag pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa gang yin pa dang / de'i rgyus gnas na 'dug pa'i rtog pa skye ba dang / gnas pa dang /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang rtags nye bar bzung bas 'du shes rnams skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gag pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa gang yin pa dang / de'i rgyus gnas na 'dug pa'i rtog pa skye ba dang / gnas pa dang /
translated: It is the perfect realization of the arising, abiding, and ceasing of thoughts that occur when one is resting due to the cause of those perceptions.

original: 'gag pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa de lta bu'i dran pa dang shes bzhin gyi dus thams cad dang rnam pa thams cad du yul las sems kun du srung bar byed pa 'di ni dran pa dang / shes bzhin dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'gag pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa de lta bu'i dran pa dang shes bzhin gyi dus thams cad dang rnam pa thams cad du yul las sems kun du srung bar byed pa 'di ni dran pa dang / shes bzhin dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is what is called the highest mindfulness and alertness.

original: gzhan yang dran pa dang shes bzhin dam pa ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa dang / mtshan ma med pa thob pa dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa thob pas 'phags pa dang / lha'i gnas la brten nas dran pa dang shes bzhin dam pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang dran pa dang shes bzhin dam pa ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa dang / mtshan ma med pa thob pa dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa thob pas 'phags pa dang / lha'i gnas la brten nas dran pa dang shes bzhin dam pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the highest mindfulness and alertness is to be known as the highest mindfulness and alertness that is attained by means of the attainment of the meditative absorption of cessation, the attainment of the signless, the attainment of the absence of thought and discernment, and the attainment of the abode of the noble ones and the gods.

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin dam pa'i gnas de las ches 'das pa gung na med do //
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin dam pa'i gnas de las ches 'das pa gung na med do //
translated: There is no higher state than this, which is the highest state of mindfulness and vigilance.

original: de la 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang ba'i tshe dang / langs te gnas pa dang / snyoms par gzhug pa'i tshor ba rnams skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gag pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa ni dran pa dang shes bzhin dam pa yin no //
analyzed: de la 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang ba'i tshe dang / langs te gnas pa dang / snyoms par gzhug pa'i tshor ba rnams skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gag pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa ni dran pa dang shes bzhin dam pa yin no //
translated: Here, the highest mindfulness and vigilance is the correct understanding of the arising, enduring, and perishing of the feelings that occur when one rises from the attainment of cessation, when one abides having risen, and when one enters the attainment.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshor ba rnams ji lta ba bzhin du mtshan ma med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'du shes rnams dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i rtog pa rnams de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshor ba rnams ji lta ba bzhin du mtshan ma med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i 'du shes rnams dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i rtog pa rnams de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as with the feelings in the attainment of cessation, so it is with the perceptions in the attainment of the signless and with the discursive thoughts in the attainment of the absence of discursive thought and the absence of inspection.

original: de la chos tsam 'dzin pas na dran pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la chos tsam 'dzin pas na dran pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Here, it is called mindfulness because it holds just the dharma.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / rtog pa rnams la bdag gam bdag gir rtog pa med do //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / rtog pa rnams la bdag gam bdag gir rtog pa med do //
translated: It does not conceive of the feelings, perceptions, and discursive thoughts as a self or as belonging to a self.

original: byis pa ni tshor ba'i rig pa dang 'du shes dang / rtog pa skye ba na yang /
analyzed: byis pa ni tshor ba'i rig pa dang 'du shes dang / rtog pa skye ba na yang /
translated: When a fool experiences a feeling, a perception, or a thought,

original: byis pa ni tshor ba la sogs pa'i chos de dag la chos tsam du 'du shes par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: byis pa ni tshor ba la sogs pa'i chos de dag la chos tsam du 'du shes par mi 'gyur te /
translated: he does not perceive those dharmas as mere dharmas.

original: de ni 'di ltar bdag gis tshor ro snyam du 'dzin par zad de rgyas par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar bdag gis tshor ro snyam du 'dzin par zad de rgyas par sbyar ro //
translated: He thinks, ‚ÄúI feel,‚Äù and so on, as before.

original: de bas na de'i @233b de ni dran pa dang shes bzhin par yang mi 'gyur na dam par lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: de bas na de'i @233b de ni dran pa dang shes bzhin par yang mi 'gyur na dam par lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, he does not have mindfulness and introspection, much less the highest.

original: de la dran pa dang shes pa bzhin dam pa phyi ma shos ni phyir mi 'ong ba'am dgra bcom pa'i yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la dran pa dang shes pa bzhin dam pa phyi ma shos ni phyir mi 'ong ba'am dgra bcom pa'i yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The highest mindfulness and introspection should be understood as belonging to the non-returner and arhat.

original: snga ma shos ni yid la byed pa thob pa'i so so'i skye bo bag med pa yan lag cig phyir 'ong ba man chad kyi'o //
analyzed: snga ma shos ni yid la byed pa thob pa'i so so'i skye bo bag med pa yan lag cig phyir 'ong ba man chad kyi'o //
translated: The lower mindfulness and introspection belong to the ordinary person who has attained attention, the careless one, the once-returner, and so on.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rgyu gnyis kyis nyid kyi sku bgres pa dang / bsnyel ba brjod pa'i sgo nas lang tsho'i rgya gas pas myos shing bag med par gnas pa rnams skyo ba bskyed pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus na dge slong 'khogs shing rgas pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rgyu gnyis kyis nyid kyi sku bgres pa dang / bsnyel ba brjod pa'i sgo nas lang tsho'i rgya gas pas myos shing bag med par gnas pa rnams skyo ba bskyed pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus na dge slong 'khogs shing rgas pa dang /
translated: The TathƒÅgata, for two reasons, causes the bhik·π£us to teach the Dharma to others, in order to generate disgust in those who are intoxicated and heedless with the bursting of the bubble of youthfulness by means of his own aged body and his forgetfulness.

original: mthu med pa 'byung ba gang yin pa de dag kyang yid la gcags pa med par dge slong gsar bu rnams la 'chol bar 'gyur ba dang / dge slong gsar bu rnams kyang yid la gcags pa med pa dang / bag tsha ba med par gzhan dag la chos ston par 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir nyan thos rnams gzhan dag la chos ston par yang dag par 'dzud pa mdzad do //
analyzed: mthu med pa 'byung ba gang yin pa de dag kyang yid la gcags pa med par dge slong gsar bu rnams la 'chol bar 'gyur ba dang / dge slong gsar bu rnams kyang yid la gcags pa med pa dang / bag tsha ba med par gzhan dag la chos ston par 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir nyan thos rnams gzhan dag la chos ston par yang dag par 'dzud pa mdzad do //
translated: And in order that the young bhik·π£us will not be heedless and will teach the Dharma to others without hesitation, when in the future there will be aged and decrepit bhik·π£us who are powerless.

original: 'dus shing 'khod pa rnams kyi chos kyi gtam ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dus shing 'khod pa rnams kyi chos kyi gtam ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: The Dharma talk of those who are assembled and seated should be understood as being of two kinds.

original: rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa'i gtam dang / bstan pa'i gtam mo //
analyzed: rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa'i gtam dang / bstan pa'i gtam mo //
translated: the discourse on ascertainment and the discourse on teaching.

original: de la rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa'i gtam 'dri ba'i tshul gyis the tshom bsal ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par gtan la 'bebs pa'i gtam 'dri ba'i tshul gyis the tshom bsal ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: The discourse on ascertainment is the removal of doubts by way of asking questions.

original: bstan pa'i gtam ni chos nyan pa mi smra bar 'khod pa rnams la chos ston pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa'i gtam ni chos nyan pa mi smra bar 'khod pa rnams la chos ston pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The discourse on teaching is the teaching of the Dharma to those who listen to the Dharma but do not speak.

original: gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa ni rnam pa bzhis mthun par byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa ni rnam pa bzhis mthun par byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Instruction and counsel are called ‚Äúharmonious‚Äù because of four aspects.

original: skye mched kyi bye brag gis 'du byed rnams la bdag med par shes pa'i lta ba rnam par dag pa dang / gnas dang bcas pa'i tshor ba 'gag pa la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med cing zhi ba nyid du lta ba rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: skye mched kyi bye brag gis 'du byed rnams la bdag med par shes pa'i lta ba rnam par dag pa dang / gnas dang bcas pa'i tshor ba 'gag pa la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med cing zhi ba nyid du lta ba rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: The pure view is the knowledge of the selflessness of compounded things by way of the distinctions of the sense spheres. The pure view is the absence of pride and the peacefulness of the cessation of feeling together with its basis.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba'i lta ba rnam pa dag pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba'i lta ba rnam par dag pa'o //üîΩde la nang dang phyi rol gyi skye mched dang / rnam par shes pa dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / sred pa'i tshogs kyi bye brag gis bdag med par yang dag par mthong bas ni rten cing 'brel par @234a * //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba'i lta ba rnam pa dag pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba'i lta ba rnam par dag pa'o // de la nang dang phyi rol gyi skye mched dang / rnam par shes pa dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / sems pa dang / sred pa'i tshogs kyi bye brag gis bdag med par yang dag par mthong bas ni rten cing 'brel par @234a * //
translated: The pure view of the transcendence of future suffering, and the pure view of the transcendence of present suffering.

original: 'byung ba'i tshul gyis lta ba rnam par dag pa dang po skyed par byed do //üîΩmar me la brten pa'i 'od dam /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i tshul gyis lta ba rnam par dag pa dang po skyed par byed do // mar me la brten pa'i 'od dam /
translated: Therein, by seeing the selflessness of the internal and external sense-spheres, consciousness, contact, feeling, perception, volition, and craving, one generates the first pure view through the principle of dependent origination.

original: shing la brten pa'i grib ma med na /
analyzed: shing la brten pa'i grib ma med na /
translated: The light that is dependent on a lamp, or the shadow that is dependent on a tree, do not exist.

original: de yang med pa bzhin du nang dang / phyi rol gyi skye mched kyi rgyu las byung ba'i tshor ba rnams skye mched rnams ma lus par 'gags na de dag kyang 'gag par yang dag par mthong bas ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la zhi bar lta ba rnam par dagüîΩpa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de yang med pa bzhin du nang dang / phyi rol gyi skye mched kyi rgyu las byung ba'i tshor ba rnams skye mched rnams ma lus par 'gags na de dag kyang 'gag par yang dag par mthong bas ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la zhi bar lta ba rnam par dag pa skyed par byed do //
translated: Thus, he generates the pure view of nirvƒÅ·πáa as peace, free of the pride of self-existence.üîΩHe sees that in this life, by means of the sword of wisdom, all afflictions are abandoned.üîΩThus, he generates the pure view of completely transcending all suffering in future lives.

original: tshe 'di la shes rab kyi mtshon gyis nyon mongs pa thams cad spong bar yang dag pa mthong bas ni tshe phyi ma'i sdug bsngal ma lus pa las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba'i lta ba rnam par dag pa skyed par byed do //üîΩbde ba'am / sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: tshe 'di la shes rab kyi mtshon gyis nyon mongs pa thams cad spong bar yang dag pa mthong bas ni tshe phyi ma'i sdug bsngal ma lus pa las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba'i lta ba rnam par dag pa skyed par byed do // bde ba'am / sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: He sees that all things are neither happy nor miserable,üîΩnor are they both happy and miserable,

original: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin /
translated: nor are they neither happy nor miserable.

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas kyi chos rnams la kun du chags pa med pa dang / kun du zhe sdang ba med pa dang / kun du gti mug ba med par yang dag par mthong ba dang / mthong ba'i lam la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i sems shin tu gnas par yang dag par mthong ba dang /
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i gnas kyi chos rnams la kun du chags pa med pa dang / kun du zhe sdang ba med pa dang / kun du gti mug ba med par yang dag par mthong ba dang / mthong ba'i lam la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i sems shin tu gnas par yang dag par mthong ba dang /
translated: He sees that the mind is well-established in the applications of mindfulness on the path of seeing.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa yang dag par mthong ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la byang chub kyi yan lag bsgom pa yang dag par mthong ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: He sees that the factors of awakening are cultivated on the path of cultivation.

original: zag pa zad par bya ba dang / tshe 'di la kun nas nyon mongs pa can dang / sdug bsngal bar gnas pa las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba'i lta ba rnam par dag pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: zag pa zad par bya ba dang / tshe 'di la kun nas nyon mongs pa can dang / sdug bsngal bar gnas pa las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba'i lta ba rnam par dag pa skyed par byed do //
translated: He generates the pure view that is directed toward the exhaustion of the contaminants, and that is directed toward transcending the afflicted states and the suffering that are present in this life.

original: dge slong dbang po rnams ma bsdams par gnas pa ni yul rnams la kun du chags pa'i sems dang / rnam par g-yengs pa'i sems su 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong dbang po rnams ma bsdams par gnas pa ni yul rnams la kun du chags pa'i sems dang / rnam par g-yengs pa'i sems su 'gyur te /
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, when the faculties are not restrained, the mind becomes attached to objects and distracted.

original: gnas ngan len las gyur pa dang / chos la the tshom za ba las gyur pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas ngan len las gyur pa dang / chos la the tshom za ba las gyur pa'i sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He experiences the two kinds of suffering, that which arises from the corruption of morality and that which arises from doubt about the Dharma.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar de ni lus bsgom pa gang la brten na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar de ni lus bsgom pa gang la brten na /
translated: Why is this?

original: zhi gnas kyi yan lag gi tshul khrims bsgom par 'gyur ba'i lus bsgom pa la brtson par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi yan lag gi tshul khrims bsgom par 'gyur ba'i lus bsgom pa la brtson par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not strive to cultivate the body in such a way that he would cultivate morality, which is a factor of serenity.

original: zhi gnas kyi yan lag gi tshul khrims ma bsgom pa'i rgyus ni lus dang / sems shin tu sbyangs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi yan lag gi tshul khrims ma bsgom pa'i rgyus ni lus dang / sems shin tu sbyangs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because he does not cultivate morality, which is a factor of serenity, he does not have physical and mental pliancy.

original: des na gnas ngan len gyi sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gnas ngan len gyi sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, he experiences the suffering of corruption.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa med na ni gang gis yang dag pa ji lta @234b ba bzhin du shes par 'gyur ba'i ting nge 'dzin la yang reg par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa med na ni gang gis yang dag pa ji lta @234b ba bzhin du shes par 'gyur ba'i ting nge 'dzin la yang reg par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And because he does not have pliancy, he does not touch concentration, by means of which he would know reality as it is.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma shes na ni som nyi can dang / the tshom can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma shes na ni som nyi can dang / the tshom can du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not know them as they really are, one is doubtful and uncertain.

original: de sdug bsngal bar gnas pa 'di gnyis kyis dbang po ma bsdams pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba dang bde ba med par gnas pa 'di ni tshe 'di la dbang po ma bsdams pa'i nyes dmigs yin no //
analyzed: de sdug bsngal bar gnas pa 'di gnyis kyis dbang po ma bsdams pa'i phyir sdug bsngal ba dang bde ba med par gnas pa 'di ni tshe 'di la dbang po ma bsdams pa'i nyes dmigs yin no //
translated: Because of these two kinds of suffering, and because of the lack of control over the faculties, one lives in suffering and without happiness. This is the disadvantage of not controlling the faculties in this life.

original: de las bzlog pa ni phan yon yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni phan yon yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of this is the benefit.

original: dge slong 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir brtson to //
analyzed: dge slong 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir brtson to //
translated: The monk strives to be free from the desire realm.

original: yang dag pa'i sbyor ba'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa bkag pa ni ci bdag 'dod pa rnams la 'dod pa'i 'dun pa yod bzhin du ma tshor ram /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i sbyor ba'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa bkag pa ni ci bdag 'dod pa rnams la 'dod pa'i 'dun pa yod bzhin du ma tshor ram /
translated: By the path of right practice, he stops the afflictions. He thinks, ‚ÄúDo I have desire for the desire realm while not perceiving it?

original: 'on te med pa yin snyam ste /
analyzed: 'on te med pa yin snyam ste /
translated: Or do I not have it?

original: spangs sam / ma spangs sam /
analyzed: spangs sam / ma spangs sam /
translated: Have I abandoned it or not?

original: sdug pa'i mtshan ma yid la byed pas nges par byed cing dpyod pa yid la byed pa la brten nas rtogs par 'dod pa las nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i kun du rtog pa nyon mongs pa'i gzhi dang gnas su gyur pa rnams skye bar
analyzed: sdug pa'i mtshan ma yid la byed pas nges par byed cing dpyod pa yid la byed pa la brten nas rtogs par 'dod pa las nyon mongs pa ma spangs pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i kun du rtog pa nyon mongs pa'i gzhi dang gnas su gyur pa rnams skye bar
translated: Because they have not abandoned the afflictions, they generate the conceptual thoughts of the desire realm, which are the basis and abode of the afflictions.

original: 'gyur te / de dag gis 'phrog pa ltar na 'di dag ni nyams par 'gyur bar byed pa yin no snyam du rig nas gtod par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'gyur te / de dag gis 'phrog pa ltar na 'di dag ni nyams par 'gyur bar byed pa yin no snyam du rig nas gtod par mi byed do //
translated: Knowing that they are like thieves who cause one to lose the meditative absorption, they do not entrust themselves to it.

original: gal te gtad par gyur na ni ting nge 'dzin tsam zhig thob pa de las kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur na khyad par du 'gro bar lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te gtad par gyur na ni ting nge 'dzin tsam zhig thob pa de las kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur na khyad par du 'gro bar lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: If they did entrust themselves to it, they would lose even the mere meditative absorption that they have attained, let alone make progress.

original: gtad na ni nyams par yang mi 'gyur la khyad par du yang 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtad na ni nyams par yang mi 'gyur la khyad par du yang 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if they do entrust themselves to it, they will not lose it and will make progress.

original: gal te brtag pa yang ma byas na ni de ltar na yang mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bcas pa'i phyir nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te brtag pa yang ma byas na ni de ltar na yang mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang bcas pa'i phyir nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they do not investigate it, they will lose it because they have overestimated their meditative absorption.

original: gang gi phyir brtag pa byas na nges par rtogs par yang 'gyur la sems 'phrog cing 'dus pa yang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir brtag pa byas na nges par rtogs par yang 'gyur la sems 'phrog cing 'dus pa yang /
translated: Because, when one examines, one will certainly understand and the mind will be captivated and concentrated.

original: yang dag par yongs su shes nas gtod par byed de de bas na yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag par yongs su shes nas gtod par byed de de bas na yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Having understood correctly, one will be able to teach without backsliding.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir brtson pa ji lta ba bzhin du gong ma yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir brtson pa ji lta ba bzhin du gong ma yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: As with the effort to become free from attachment to the realm of desire, so it is with the higher realms.

original: gal te lta ba drag pos ji ltar brtags kyang 'dod pa kun du rtog pa rnams mi skye na ni des gang la dmigs na nyon mongs pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i skye mched de zil gyis non to snyam du nges par thob par 'gyur ro //üîΩdes skye mched de zil gyis non pas na slob pa'i sa las yang @235a * //
analyzed: gal te lta ba drag pos ji ltar brtags kyang 'dod pa kun du rtog pa rnams mi skye na ni des gang la dmigs na nyon mongs pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i skye mched de zil gyis non to snyam du nges par thob par 'gyur ro // des skye mched de zil gyis non pas na slob pa'i sa las yang @235a * //
translated: If, by the power of insight, the conceptualizations of the realm of desire do not arise, one will be certain that one has overcome the perceptual range in which the afflictions can arise.

original: dag par 'das nas /
analyzed: dag par 'das nas /
translated: Since one has overcome that perceptual range, one will have truly transcended the stage of training.

original: rang gi sems la dbang yod pas na rgyal po lta bu'o //
analyzed: rang gi sems la dbang yod pas na rgyal po lta bu'o //
translated: Since one has power over one‚Äôs own mind, one is like a king.

original: bdud thams cad la rnam par rgyal bas na g-yul las rnam par rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: bdud thams cad la rnam par rgyal bas na g-yul las rnam par rgyal ba'o //
translated: He is the Victor in battle because he is victorious over all demons.

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes kyis ni tshangs par spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa thob par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes kyis ni tshangs par spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa thob par 'gyur ro ;
translated: By means of the knowledge of extinction and non-production, he attains the perfection of pure conduct.

original: / dbang po drug po rnams snga ma bzhin du rnam par zhi ba rnam pa lngas rnam par ma zhi ba'i sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum yongs su 'dzin pa'i 'bras bu can du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: / dbang po drug po rnams snga ma bzhin du rnam par zhi ba rnam pa lngas rnam par ma zhi ba'i sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum yongs su 'dzin pa'i 'bras bu can du rig par bya'o //
translated: The six sense faculties, as before, should be known as having the result of grasping the three kinds of suffering that are not pacified by the five kinds of non-pacification.

original: tshe 'di la dbang po'i dbang las byung ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gnas pa dang / de bzhin du mi dge ba kun du spyod pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i gzhan gyis nyams par byas pa'am /
analyzed: tshe 'di la dbang po'i dbang las byung ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gnas pa dang / de bzhin du mi dge ba kun du spyod pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i gzhan gyis nyams par byas pa'am /
translated: In this life, there is the afflicted abiding due to the power of the sense faculties, and likewise, the destruction by others that arises from the cause of engaging in non-virtue,

original: smad pa'am / gsad pa'am /
analyzed: smad pa'am / gsad pa'am /
translated: whether it is disparagement, killing,

original: bcing ba'am / de la sogs pa tshe 'di'i sdug bsngal dang / tshe phyi ma'i skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba'i sdug bsngal dang / tshe phyi ma'i sngon bsgoms pa las byung ba'i rgyu dang mthun pa'i dbang po ma bsdams pa ste /
analyzed: bcing ba'am / de la sogs pa tshe 'di'i sdug bsngal dang / tshe phyi ma'i skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba'i sdug bsngal dang / tshe phyi ma'i sngon bsgoms pa las byung ba'i rgyu dang mthun pa'i dbang po ma bsdams pa ste /
translated: or bound by them, and so on.üîΩThe suffering of this life is suffering of the present life. The suffering of future lives is the suffering of birth, old age, sickness, and death. The suffering of future lives is also the suffering of the faculty of life that is not restrained, which is the result of the cause that is the non-restraint of the faculties.

original: de yang kun nas nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yin no //
analyzed: de yang kun nas nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yin no //
translated: This is suffering because it is defiled.

original: de las bzlog pa ni rnam pa lngas dbang po rnams rnam par zhi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni rnam pa lngas dbang po rnams rnam par zhi bar 'gyur te /
translated: The faculties are calmed in five ways that are the opposite of those.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum med par gyur pa'i 'bras bu can yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum med par gyur pa'i 'bras bu can yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this is the result of the absence of the three kinds of suffering.

original: 'di gnyis ni kun rdzob kyi bram ze yon gnas kyi mngon pa'i nga rgyal can yon gnas su khas 'che ba rnams kyi yon gnas ma yin pa'i rtags yin te /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni kun rdzob kyi bram ze yon gnas kyi mngon pa'i nga rgyal can yon gnas su khas 'che ba rnams kyi yon gnas ma yin pa'i rtags yin te /
translated: These two are the signs of those who are not worthy of offerings from those who are proud of being holy men and who claim to be holy men in the conventional sense.

original: de gnyis dang ldan na bkur sti bya ba'i 'os ma yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de gnyis dang ldan na bkur sti bya ba'i 'os ma yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that those who possess these two are not worthy of being honored.

original: gzhan las rnyed pa'am bkur sti byung nas dam por lhag par zhen par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan las rnyed pa'am bkur sti byung nas dam por lhag par zhen par 'gyur la /
translated: Or, if they obtain something from others, or are honored by others, they become attached to that.

original: dbang po rgod par 'gyur ba dang / drod mi thub par snang ba gang yin pa de dag ni 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i spyod pas nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rgod par 'gyur ba dang / drod mi thub par snang ba gang yin pa de dag ni 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba'i spyod pas nye bar gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: Or, if they are restless and unstable, and their minds are not fit for meditation, then they are not living the holy life.

original: khyim dang bu smad kyi tshogs yongs su 'dzin pa'i 'du 'dzi yongs su nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur bas bdag nyid 'tsho bar byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: khyim dang bu smad kyi tshogs yongs su 'dzin pa'i 'du 'dzi yongs su nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur bas bdag nyid 'tsho bar byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Or, if they are distracted by the company of their wives and children, and are defiled by the concerns of family life, then they are not living the holy life.

original: de dag ni de ltar log par zhugs pas bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi spyod pa yang ma yin la tshul khrims dang chos spyod pa yang med /
analyzed: de dag ni de ltar log par zhugs pas bdag dang gzhan gyi don gyi spyod pa yang ma yin la tshul khrims dang chos spyod pa yang med /
translated: Since they are thus wrongly engaged, they are not living the holy life for the sake of either themselves or others. They do not have the morality and spiritual life.

original: mtho ris su 'gro ba'i dge ba spyod pa yang med /
analyzed: mtho ris su 'gro ba'i dge ba spyod pa yang med /
translated: They do not have the virtue that leads to rebirth in the heavens.

original: mya ngan las @235b 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i spyod pa yang med de /
analyzed: mya ngan las @235b 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i spyod pa yang med de /
translated: They do not have the virtue that leads to Nirva·πáa.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad dang yang khyad par med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad dang yang khyad par med par rig par bya'o //
translated: They are not different from all foolish ordinary people.

original: de las bzlog pas ni chos 'di pa rnams don dam pa'i bram ze yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pas ni chos 'di pa rnams don dam pa'i bram ze yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of this is the way in which the followers of this Dharma are true Brahmins.

original: 'di las phyi rol pa'i dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams ni slob ma rnams la chos bstan pa phal cher klan ka tshol ba'i phan yon can dang / gal te 'dzin pa las thar pa'i phan yon can yin te /
analyzed: 'di las phyi rol pa'i dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams ni slob ma rnams la chos bstan pa phal cher klan ka tshol ba'i phan yon can dang / gal te 'dzin pa las thar pa'i phan yon can yin te /
translated: The ascetics and Brahmins who are outside this Dharma teach their disciples a doctrine which is mostly concerned with the advantages of finding fault and with liberation from grasping.

original: de yang yang dag par na don med pa dang phan yon med par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang yang dag par na don med pa dang phan yon med par rig par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood as being, in reality, without purpose and without benefit.

original: bdag la phan par 'gyur ba yang ma yin gzhan la phan par 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag la phan par 'gyur ba yang ma yin gzhan la phan par 'gyur ba yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not for the benefit of oneself, nor for the benefit of others.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni nyan thos rnams la chos bstan pa rig pa dang rnam par grol ba'i 'bras bu'i phan yon can yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni nyan thos rnams la chos bstan pa rig pa dang rnam par grol ba'i 'bras bu'i phan yon can yin te /
translated: The Tathagata teaches the Dharma to his disciples with the benefit of the fruits of knowledge and liberation.

original: 'bras bu che zhing phan yon che la bdag dang gzhan la phan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu che zhing phan yon che la bdag dang gzhan la phan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as having great fruits and great benefits, and as being for the benefit of oneself and others.

original: de la dus gsum du mchog tu kun tu rmongs pa med par gnas pa'i don gyis dmigs pa rnam pa gsum gyi bye brag gis na rig pa gsum la rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la dus gsum du mchog tu kun tu rmongs pa med par gnas pa'i don gyis dmigs pa rnam pa gsum gyi bye brag gis na rig pa gsum la rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The three knowledges are so called because of the three objects, which are the objects of the three knowledges, since they are the objects of the three knowledges that are not at all confused about the three times.

original: de la sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba ni srid pa dang / ma rig pa'i rtsa ba can gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba ni srid pa dang / ma rig pa'i rtsa ba can gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The mind liberation and the wisdom liberation are called liberations because they are the antidotes to the defilements that have the roots of existence and ignorance.

original: rig pa dang rnam par grol ba ma thob pa de thob par bya ba'i phyir ni lam rnam pa bzhi bsgom par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rig pa dang rnam par grol ba ma thob pa de thob par bya ba'i phyir ni lam rnam pa bzhi bsgom par rig par bya ste /
translated: The four paths should be known as the cultivation of the non-attainment of the knowledge and liberation in order to attain it.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the four?

original: dbang po bsgoms pas lus bsgom pa dang / lus bsgoms pas drangs pa'i legs par spyod pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po bsgoms pas lus bsgom pa dang / lus bsgoms pas drangs pa'i legs par spyod pa ste /
translated: The cultivation of the faculties, the cultivation of the body, and the good conduct that is drawn out by the cultivation of the body.

original: tshul khrims bsgom pa gang yin pa dang / tshul khrims bsgoms pas drangs pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag bsgoms pa sems dang / shes rab bsgom pa gang yin pa'o /
analyzed: tshul khrims bsgom pa gang yin pa dang / tshul khrims bsgoms pas drangs pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i byang chub kyi yan lag bsgoms pa sems dang / shes rab bsgom pa gang yin pa'o /
translated: It is the cultivation of morality, the cultivation of the enlightenment factors of mindfulness and concentration that are induced by the cultivation of morality, and the cultivation of wisdom.

original: de la dbang po bsgom pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de la dbang po bsgom pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The cultivation of the faculties is threefold:

original: 'jig rten pa'i dang / slob pa'i dang / mi slob pa'i ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dang / slob pa'i dang / mi slob pa'i ste /
translated: mundane, that of the trainees, and that of the non-trainees.
