translated: If he sees the third, he generates the thought of being pleased and not being pleased.

original: bzhi ba gzigs na ni thugs su mi byon pa dang / thugs su byon pa skye'o //
analyzed: bzhi ba gzigs na ni thugs su mi byon pa dang / thugs su byon pa skye'o //
translated: If he sees the fourth, he generates the thought of not being pleased and being pleased.

original: snga pa gzigs na ni thugs su byon pa yang skye /
analyzed: snga pa gzigs na ni thugs su byon pa yang skye /
translated: If he sees the first, he generates the thought of being pleased.

original: thugs su mi byon pa yang skye /
analyzed: thugs su mi byon pa yang skye /
translated: He also generates the thought of not being pleased.

original: thugs su byon pa dang / thugs su mi byon pa yang skye'o //
analyzed: thugs su byon pa dang / thugs su mi byon pa yang skye'o //
translated: He also generates the thought of being pleased and not being pleased.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni de ltar rnam pa lngar bsgyur ba'i sgo nas thugs su byon pa dang / thugs su mi byon pa skye mod kyi 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba la dbang po bsgoms pas na rjes su chags pa'i rnam pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni de ltar rnam pa lngar bsgyur ba'i sgo nas thugs su byon pa dang / thugs su mi byon pa skye mod kyi 'on kyang de bzhin gshegs pa ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba la dbang po bsgoms pas na rjes su chags pa'i rnam pa dang /
translated: The TathƒÅgata generates the thought of being pleased and not being pleased in these five ways, but since the TathƒÅgata is free of afflictions and their imprints and has cultivated his faculties, he does not generate the thought of being pleased and not being pleased in the way that ordinary beings do.

original: khong khro ba'i rnam pa kun nas nyon mongs pa can du mi 'gyur ba dang / de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / @238a * //
analyzed: khong khro ba'i rnam pa kun nas nyon mongs pa can du mi 'gyur ba dang / de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / @238a * //
translated: Therefore, the TathƒÅgata is one who has abandoned the afflictions together with their traces.

original: de nyid la brten nas dgongs pa legs par gnas pas rnam pa lngar bsgyur ba'i sgo nas nyan thos rnams la kun nas nyon mongs pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir dbang po bsgom pa bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid la brten nas dgongs pa legs par gnas pas rnam pa lngar bsgyur ba'i sgo nas nyan thos rnams la kun nas nyon mongs pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir dbang po bsgom pa bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And because he is well-established in his intention, he is said to have unsurpassed cultivation of the faculties, since the afflictions do not arise for the disciples in any of the five ways.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa ni rnam pa lngar bsgyur ba thams cad du ci rigs par gnyen po rnam pa gsum thugs la dgongs te /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa ni rnam pa lngar bsgyur ba thams cad du ci rigs par gnyen po rnam pa gsum thugs la dgongs te /
translated: In this regard, the TathƒÅgata, in all five ways, has in mind the three kinds of antidotes, as appropriate.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / byams pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i 'du shes dang / byams pa dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: The perception of impermanence, loving-kindness, and the concentration on signlessness.

original: de yang ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: And these should be understood as appropriate.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos don byas pa mi slob pa ni dbang po bsgom pa zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos don byas pa mi slob pa ni dbang po bsgom pa zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The disciples of the Bhagavat who have completed their purpose, who are beyond training, are called ‚Äúthose who cultivate the controlling faculties.‚Äù

original: de ni yun ring po nas mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir snga ma bzhin du sems can nam sems can ma yin pa'i yul gcig tu nges par 'dod pa'am /
analyzed: de ni yun ring po nas mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir snga ma bzhin du sems can nam sems can ma yin pa'i yul gcig tu nges par 'dod pa'am /
translated: Because they have long delighted in nirvana, they do not desire a specific object, either a sentient being or a non-sentient being, as before.

original: gcig tu nges par 'dod pa ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: gcig tu nges par 'dod pa ma yin pa'am /
translated: They do not desire a specific object.üîΩSimilarly, when they encounter a pleasant or unpleasant appearance, because they are free from attachment, aversion, and delusion, they quickly attain liberation of mind and liberation by wisdom.

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i snang ba dang phrad na 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang bral ba'i phyir sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba'i sgo nas myur ba myur bar mtshan ma med pas de las sems lhag par btang snyoms su byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i snang ba dang phrad na 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang bral ba'i phyir sems rnam par grol ba dang / shes rab rnam par grol ba'i sgo nas myur ba myur bar mtshan ma med pas de las sems lhag par btang snyoms su byed de /
translated: They are indifferent to those signs, and their minds are liberated from the afflictions.

original: sems thag pa nas yul la ni mi mthun par 'du shes la mya ngan las 'das pa la ni zhi bar lta'o //
analyzed: sems thag pa nas yul la ni mi mthun par 'du shes la mya ngan las 'das pa la ni zhi bar lta'o //
translated: They perceive objects as disagreeable and they view nirvana as peace.

original: gang de ltar myur du btang snyoms su gnas shing gang skad cig kyang brjed ngas pa las gyur ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sems mi skye ba de tsam gyis na dbang po legs par bsgoms pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang de ltar myur du btang snyoms su gnas shing gang skad cig kyang brjed ngas pa las gyur ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sems mi skye ba de tsam gyis na dbang po legs par bsgoms pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the faculties are well cultivated to the extent that one quickly becomes indifferent and to that extent the afflicted mind does not arise even for a moment due to forgetfulness.

original: slob pa'i rgyud ni nyon mongs pas 'dres pas na myur du btang snyoms su gnas pa ma yin no //üîΩrnam pa gsum du bsgyur ba thams cad du yang nyon mongs pa la sdang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: slob pa'i rgyud ni nyon mongs pas 'dres pas na myur du btang snyoms su gnas pa ma yin no // rnam pa gsum du bsgyur ba thams cad du yang nyon mongs pa la sdang ba'i phyir /
translated: The mindstream of a learner is not quickly indifferent because it is mixed with afflictions.üîΩIn all three transformations, one abides with a mind that is averse to afflictions,

original: nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pas 'dzem zhing mi mthun pa'i 'du shes dang nyes dmigs kyi 'du shes kyis gnas te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pas 'dzem zhing mi mthun pa'i 'du shes dang nyes dmigs kyi 'du shes kyis gnas te /
translated: with a sense of shame and embarrassment due to engaging in afflictions, and with a sense of their disadvantages.

original: de ltar zhugs pa'i dbang po bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar zhugs pa'i dbang po bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: The cultivation of the faculties of one who has entered in this way becomes complete.

original: de bas na yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na yang dag par zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called right practice.

original: de ltar na legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba 'di ni ston pa'i sgo nas kyang mdzes la nyan thos rnams kyis thob par bya ba'i don 'thob pa dang / yang @238b dag par nan tan du sgrub pa'i sgo nas kyang mdzes so //
analyzed: de ltar na legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba 'di ni ston pa'i sgo nas kyang mdzes la nyan thos rnams kyis thob par bya ba'i don 'thob pa dang / yang @238b dag par nan tan du sgrub pa'i sgo nas kyang mdzes so //
translated: Thus, this well-spoken Dharma and Vinaya is also beautiful in terms of the teacher, and it is also beautiful in terms of the attainment of the goal to be attained by the ≈õrƒÅvakas and the practice of correct practice.

original: bdag med par smra ba ston pa'i sgo nas yang dag pa'i las su bya ba gsum byed pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag med par smra ba ston pa'i sgo nas yang dag pa'i las su bya ba gsum byed pa yin te /
translated: The teacher of the doctrine of selflessness performs the three correct actions:

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: sdug bsngal ba dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pas bsdus pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid yang dag par gleng bas bdag med par rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pas bsdus pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid yang dag par gleng bas bdag med par rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: The establishment of selflessness through the correct discussion of the characteristics of conditioned states included in the truths of suffering and origination.

original: de la sna tshogs mang po'i bdag nyid kyis ni rang gi mtshan nyid brtag pa dang / skye ba dang 'jig pa brtag pas ni spyi'i mtshan nyid brtag pa ste /
analyzed: de la sna tshogs mang po'i bdag nyid kyis ni rang gi mtshan nyid brtag pa dang / skye ba dang 'jig pa brtag pas ni spyi'i mtshan nyid brtag pa ste /
translated: Therein, the discussion of the individual characteristics is through the manifold variety of individual characteristics, and the discussion of the general characteristics is through the discussion of arising and destruction.

original: 'di ni yang dag pa'i las su bya ba dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag pa'i las su bya ba dang po'o //
translated: This is the first correct action.

original: gzhan yang bdag ni med la rgyu dang bcas pa'i 'du byed tsam zhig yod pa la ci nas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gleng ba 'di ni yang dag pa'i las su bya ba
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag ni med la rgyu dang bcas pa'i 'du byed tsam zhig yod pa la ci nas kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du gleng ba 'di ni yang dag pa'i las su bya ba
translated: Furthermore, the one who is devoid of self and who has the mere conditioned phenomena that are associated with causes, will, in any case, be afflicted or completely purified.

original: gnyis pa ste /üîΩde la tshor ba rnam pa gsum rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal rnam pa gsum ma spangs te mthong ba'i lam la nga'o snyam pa'i lta ba'i bag la nyal yang dag par ma bcom pa dang bsgom pa'i lam la nga'o snyam
analyzed: gnyis pa ste / de la tshor ba rnam pa gsum rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal rnam pa gsum ma spangs te mthong ba'i lam la nga'o snyam pa'i lta ba'i bag la nyal yang dag par ma bcom pa dang bsgom pa'i lam la nga'o snyam
translated: The second is

original: pa'i nga rgyal gyi bag la nyal yang dag par ma bcom pa dang lta ba dang nga rgyal gyi phyogs dang mthun pa de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i ma rig pa yang ma spangs la de'i gnyen po rig pa yang ma skyes pas na sdug bsngal mthar
analyzed: pa'i nga rgyal gyi bag la nyal yang dag par ma bcom pa dang lta ba dang nga rgyal gyi phyogs dang mthun pa de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i ma rig pa yang ma spangs la de'i gnyen po rig pa yang ma skyes pas na sdug bsngal mthar
translated: In that regard, the three types of feeling arise in dependence and are not abandoned in relation to the three latent states of affliction. The latent state of the view of ‚ÄúI‚Äù is not destroyed on the path of seeing. The latent state of the pride of ‚ÄúI‚Äù is not destroyed on the path of meditation. The ignorance that motivates the factors that are associated with the view of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and pride is not abandoned. Since the knowledge that is the antidote to that is not generated, suffering is not terminated.

original: byed par mi 'gyur ba 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag par mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: byed par mi 'gyur ba 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa yang dag par mthong ba yin no //
translated: This is the correct view of the defilement aspect.

original: de las bzlog pa ni rnam par byang ba yang dag par mthong ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni rnam par byang ba yang dag par mthong ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of this should be understood as the correct view of the purification aspect.

original: gzhan yang 'du byed rnams la bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa'i bdag tu lta ba yang spangs la bden pa 'dzin pa'i bdag med par lta ba la brten nas ji ltar rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba de gleng bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'du byed rnams la bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa'i bdag tu lta ba yang spangs la bden pa 'dzin pa'i bdag med par lta ba la brten nas ji ltar rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba de gleng bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the view of self that superimposes a self on the formations should be abandoned, and it should be discussed how purification occurs based on the view of selflessness that grasps the truth.

original: bdag med par lta ba de yang so so'i skye bor gyur ba kho nas legs par bzung na slob par gyur ba'i bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag med par lta ba de yang so so'i skye bor gyur ba kho nas legs par bzung na slob par gyur ba'i bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When that view of selflessness is well-taken up only by ordinary beings, they will attain the eye of noble wisdom that directly realizes the truths of those in training.

original: de'i gong du mi slob par gyur ba'i zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes kyang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i gong du mi slob par gyur ba'i zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes kyang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Above that, they will also attain the knowledge of exhaustion and non-arising of those beyond training.

original: slob pa dang mi slob pa'i mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ma lus par spong bar 'gyur @239a * //
analyzed: slob pa dang mi slob pa'i mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa ma lus par spong bar 'gyur @239a * //
translated: and the afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing and the path of cultivation are completely abandoned.

original: ro ; / de bas 'di ni bdag med par lta ba de'i rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba gleng ba yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩchos 'di pa 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang ldan pa mang du thos pa mnyam par gzhag pa las ni chos 'di pa 'jig rten pa'i yang dag par lta ba dang ldan pa mang du thos pa mnyam par gzhag pa yang dag pa'i sbyor ba'i
analyzed: ro ; / de bas 'di ni bdag med par lta ba de'i rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba gleng ba yin par rig par bya'o // chos 'di pa 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba dang ldan pa mang du thos pa mnyam par gzhag pa las ni chos 'di pa 'jig rten pa'i yang dag par lta ba dang ldan pa mang du thos pa mnyam par gzhag pa yang dag pa'i sbyor ba'i
translated: Therefore, this should be understood as the statement of the purification of the view of selflessness.

original: 'bras bu'i phan yon rnam pa lngas khyad par du 'phags par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i phan yon rnam pa lngas khyad par du 'phags par rig par bya ste /
translated: The one who possesses the correct view of this life, who is learned, and who is equipoised, is superior to the one who possesses the correct view of this life, who is learned, and who is equipoised, by five aspects of benefit that are the fruits of correct practice.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: chos 'di pa snga ma shos ni thog ma kho nar sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i phyir zhi gnas kyi yan lag gi tshul khrims yongs su ma dag cing yongs su ma byang ba yin la cig shos sems mnyam par bzhag pa ni yongs su dag cing yongsüîΩsu byang ste /
analyzed: chos 'di pa snga ma shos ni thog ma kho nar sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i phyir zhi gnas kyi yan lag gi tshul khrims yongs su ma dag cing yongs su ma byang ba yin la cig shos sems mnyam par bzhag pa ni yongs su dag cing yongs su byang ste /
translated: The former practitioner of this Dharma does not have completely pure and completely purified morality that is a branch of serenity because he has not first of all settled his mind in meditative equipoise. The latter practitioner, who has settled his mind in meditative equipoise, has completely pure and completely purified morality.

original: 'di ni yang dag pa'i sbyor ba'i 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi khyad par dang po yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni yang dag pa'i sbyor ba'i 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi khyad par dang po yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the first distinction in the benefits that result from right practice.

original: gzhan yang mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gang zag snga ma shos kyis ni tshor brten dang bcas dmigs pa dang bcas grogs dang bcas 'gyur ba dang bcas pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes te /
analyzed: gzhan yang mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gang zag snga ma shos kyis ni tshor brten dang bcas dmigs pa dang bcas grogs dang bcas 'gyur ba dang bcas pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes te /
translated: Moreover, the former practitioner, who has not settled his mind in meditative equipoise, does not know the feelings that are based on the body, the objects that are based on the body, the companions that are based on the body, and the changes that are based on the body, as they really are.

original: mi shes pas ni mi shes pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i nyes dmigs rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: mi shes pas ni mi shes pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i nyes dmigs rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Because of this lack of knowledge, he does not know the three kinds of calamities that arise from the cause of this lack of knowledge.

original: tshor ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las gyur ba dang / dus kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa las gyur pa dang / tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las gyur pas gos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshor ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las gyur ba dang / dus kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa las gyur pa dang / tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las gyur pas gos par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is defiled by the defilement of feeling, by the defilement of time, and by the defilement of this life and the next.

original: de la tshor ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kun du rmongs nas bde ba'i tshor ba 'gyur ba dang bcas pa'i bar la kun du chags pa ni der kun du chags par 'gyur ba sdug bsngal ba la ni khong khro ba dang ldan no //
analyzed: de la tshor ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kun du rmongs nas bde ba'i tshor ba 'gyur ba dang bcas pa'i bar la kun du chags pa ni der kun du chags par 'gyur ba sdug bsngal ba la ni khong khro ba dang ldan no //
translated: Therein, one is attached to pleasant feeling through the defilement of feeling, and one is attached to the pleasant that is mixed with the unpleasant. One is hostile to the unpleasant.

original: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa la ni kun du rmongs te /üîΩkun nas dkris pa dang bag la nyal gyi sgo nas ni chags so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa la ni kun du rmongs te / kun nas dkris pa dang bag la nyal gyi sgo nas ni chags so //
translated: One is confused with regard to the neither unpleasant nor pleasant.üîΩOne is attached through the envelopments and the latent tendencies.

original: bag la nyal gyi sgo nas ni ldan pa dang kun du rmongs so //
analyzed: bag la nyal gyi sgo nas ni ldan pa dang kun du rmongs so //
translated: One is endowed with and confused about the latent tendencies.

original: de la dus kyi sgo nas kun nas nyon mongs pa ni da ltar gyi dus na ni chags shing sdang la kun du rmongs so //
analyzed: de la dus kyi sgo nas kun nas nyon mongs pa ni da ltar gyi dus na ni chags shing sdang la kun du rmongs so //
translated: Therein, the defilement by time is that one is attached, hostile, and confused in the present time.

original: 'das pa'i dus na ni lta ba dang ldan no //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na ni lta ba dang ldan no //
translated: In the past, he was endowed with views.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na ni sems 'dogs so //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na ni sems 'dogs so //
translated: In the future, he will be endowed with a mind.

original: de la tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni de de ltar sems kun nas nyon mongs pa @239b can du gyur ba'i phyir tshor ba dang dus kyi kun nas nyon mongs pas yang srid par skye ba'i las bsags pas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni de de ltar sems kun nas nyon mongs pa @239b can du gyur ba'i phyir tshor ba dang dus kyi kun nas nyon mongs pas yang srid par skye ba'i las bsags pas 'di lta ste /
translated: In this regard, the defilement of this life and the next life is the accumulation of karma for rebirth in the next existence by the defilement of sensation and time, because the mind is defiled in that way.üîΩThe existence of rebirth is the appropriation of the aggregates for rebirth in the next existence, because of rebirth.

original: skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir yang srid par skye ba'i phung po yang nye bar sogs la srid pa ste yang srid par skye ba'i srid pa dang / longs spyod kyi sred pa yang 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir yang srid par skye ba'i phung po yang nye bar sogs la srid pa ste yang srid par skye ba'i srid pa dang / longs spyod kyi sred pa yang 'phel bar byed do //
translated: The craving for pleasure increases.

original: yang srid par skye ba'i sred pas ni phyi ma la lus mngon par 'grub par byed do //
analyzed: yang srid par skye ba'i sred pas ni phyi ma la lus mngon par 'grub par byed do //
translated: The craving for rebirth in the next existence establishes the body in the next life.

original: longs spyod kyi sred pas ni yongs su tshol ba la zhugs pa na ngal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: longs spyod kyi sred pas ni yongs su tshol ba la zhugs pa na ngal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The craving for pleasure causes fatigue when one is engaged in seeking.

original: yul thob tu zin kyang nyon mongs pas gos par 'gyur la ma thob na yang 'dod pa mi rnyed pas gdungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul thob tu zin kyang nyon mongs pas gos par 'gyur la ma thob na yang 'dod pa mi rnyed pas gdungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if the object is obtained, one is defiled by the defilements; and if it is not obtained, one is tormented by the non-acquisition of what one desires.

original: thob pa las nyams na yang mya ngan dang 'khrug pa rnams kyis gzir bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: thob pa las nyams na yang mya ngan dang 'khrug pa rnams kyis gzir bar 'gyur te /
translated: And if one loses what has been obtained, one is oppressed by sorrow and lamentation.

original: 'di ni de'i tshe 'di'i nyes dmigs so //
analyzed: 'di ni de'i tshe 'di'i nyes dmigs so //
translated: This is the misfortune in this life.

original: yang srid par skye ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de byas shing bsags pa'i phyir phyi ma la skye ba dang rga shi la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi khyad par rnams skye bar 'gyur ba 'di ni tshe phyi ma'o //
analyzed: yang srid par skye ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de byas shing bsags pa'i phyir phyi ma la skye ba dang rga shi la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi khyad par rnams skye bar 'gyur ba 'di ni tshe phyi ma'o //
translated: The future is the arising of the particular sufferings of birth, old age, death, etc. in the next life, because of the performance and accumulation of the karma and defilements which give rise to rebirth.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag pa'i gang zag cig shos ni de las bzlog pa yin par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: gzhan yang sems mnyam par gzhag pa'i gang zag nyes dmigs de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes shing bsgom pa'i sa la zhugs pa cig shos kyis ni bdag med pa dang ldan pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba sngar thob pa de bsgom pa des spong

analyzed: ba'i khams dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams kyis dus gnyis su byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos thams cad dang bcas par yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur la sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gang zag snga ma shos kyis ni yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The first person, who is not in meditative equipoise, does not have this perfection.

original: 'di ni bzhi pa ste @240a * //
analyzed: 'di ni bzhi pa ste @240a * //
translated: This is the fourth.

original: snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin no //
translated: It is as above.

original: gzhan yang sems mnyam par gzhag pa'i gang zag gi ni mang du thos pa lhag mthong gi yan lag gang yin pa de ting nge 'dzin gyis yongs su zin pas lhag mthong yongs su dag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems mnyam par gzhag pa'i gang zag gi ni mang du thos pa lhag mthong gi yan lag gang yin pa de ting nge 'dzin gyis yongs su zin pas lhag mthong yongs su dag par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, for a person who is in meditative equipoise, the much learning that is a limb of insight is purified by insight, because it is embraced by meditative concentration.

original: de bas na de'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnyi ga la mnyam du zung du 'brel bar 'gyur la sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gang zag gis ni mang du thos pa dang bcas par gnyi ga med par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na de'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gnyi ga la mnyam du zung du 'brel bar 'gyur la sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gang zag gis ni mang du thos pa dang bcas par gnyi ga med par rig par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, for him, serenity and insight are equally yoked. But for a person who is not in meditative equipoise, it should be understood that neither is present, even though he may have much learning.

original: yang dag pa'i sbyor ba'i 'bras bu'i phan yon 'di ni chos 'di pa yang dag pa'i lta ba dang ldan pa mang du thos pa sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gang zag las chos 'di pa yang dag pa'i lta ba dang ldan pa mang du thos pa sems
analyzed: yang dag pa'i sbyor ba'i 'bras bu'i phan yon 'di ni chos 'di pa yang dag pa'i lta ba dang ldan pa mang du thos pa sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gang zag las chos 'di pa yang dag pa'i lta ba dang ldan pa mang du thos pa sems
translated: The benefits of the result of correct practice are that for a person who has the correct view of this Dharma, who is learned, but whose mind is not yet fully concentrated, the correct view of this Dharma, learning,üîΩ

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i khyad par du 'phags pa lnga pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i khyad par du 'phags pa lnga pa yin par rig par bya ste /

original: des de ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pa des spong ba'i khams su yongs su shes par bya ba ni yongs su shes /
analyzed: des de ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong thob pa des spong ba'i khams su yongs su shes par bya ba ni yongs su shes /
translated: That person who has thus achieved serenity and insight fully understands what is to be fully understood in the element of abandonment.

original: spang bar bya ba ni spong bar byed /üîΩmngon sum du bya ba ni mngon sum du byed /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba ni spong bar byed / mngon sum du bya ba ni mngon sum du byed /
translated: He abandons what is to be abandoned.üîΩHe actualizes what is to be actualized.

original: bsgom par bya ba ni sgom par byed do //
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba ni sgom par byed do //
translated: He cultivates what is to be cultivated.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams su ni yongs su shes pa dang / spangs pa dang / mngon sum du byas pa dang / bsgoms zin par gyur te gzugs te rten dang / ming ste brten pa yang yongs su shes so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i khams su ni yongs su shes pa dang / spangs pa dang / mngon sum du byas pa dang / bsgoms zin par gyur te gzugs te rten dang / ming ste brten pa yang yongs su shes so //
translated: In the realm free from desire, one has completely understood, abandoned, realized, and cultivated the form, which is the support, and the name, which is the supported.

original: yongs su shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will completely understand.

original: ma rig pa ste rten dang / srid pa'i sred pa ste brten pa yang spong ngo //
analyzed: ma rig pa ste rten dang / srid pa'i sred pa ste brten pa yang spong ngo //
translated: One abandons ignorance, which is the support, and craving for existence, which is the supported.

original: spangs par gyur to //üîΩrig pa rnam par dag pa'i shes pa ste rten dang / rnam par grol ba nyon mongs pa spang ba ste /
analyzed: spangs par gyur to // rig pa rnam par dag pa'i shes pa ste rten dang / rnam par grol ba nyon mongs pa spang ba ste /
translated: One has abandoned.

original: brten pa yang mngon sum du byed do //
analyzed: brten pa yang mngon sum du byed do //
translated: One realizes the knowledge of pure awareness, which is the support, and liberation from the afflictions, which is the supported.

original: mngon sum du byas par gyur to //
analyzed: mngon sum du byas par gyur to //
translated: One has realized.

original: zhi gnas te rten dang / lhag mthong ste brten pa yang sgom mo //
analyzed: zhi gnas te rten dang / lhag mthong ste brten pa yang sgom mo //
translated: One cultivates tranquility, which is the support, and insight, which is the supported.

original: bsgoms par gyur to //
analyzed: bsgoms par gyur to //
translated: One has cultivated.

original: chos mthong ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: chos mthong ba ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two ways of seeing phenomena:

original: 'dus byas kyi chos mthong ba dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos mthong ba'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos mthong ba dang 'dus ma byas kyi chos mthong ba'o //

original: de la 'dus byas kyi chos mthong ba ni ji ltar 'di na kha cig bden pa'i gnas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes la bden pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: de la 'dus byas kyi chos mthong ba ni ji ltar 'di na kha cig bden pa'i gnas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes la bden pa yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: The seeing of conditioned phenomena is as follows: Someone here knows the reality of the truth just as it is, and also knows the truth just as it is.

original: bden pa'i gnas gang zhe na /
analyzed: bden pa'i gnas gang zhe na /
translated: What is the reality of the truth?

original: ming dang gzugs @240b ni mi'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs @240b ni mi'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Name-and-form is called the nature of humans.

original: bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the truth?

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: It is the conventional truth and the ultimate truth.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the conventional truth?

original: bden pa'i gnas de nyid la bdag gam /
analyzed: bden pa'i gnas de nyid la bdag gam /
translated: In that very reality of the truth, one knows the self,

original: sems can nam /
analyzed: sems can nam /
translated: sentient beings,

original: srog dang skye ba po'i bar du 'du shes pa gang yin pa dang / bdag gis mig gis gzugs rnams mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas yid kyis chos rnams rnam par shes so zhes bya ba'i bar du khas 'che ba dang / 'di ltar de'i ming 'di zhes bya ba nas snga ma bzhin du tshe'i tshad ni 'di tsam mo zhes bya ba'i bar du tha snyad 'dogs so //
analyzed: srog dang skye ba po'i bar du 'du shes pa gang yin pa dang / bdag gis mig gis gzugs rnams mthong ngo zhes bya ba nas yid kyis chos rnams rnam par shes so zhes bya ba'i bar du khas 'che ba dang / 'di ltar de'i ming 'di zhes bya ba nas snga ma bzhin du tshe'i tshad ni 'di tsam mo zhes bya ba'i bar du tha snyad 'dogs so //
translated: The idea that there is a life force, a being, up to the idea that there is a self, the claim that ‚ÄúI see forms with my eyes‚Äù up to ‚ÄúI cognize mental phenomena with my mind,‚Äù and the conventional expressions ‚ÄúHis name is such-and-such,‚Äù up to ‚ÄúHis life span is this long,‚Äù as before.

original: de'i 'du shes shing khas 'che la tha snyad 'dogs pa tsam gang yin pa 'di ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'du shes shing khas 'che la tha snyad 'dogs pa tsam gang yin pa 'di ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: This mere idea, claim, and conventional expression is the conventional truth.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the ultimate truth?

original: bden pa'i gnas de ni mi rtag pa nas snga ma bzhin du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i bar du sbyar te /
analyzed: bden pa'i gnas de ni mi rtag pa nas snga ma bzhin du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i bar du sbyar te /
translated: The basis of the truth is impermanent, up to the truth is dependently arisen, as before.

original: mi rtag pa nyid ji lta ba bzhin du sdug bsngal ba nyid kyang de dang 'dra'o snyam nas gang de ltar kun rdzob dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'i gnas la kun rdzob kyi bden pa la yang kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin pa dang /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ji lta ba bzhin du sdug bsngal ba nyid kyang de dang 'dra'o snyam nas gang de ltar kun rdzob dang / don dam pa'i bden pa'i gnas la kun rdzob kyi bden pa la yang kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin pa dang /
translated: Just as with impermanence, so it is with suffering.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa la yang don dam pa'i bden pa yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa'i dge slong de la ni 'dus byas kyi chos mthong ba dang ldan pa zhes brjod par 'os so //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa la yang don dam pa'i bden pa yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa'i dge slong de la ni 'dus byas kyi chos mthong ba dang ldan pa zhes brjod par 'os so //
translated: The monk who knows the two truths in this way, who knows conventional truth as conventional truth and ultimate truth as ultimate truth, is worthy to be called one who sees conditioned phenomena.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos mthong ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos mthong ba gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is seeing unconditioned phenomena?‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúIt is the mind that views nirvana, the complete pacification of all the aggregates, as peace, based on the expertise in the two truths of one who is skilled in the two truths.

original: bden pa'i gnas la bden pa pa gnyis la mkhas pa'i mkhas pa de nyid la brten nas phung po thams cad yang dag par zad pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la zhi bar lta ba'i sems 'jug pa gang yin pa nas snga ma bzhin du rnam par grol
analyzed: bden pa'i gnas la bden pa pa gnyis la mkhas pa'i mkhas pa de nyid la brten nas phung po thams cad yang dag par zad pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la zhi bar lta ba'i sems 'jug pa gang yin pa nas snga ma bzhin du rnam par grol
translated: As before, this leads to liberation.

original: bar 'gyur ba'i bar du sbyar ba 'di ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos mthong ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bar 'gyur ba'i bar du sbyar ba 'di ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos mthong ba zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called ‚Äúseeing the unconditioned element.‚Äù

original: de dang ldan pa'i dge slong de ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos mthong ba zhes brjod par 'os so //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i dge slong de ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos mthong ba zhes brjod par 'os so //
translated: The monk who possesses this is called ‚Äúone who sees the unconditioned element.‚Äù

original: chos mthong ba de yang gang zag gsum la yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: chos mthong ba de yang gang zag gsum la yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: This seeing of the Dharma should be understood as existing in three persons:

original: so so'i skye bo chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la zhugs pa /üîΩsems mnyam par gzhag pa mkhas shing yid gzhungs la tshul bzhin du chos la spyod par byed pa dang / de bzhin du slob pa bzhi mthong ba dang / mi slob pa zag @241a * //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la zhugs pa / sems mnyam par gzhag pa mkhas shing yid gzhungs la tshul bzhin du chos la spyod par byed pa dang / de bzhin du slob pa bzhi mthong ba dang / mi slob pa zag @241a * //
translated: the ordinary man who is a Dharma-follower,üîΩthe one who is skilled in concentration, who is intelligent, and who practices the Dharma correctly;

original: pa zad pa la yang yod do //
analyzed: pa zad pa la yang yod do //
translated: and the one who is a learner, who has seen the truths, and the one who is a post-learner, who has destroyed the defilements.

original: lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir smon nas tshangs par spyad pa spyod pa la ni lha dang mi'i nyes dmigs gnyis su 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: lha dang mi'i phun sum tshogs pa mngon par 'dod pa'i phyir smon nas tshangs par spyad pa spyod pa la ni lha dang mi'i nyes dmigs gnyis su 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
translated: One should know that there are two kinds of disadvantages for the gods and men who practice pure conduct with a vow, because they desire the excellence of gods and men.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: nyon mongs pas bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal dang mi rtag pa nyid kyis bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pas bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal dang mi rtag pa nyid kyis bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The suffering generated by the afflictions and the suffering generated by impermanence.

original: nyon mongs pas bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyon mongs pas bskyed pa'i sdug bsngal gang zhe na /
translated: What is the suffering generated by the afflictions?

original: lha dang mi rnams ni da ltar gyi dus kyi sgo nas yul la kun tu dga' bar gnas la /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams ni da ltar gyi dus kyi sgo nas yul la kun tu dga' bar gnas la /
translated: Gods and humans are presently attached to objects.

original: 'das pa'i dus kyi sgo nas ni yul la dga'o //üîΩda ltar gyi dus su 'das pa'i yul gyi dga' ba la brten pas ni yul la kun nas dga'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus kyi sgo nas ni yul la dga'o // da ltar gyi dus su 'das pa'i yul gyi dga' ba la brten pas ni yul la kun nas dga'o //
translated: In the past, they were attached to objects.üîΩIn the present, they are attached to objects by relying on the pleasure of past objects.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su da ltar byung ba'i yul gyi dga' ba la brten pas ni yul la mngon par dga'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su da ltar byung ba'i yul gyi dga' ba la brten pas ni yul la mngon par dga'o //
translated: In the future, they will be attached to objects by relying on the pleasure of present objects.

original: de ltar dus gsum du kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gnas pa de dag la ni 'dod pa mi rnyed pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang / skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung bar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar dus gsum du kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gnas pa de dag la ni 'dod pa mi rnyed pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang / skye ba dang rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung bar shes par bya ste /
translated: Thus, it should be understood that those who are presently afflicted in the three times experience the suffering that arises from not obtaining what they desire and the suffering of birth, aging, etc.

original: 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa las gyur ba'i sdug bsngal skye bar byed pa'i nyes dmigs so //
analyzed: 'di ni kun nas nyon mongs pa las gyur ba'i sdug bsngal skye bar byed pa'i nyes dmigs so //
translated: This is the disadvantage of the arising of suffering that comes from the defilements.

original: mi rtag pa nyid las gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid las gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gang zhe na /
translated: What is suffering that comes from impermanence?

original: bde ba dang mthun pa rnams dang 'bral zhing 'gyur ba las 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang mthun pa rnams dang phrad pa las skyo ba'i sdug bsngal 'byung ba dang / lus thams cad 'chi ba'i tshe 'gag par 'gyur ba las 'gag pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: bde ba dang mthun pa rnams dang 'bral zhing 'gyur ba las 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang mthun pa rnams dang phrad pa las skyo ba'i sdug bsngal 'byung ba dang / lus thams cad 'chi ba'i tshe 'gag par 'gyur ba las 'gag pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung ba dang /
translated: The suffering of change arises from the separation from, and change in, what is agreeable. The suffering of misery arises from contact with what is disagreeable. The suffering of suffering arises from the cessation of the body at the time of death.

original: rnam pa gsum po 'di dag ni mi rtag pa nyid las gyur ba'i sdug bsngal yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po 'di dag ni mi rtag pa nyid las gyur ba'i sdug bsngal yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These three kinds of suffering should be understood as the suffering that comes from impermanence.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa ni nyes dmigs de gnyis las 'da' bas na gcig tu nges par bde ba la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa ni nyes dmigs de gnyis las 'da' bas na gcig tu nges par bde ba la gnas pa yin no //
translated: The Tathagata, who has gone beyond these two disadvantages, is one who abides in true happiness.

original: de la bde ba de yang rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bde ba de yang rig par bya ste /
translated: And that happiness should be understood as follows:

original: gang gis bde bar 'gyur ba dang / bde ba de'i thabs kyang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis bde bar 'gyur ba dang / bde ba de'i thabs kyang rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know what is happiness and the means to that happiness.

original: bde ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: bde ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is happiness?

original: yul thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams zad nas bla na med pa'i grub pa dang / bde ba phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yul thams cad dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams zad nas bla na med pa'i grub pa dang / bde ba phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is the unsurpassed accomplishment and happiness of the Nirvana with remainder that comes from the extinction of the afflictions associated with all objects.

original: thabs gang zhe na /
analyzed: thabs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the means?

original: snga ma bzhin du tshor ba rnam pa lnga yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du @241b sngar bsgyur ba'i shas pa'o //

analyzed: dran pa'i stobs dang ldan pa'i rgyu ni gsum yod de /

analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa'o //

translated: The enlightenment of the Buddhas is distinguished by three aspects: the realization of all objects of knowledge, the realization of existent and non-existent things as they truly are, and the realization of all phenomena that are conducive to affliction and purification. Therefore, in these three cases, others ask the Blessed One questions.

original: 'dus byas kyi chos lhan cig 'byung ba thams cad ni sems rmongs shing mtshan nyid la log par 'dzin pa'i rtog pa skyed par byed pa yin no //

translated: All conditioned things that occur together produce the delusion of mind and the conception of a false nature.

analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa ni nyan thos rnams mtshan nyid nges pa la 'jug par mdzad pa'i phyir rnam par dbye bar mdzad de /

analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi de nyid shes pa rnams ni bdag kyang bslus par mi 'gyur la /

original: rab tu byung ba'i bslab pa 'bul ba'i sgo nas ni yul la lta ba rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i bslab pa 'bul ba'i sgo nas ni yul la lta ba rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The presentation of the view of objects should be understood as the presentation of the vows of the ordained.

original: rab tu byung ba nyid kyi 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi sgo nas ni rab tu byung ba nyid kyi 'jug pa mi phyogs pa sems kyi thab 'chab pa'i gzhi rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //

translated: The object that is definitely seized and observed by the enjoyment of one who is devoid of shame and modesty is called ‚Äúthe object of one who is intent on enjoyment.‚Äù

analyzed: des kyang dge ba'i phyogs chen po bya ba la las su mi rung ba'i tshul gyis sems tha bar byed do //

analyzed: de'i sgo nas kyang nyes par spyod pa kun du sbyor bar @243a * //

analyzed: 'gyur la sdig pa'i bsam pa yang mkhyud par 'gyur zhing 'chab pa bskyed do //

analyzed: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni ro myang ba lhur len pa'i yul sems kyi tha ba 'chab pa'i gzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: All of those together are called ‚Äúthe basis of the mind‚Äôs hardness and concealment that is the object of one who is intent on enjoyment.‚Äù

original: dbang po'i sgom bsdams par spyod pa ni dam pa'i chos ma yin pa thos pa la brten nas ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i nyon mongs pa can gyi yid la byed pa skye bar 'gyur te /

translated: One who is not restrained in the doors of the senses generates afflicted mental activity that arises from contact with ignorance in dependence on hearing what is not the true Dharma.

original: de'i sgo nas phyi ma la skye mched mngon par 'grub pa'i nyes dmigs yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes so //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas phyi ma la skye mched mngon par 'grub pa'i nyes dmigs yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes so //
translated: Because of this, one does not understand as it really is the disadvantage of the future manifestation of the sense-spheres.

analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes na 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Not understanding as it really is, one desires.

original: 'dod par gyur na de dang ldan pa'i las byed cing sogs so //
analyzed: 'dod par gyur na de dang ldan pa'i las byed cing sogs so //
translated: Having desired, one performs and accumulates actions associated with that.

original: de dang ldan pa'i las byas shing bsags na phyi ma la skye mched drug mngon par 'grub ste go rims 'di bzhin du mi mthun pa'i tshul gyis skye mched drug ni las kyi rgyu las byung ngo //

translated: Having performed and accumulated actions associated with that, one manifests the six sense-spheres in the future. In this order, the six sense-spheres arise from the cause of action, in a manner contrary to the order.

original: las ni srid pa'i rgyu las byung ngo //
analyzed: las ni srid pa'i rgyu las byung ngo //
translated: Action arises from the cause of existence.

original: sred pa ni ma rig pa'i rgyu las byung ngo //üîΩma rig pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rgyu las byung ngo //
analyzed: sred pa ni ma rig pa'i rgyu las byung ngo // ma rig pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i rgyu las byung ngo //
translated: Craving arises from the cause of ignorance.üîΩIgnorance arises from the cause of incorrect mental activity.
