analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa ni ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: Incorrect mental activity arises from the cause of the contact of ignorance.

original: de la sngon gyi las gang yin pa de ni tshe 'di la myong bar 'gyur ba'i skye mched drug gi rkyen to //
analyzed: de la sngon gyi las gang yin pa de ni tshe 'di la myong bar 'gyur ba'i skye mched drug gi rkyen to //
translated: The six sense spheres are the condition for the karma that is to be experienced in this life.

original: tshe 'di'i las gang yin pa de ni skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'i skye mched drug gi rkyen to //
analyzed: tshe 'di'i las gang yin pa de ni skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'i skye mched drug gi rkyen to //
translated: The six sense spheres are the condition for the karma that is to be experienced in the next life.

original: yang na lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i gzhi'o //
analyzed: yang na lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i gzhi'o //
translated: Or, they are the basis for the karma that is to be experienced in a third life.

original: de bzhin du sred pa la sogs pa yang las la sogs pa dang ci rigs par sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sred pa la sogs pa yang las la sogs pa dang ci rigs par sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, craving and so on should be understood as appropriate conditions for karma and so on.

original: yang srid par skye ba ni yang srid par skye ba'i las dang / yang srid par skye ba'i sred pa rnam pa gnyis kyis mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang srid par skye ba ni yang srid par skye ba'i las dang / yang srid par skye ba'i sred pa rnam pa gnyis kyis mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: The rebirth in a new existence is accomplished by two things: by the karma that produces the new existence and by the craving for the new existence.

original: sems can 'di dag ni las ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni las ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba zhes bya'o //
translated: These beings go according to their karma.

original: sred pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba zhes ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: sred pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba zhes ni mi bya'o //
translated: They do not go according to their craving.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sred pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sred pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: In brief, craving is of three kinds:

original: 'dod pa'i sred pa dang / gzugs kyi sred pa dang / gzugs med pa'i sred pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sred pa dang / gzugs kyi sred pa dang / gzugs med pa'i sred pa'o //
translated: craving for the desire realm, craving for the form realm, and craving for the formless realm.

original: de la 'dod pa'i sred pa gang yin pa de ni mi dge ba yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i sred pa gang yin pa de ni mi dge ba yin te /
translated: Among these, craving for the desire realm is nonvirtuous.

original: rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa yin mod kyi sdig pa'i @243b las kun nas ma bslangs par ngan song rnams su rnam par smin pa smin par mi byed do //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa yin mod kyi sdig pa'i @243b las kun nas ma bslangs par ngan song rnams su rnam par smin pa smin par mi byed do //
translated: Although it has karmic maturation, it does not cause the maturation of karmic maturation in the lower realms unless it is motivated by sinful karma.

original: gang gi tshe 'dod pa'i khams su sred pa dang bcas pa'i ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba 'dod par gyur nas chags par 'gyur ba'i yul la 'dod chags pa dang / zhe sdang bar 'gyur ba la zhe sdang ba dang /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dod pa'i khams su sred pa dang bcas pa'i ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba 'dod par gyur nas chags par 'gyur ba'i yul la 'dod chags pa dang / zhe sdang bar 'gyur ba la zhe sdang ba dang /
translated: When craving for the desire realm arises from contact that is ignorance accompanied by craving, and one becomes attached to objects that cause attachment, one becomes angry toward objects that cause anger,

original: gti mug par 'byung ba la gti mug pa'i sgo nas mi dge ba'i las kun du spyod de /
analyzed: gti mug par 'byung ba la gti mug pa'i sgo nas mi dge ba'i las kun du spyod de /
translated: and one becomes deluded toward objects that cause delusion, one engages in nonvirtuous actions.

original: de'i phyir las des ngan song rnams su skye bar 'gyur gyi 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi kun nas dkris pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir las des ngan song rnams su skye bar 'gyur gyi 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi kun nas dkris pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, one is born in the lower realms due to that action, not due to the mere entanglement of desire, hatred, and ignorance.

original: sred pa ni las de'i rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub pa'i tshe nges pa kho nar grogs kyi bya ba byed par zad do //
analyzed: sred pa ni las de'i rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub pa'i tshe nges pa kho nar grogs kyi bya ba byed par zad do //
translated: Craving is only the cooperative cause when the maturation of that action is being actualized.

original: sdug pa'i yul 'dod pa'i sgo nas ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyis dge ba kun du spyod de /
analyzed: sdug pa'i yul 'dod pa'i sgo nas ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyis dge ba kun du spyod de /
translated: One engages in wholesome actions of body, speech, and mind through the desire for pleasant objects.

original: de'i rgyus ni bde 'gror skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i rgyus ni bde 'gror skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Due to that, one is born in the happy realms.

original: der sdug pa'i rnam par smin pa 'phen cing ;
analyzed: der sdug pa'i rnam par smin pa 'phen cing ;
translated: There, the pleasant maturation is projected.

original: mngon par 'grub pa na las nyi tshe rgyur 'gyur bar 'os kyi /
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa na las nyi tshe rgyur 'gyur bar 'os kyi /
translated: When it is being actualized, only the action is suitable to be the cause.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi sred pa'i rang bzhin ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi sred pa'i rang bzhin ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: The nature of afflicted craving is not like that.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sred pa gang yin pa ni mi dge ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sred pa gang yin pa ni mi dge ba ma yin no //
translated: The craving for the form and formless realms is not unwholesome.

original: 'on kyang nyon mongs pa can yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang nyon mongs pa can yin te /
translated: However, it is afflicted.

original: de ni thams cad kyi thams cad du rnam par smin pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de ni thams cad kyi thams cad du rnam par smin pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: It is completely without ripening.

original: de gal te gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sred pas sred par 'gyur na ni dam pa'i chos thos pa la brten nas 'dod pa'i khams la rags par mthong ste /
analyzed: de gal te gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sred pas sred par 'gyur na ni dam pa'i chos thos pa la brten nas 'dod pa'i khams la rags par mthong ste /
translated: If it is craving for the form and formless realms, then, based on hearing the excellent teaching, one sees the desire realm as coarse.

original: reg pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i 'jig rten pa'i tshor ba tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang phrad nas 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug bsam te dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa bsgoms pa las byung ba'i las byed do //
analyzed: reg pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i 'jig rten pa'i tshor ba tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang phrad nas 'dod pa'i khams kyi 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug bsam te dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa bsgoms pa las byung ba'i las byed do //
translated: Having encountered the mundane feeling that arises from contact with the appropriate mental attention, one abandons the desire realm‚Äôs attachment, anger, and ignorance. One then performs virtuous, contaminated karma that arises from meditation.

original: des na de 'dir bya ba'i las kyis der skye bar 'gyur gyi nyon mongs pa can gyi sred pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de 'dir bya ba'i las kyis der skye bar 'gyur gyi nyon mongs pa can gyi sred pas ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, one is born in the desire realm due to the karma that is to be done here, but not due to contaminated craving.

original: sred pa ni las de'i rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub pa'i tshe grogs kyi bya ba byed par zad do //
analyzed: sred pa ni las de'i rnam par smin pa mngon par 'grub pa'i tshe grogs kyi bya ba byed par zad do //
translated: Craving merely performs the function of assisting the ripening of that karma.

original: de bas na sems can rnams ni las ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba zhes bya'i sred pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba zhes mi bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na sems can rnams ni las ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba zhes bya'i sred pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'gro ba zhes mi bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is said that sentient beings go according to their karma, not that they go according to their craving.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams @244a * //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams @244a * //
translated: In regard to external things,

original: la 'jig rten gyi gdags pa'i sgo nas 'bras bu 'ga' zhig tshor ba po las res 'ga' stong la res 'ga' ni mi stong par snang ste 'bras bu la ji lta ba bzhin du rgyu la yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: la 'jig rten gyi gdags pa'i sgo nas 'bras bu 'ga' zhig tshor ba po las res 'ga' stong la res 'ga' ni mi stong par snang ste 'bras bu la ji lta ba bzhin du rgyu la yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: sometimes the result of worldly designations is not empty for the experiencer, and sometimes it is empty. The cause is like the result.

original: de yang kun rdzob kyi stong pa yin gyi don dam pa'i stong pa zhes ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: de yang kun rdzob kyi stong pa yin gyi don dam pa'i stong pa zhes ni mi bya'o //
translated: This is the emptiness of the conventional, not the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: dus thams cad du 'du byed thams cad kyi 'bras bu dang rgyu tsam zhig ni yod la tshor ba po dang byed pa po ni med pa gang yin pa 'di ni don dam pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: dus thams cad du 'du byed thams cad kyi 'bras bu dang rgyu tsam zhig ni yod la tshor ba po dang byed pa po ni med pa gang yin pa 'di ni don dam pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The emptiness of the ultimate is the emptiness of all conditioned things at all times, of the result and the cause, and of the experiencer and the agent.

original: de yang rnam pa bdun du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bdun du rig par bya ste /
translated: This is to be understood in seven ways.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows.

original: phyi ma'i mtha' stong pa nyid dang / sngon gyi mtha' stong pa nyid dang / dbus kyi mtha' stong pa nyid dang / rtag pa stong pa nyid dang / bdag stong pa nyid dang / tshor ba po stong pa nyid dang / byed pa po stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' stong pa nyid dang / sngon gyi mtha' stong pa nyid dang / dbus kyi mtha' stong pa nyid dang / rtag pa stong pa nyid dang / bdag stong pa nyid dang / tshor ba po stong pa nyid dang / byed pa po stong pa nyid do //
translated: The emptiness of the past, the emptiness of the future, the emptiness of the present, the emptiness of the beginningless, the emptiness of the endless, the emptiness of the basic nature, the emptiness of all things, the emptiness of defining characteristics, the emptiness of the absence of external objects, and the emptiness of the lack of an owner.

original: de la ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'du byed rnams 'du byed kyi phung por 'dug ste /
analyzed: de la ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'du byed rnams 'du byed kyi phung por 'dug ste /
translated: The emptiness of the past means that in the future, formations will be present as the aggregate of formations.

original: de las 'du byed rnams skye ba'i tshe 'ong bar 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: de las 'du byed rnams skye ba'i tshe 'ong bar 'gyur ba med do //
translated: When those formations arise, they do not come from anywhere.

original: gal te de yod par 'gyur na ma 'ongs pa'i dus na rang bzhin gyis yongs su grub zin pa de dag ni skyer yang mi rung la mi rtag pa nyid du snang bar yang mi 'gyur ba'i rigs na snang zhing yang 'dug ste /
analyzed: gal te de yod par 'gyur na ma 'ongs pa'i dus na rang bzhin gyis yongs su grub zin pa de dag ni skyer yang mi rung la mi rtag pa nyid du snang bar yang mi 'gyur ba'i rigs na snang zhing yang 'dug ste /
translated: If they were to exist, it would be illogical for those formations that are already essentially established in the future to arise again, and it would be illogical for them to appear as impermanent.

original: de bas na skye ba'i tshe gang nas kyang mi 'ong la med pa las yod par yang 'gyur ba 'di ni phyi ma'i mtha' stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: de bas na skye ba'i tshe gang nas kyang mi 'ong la med pa las yod par yang 'gyur ba 'di ni phyi ma'i mtha' stong pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, when they arise, they do not come from anywhere, and they do not exist from a nonexistent state. This is the emptiness of the future.üîΩThe emptiness of the present means that the five present aggregates are empty of their own essence.

original: de las 'das pa'i dus na 'du byed rnams phung por 'dug ste /
analyzed: de las 'das pa'i dus na 'du byed rnams phung por 'dug ste /
translated: In a time prior to that, compounded phenomena were not accumulated.

original: der 'du byed skyes nas 'gag pa rnams sogs par 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: der 'du byed skyes nas 'gag pa rnams sogs par 'gyur ba med de /
translated: When compounded phenomena arose and ceased, they were not accumulated.üîΩIf they were, then because the collection of past compounded phenomena would remain by its own power, compounded phenomena would never cease.

original: gal te yod par gyur na 'das pa'i 'du byed kyi tshogs rang gi bdag nyid kyis gnas pa'i phyir 'du byed 'gag pa yang med pa kho nar 'gyur la 'gag pa med na ni rtag pa nyid du yang snang bar mi 'gyur ba'i rigs na snang zhing yang
analyzed: gal te yod par gyur na 'das pa'i 'du byed kyi tshogs rang gi bdag nyid kyis gnas pa'i phyir 'du byed 'gag pa yang med pa kho nar 'gyur la 'gag pa med na ni rtag pa nyid du yang snang bar mi 'gyur ba'i rigs na snang zhing yang
translated: If they did not cease, then it would be logical that they would not appear to be impermanent.üîΩBut they do appear to be impermanent.

original: 'dug ste / de bas na 'du byed rnams 'gag pa'i tshe gang du yang sogs par mi 'gyur la yod pa las 'gag pa'i rgyu la ma ltos par rang gi ngang gis phyir med par 'gyur ba 'di ni sngon gyi mtha' stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dug ste / de bas na 'du byed rnams 'gag pa'i tshe gang du yang sogs par mi 'gyur la yod pa las 'gag pa'i rgyu la ma ltos par rang gi ngang gis phyir med par 'gyur ba 'di ni sngon gyi mtha' stong pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, when compounded phenomena cease, they are not accumulated anywhere. Without depending on a cause for cessation, they naturally become nonexistent. This is emptiness of the prior limit.

original: 'du byed rnams kyi skad cig la skyes la ma 'gags pa la 'du byed tsam du snang ste /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi skad cig la skyes la ma 'gags pa la 'du byed tsam du snang ste /
translated: The mere appearance of compounded phenomena arises in the moment when they have not ceased.

original: de dag la de ma yin pa'i 'du byed kyang med la don tha dad par 'gyur ba yang med pa 'di ni dbus kyis @244b mtha' stong pa nyid dang / rtag pa stong pa nyid dang / bdag stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la de ma yin pa'i 'du byed kyang med la don tha dad par 'gyur ba yang med pa 'di ni dbus kyis @244b mtha' stong pa nyid dang / rtag pa stong pa nyid dang / bdag stong pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The non-existence of any other conditioning factors apart from them, and the non-existence of any separate object, should be understood as the emptiness of the middle with regard to the extremes, the emptiness of permanence, and the emptiness of self.

original: bdag med na ni 'bras bur gyur ba'i 'du byed rnams kyang tshor ba pos stong la rgyur gyur ba'i las kyang byed pa pos stong pa 'di ni tshor ba po dang / byed pa po stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag med na ni 'bras bur gyur ba'i 'du byed rnams kyang tshor ba pos stong la rgyur gyur ba'i las kyang byed pa pos stong pa 'di ni tshor ba po dang / byed pa po stong pa nyid do //
translated: Since there is no self, the conditioning factors that are the effect are empty of an experiencer, and the actions that are the cause are empty of an agent. This is the emptiness of an experiencer and an agent.

original: tshor ba po dang byed pa po med pas na 'du byed tsam gyi sngon gyi skye ba ni 'gag la 'du byed tsam gyis skye ba gzhan ni 'byung bar 'gyur gyi sngon gyi rnams 'dor ba po yongs su yang med la phyi ma rnams len pa po yongsüîΩsu yang med do //
analyzed: tshor ba po dang byed pa po med pas na 'du byed tsam gyi sngon gyi skye ba ni 'gag la 'du byed tsam gyis skye ba gzhan ni 'byung bar 'gyur gyi sngon gyi rnams 'dor ba po yongs su yang med la phyi ma rnams len pa po yongsüîΩsu yang med do //
translated: Since there is no experiencer and no agent, only conditioning factors cease in previous births, and only conditioning factors arise in other births. There is no permanent appropriator of the previous ones, nor is there a permanent appropriator of the later ones.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos rnams nyid kyis chos rnams bskyed do zhes gsungs pa de ni byed pa med pa'i chos thams cad la sus kyang ci yang bskyed pa med mod kyi 'on kyang gang yod na gang 'byung bar 'gyur la gang skyes na gang skyeüîΩbor 'gyur te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos rnams nyid kyis chos rnams bskyed do zhes gsungs pa de ni byed pa med pa'i chos thams cad la sus kyang ci yang bskyed pa med mod kyi 'on kyang gang yod na gang 'byung bar 'gyur la gang skyes na gang skye bor 'gyur te /
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚Äúall things arise in dependence on conditions‚Äù is that when this exists, that comes to be; when this arises, that arises.

original: chos tsam gyi rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa de la chos rnams nyid kyis chos rnams bskyed do zhes brda 'di 'dogs par mdzad do //
analyzed: chos tsam gyi rgyu dang 'bras bur gyur pa de la chos rnams nyid kyis chos rnams bskyed do zhes brda 'di 'dogs par mdzad do //
translated: This is the mere principle of cause and effect, and it is in reference to this that the Buddha said, ‚ÄúThings are produced by things themselves.‚Äù

original: yid bde ba dang mthun pa'i yul la ni rnam pa lngas nye bar spyod cing kun du chags te tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i mtshan ma 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: yid bde ba dang mthun pa'i yul la ni rnam pa lngas nye bar spyod cing kun du chags te tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i mtshan ma 'dzin par byed do //
translated: One enjoys and is attached to objects that are in accordance with mental pleasure in five ways: one grasps the sign of the object, one generates desire, one generates passion, one generates attachment, and one generates craving.

original: 'dun pa bskyed do //
analyzed: 'dun pa bskyed do //
translated: One generates desire.

original: lan mang du rjes su rtog par byed do //
analyzed: lan mang du rjes su rtog par byed do //
translated: One reflects on it many times.

original: yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: One seeks it.

original: de'i rgyus bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa spyod do //
analyzed: de'i rgyus bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa spyod do //
translated: One engages in merit and demerit on its account.

original: yid bde ba dang mthun pa'i yul la ji lta ba de bzhin du yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang mthun pa la yang ci rigs par sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid bde ba dang mthun pa'i yul la ji lta ba de bzhin du yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms dang mthun pa la yang ci rigs par sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as with the objects that are favorable to joy, so too with the objects that are favorable to grief and equanimity.

original: de la khyad par ni 'di yod de yid mi bde ba dang mthun pa rnams la ni gnod sems su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la khyad par ni 'di yod de yid mi bde ba dang mthun pa rnams la ni gnod sems su 'gyur ro //
translated: The difference is that the objects that are favorable to grief are the cause of malice,

original: btang snyoms dang mthun pa rnams la ni rmongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: btang snyoms dang mthun pa rnams la ni rmongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and the objects that are favorable to equanimity are the cause of delusion.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: dge slong dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa na yul thams cad la nye bar spyod pa na brjed ngas pa tsam gyis sgo nas kyang nyon mongs pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyur rtag tu mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa na yul thams cad la nye bar spyod pa na brjed ngas pa tsam gyis sgo nas kyang nyon mongs pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyur rtag tu mi 'gyur te /
translated: When a bhik·π£u who is an arhat whose contaminants have ceased experiences all objects, afflictions do not arise through the door of mere forgetfulness.

original: de bas na rtag tu kun nas nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa'i phyir rtag tu gnas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na rtag tu kun nas nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa'i phyir rtag tu gnas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, because he always abides without affliction, he is said to always abide.

original: nye bar spyod pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba gang yin pa des kyang dgra bcom pa ni yid bde bar yang mi 'gyur la yid mi bde bar yang mi 'gyur @245a * //
analyzed: nye bar spyod pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i yid bde ba dang yid mi bde ba gang yin pa des kyang dgra bcom pa ni yid bde bar yang mi 'gyur la yid mi bde bar yang mi 'gyur @245a * //
translated: The arhat is neither pleased nor displeased by the pleasure or pain that is favorable to enjoyment.

original: te dge ba gang yin pas ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: te dge ba gang yin pas ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the same for the wholesome.

original: rtag tu gnas par bya ba de dag ni dka' ba dang / mchog yin pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phyir de dag dang ldan pa ni dkon pa dang / yon gnas kyi mchog yin par rig par bya ba nas spyan drang ba'i 'os yin pa'i bar du rgyas par sbyar te /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: rtag tu gnas par bya ba de dag ni dka' ba dang / mchog yin pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i phyir de dag dang ldan pa ni dkon pa dang / yon gnas kyi mchog yin par rig par bya ba nas spyan drang ba'i 'os yin pa'i bar du rgyas par sbyar te / 'di lta ste /
translated: The arhat is difficult to please, for it is difficult to do what is necessary to please him. He is the best of the fields of merit, for he is the best of recipients. He is worthy to receive gifts, for he is worthy of worship. He is worthy of honor, for he is worthy of veneration. He is worthy of esteem, for he is worthy of respect. He is worthy of salutations, for he is worthy of obeisance. He is worthy of offerings, for he is worthy of homage. He is worthy of being looked up to, for he is worthy of being gazed upon. He is worthy of being attended upon, for he is worthy of service. He is worthy of being heeded, for he is worthy of being obeyed. He is worthy of being followed, for he is worthy of being accompanied. He is worthy of being united with, for he is worthy of being joined with. He is worthy of being venerated, for he is worthy of being worshipped. He is worthy of being praised, for he is worthy of being extolled. He is worthy of being honored, for he is worthy of being revered. He is worthy of being invited, for he is worthy of being summoned.

original: rnam grangs bsdu ba las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam grangs bsdu ba las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: In brief, the arhat is worthy of the most perfect worship.üîΩThis is the way in which the arhat is to be known as the best of fields of merit.

original: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba ston pa'i ston pa phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa gnyis kyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba ston pa'i ston pa phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa gnyis kyis rig par bya'o //
translated: The teacher is perfect in two ways: he teaches the well proclaimed Dharma-Vinaya, and he is an arhat.

original: nyan thos rnams kyi nyan thos phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa gnyis kyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi nyan thos phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa gnyis kyis rig par bya'o //
translated: The perfection of the disciples is also to be understood as twofold.

original: rnam pa gnyis po gang gis ston pa phun sum tshogs par rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis po gang gis ston pa phun sum tshogs par rig par bya zhe na /
translated: By what two aspects is the perfection of the teacher to be understood?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: gzhan la phan pa bsgrub pa'i sgo nas tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba'i 'di dag 'dir sdug bsngal ba yin no zhes bya ba la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir tshor ba rnams kyi rten bstan pa dang / gzhi bstan pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba nye bar spyod pa bstan pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa bsgrub pa'i sgo nas tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba'i 'di dag 'dir sdug bsngal ba yin no zhes bya ba la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir tshor ba rnams kyi rten bstan pa dang / gzhi bstan pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba nye bar spyod pa bstan pa dang /
translated: The teaching of the basis of the feelings, the teaching of the ground, the teaching of the enjoyment of the defilement,

original: ston pa'i rtags mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du nges par 'byung ba bstan pa 'di ni ston pa phun sum tshogs pa dang po'o //
analyzed: ston pa'i rtags mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa dang / rnam pa thams cad du nges par 'byung ba bstan pa 'di ni ston pa phun sum tshogs pa dang po'o //
translated: the teaching of the teacher's sign as the establishment of the counteragent to the adverse elements, and the teaching of the definite release in every way. This is the first perfection of the teacher.

original: yang na bdag la phan pa bsgrub pa'i sgo nas ma 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa 'di ni ston pa phun sum tshogs pa gnyis pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na bdag la phan pa bsgrub pa'i sgo nas ma 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa 'di ni ston pa phun sum tshogs pa gnyis pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Or else, by means of the three applications of mindfulness that are not shared in common, which are practiced in order to achieve benefit for oneself, he abides without defilement. This is the second perfection of the Master.

original: de la rnam pa gnyis pa gang gis nyan thos phun sum tshogs par rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnam pa gnyis pa gang gis nyan thos phun sum tshogs par rig par bya zhe na /
translated: By means of which two aspects should the perfection of the disciple be understood?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos bstan pa ni tshad med de snyam du rig nas thos pa'i pha rol tu phyin par mi nus la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos bstan pa ni tshad med de snyam du rig nas thos pa'i pha rol tu phyin par mi nus la /
translated: Having understood that the teachings of the TathƒÅgata are immeasurable, he is not able to perfect the pƒÅramitƒÅ of learning.

original: gal te pha rol tu phyin par nus na yang de ni chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos nan tan du bsgrub pas nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te pha rol tu phyin par nus na yang de ni chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos nan tan du bsgrub pas nges par 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: Even if he were able to perfect it, it is in order to attain deliverance by practicing the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma,üîΩand not just for the sake of grasping it.

original: gzung bar bya ba tsam gyi phyir ma yin no snyam du rig nas tshul bzhin du chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba tsam gyi phyir ma yin no snyam du rig nas tshul bzhin du chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la zhugs pa yin te /
translated: Having understood this, he is properly engaged in the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: tha snyad dang sgra dang tshig lhur len pa ma yin pa 'di ni nyan thos phun sum tshogs pa dang po'o //üîΩde de ltar chos kyi rjes su @245b mthun pa'i chos la zhugs nas ngan ngon gyis chog par mi 'dzin te skyes bu cang shes bzang pos sa ji tsam bgrod par bya zhing thos par bya ba de thob pa kho nar 'gyur ba'i 'di ni nyan thos phun
analyzed: tha snyad dang sgra dang tshig lhur len pa ma yin pa 'di ni nyan thos phun sum tshogs pa dang po'o // de de ltar chos kyi rjes su @245b mthun pa'i chos la zhugs nas ngan ngon gyis chog par mi 'dzin te skyes bu cang shes bzang pos sa ji tsam bgrod par bya zhing thos par bya ba de thob pa kho nar 'gyur ba'i 'di ni nyan thos phun
translated: This is the first perfection of the disciple.

original: sum tshogs pa gnyis pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sum tshogs pa gnyis pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Having thus entered into the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma, he does not settle for a mere minimum, but rather attains the very highest level of learning and spiritual practice that a noble being can attain. This is the second perfection of the disciple.

original: gzhan yang legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la ston pa'i ston pa phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa gsum gyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la ston pa'i ston pa phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa gsum gyis rig par bya'o //
translated: The perfection of the teacher of the teaching of the well-expounded Dharma and Vinaya should be understood as threefold.

original: nyan thos kyi nyan thos phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa gnyis kyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi nyan thos phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa gnyis kyis rig par bya'o //
translated: The perfection of the disciple of the teaching of the well-expounded Dharma and Vinaya should be understood as twofold.

original: ston pa phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum gyis rig par bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: ston pa phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum gyis rig par bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the threefold perfection of the teacher?

original: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa thog ma kho nar mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i dbu ma'i lam nyan thos rnams la brda sprod par mdzad pa 'di ni phun sum tshogs pa dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di la de bzhin gshegs pa thog ma kho nar mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i dbu ma'i lam nyan thos rnams la brda sprod par mdzad pa 'di ni phun sum tshogs pa dang po'o //
translated: The first perfection is that the Tathagata first teaches the path of the middle way, which avoids the two extremes, to the disciples.

original: gzhan yang ma dad pa rnams dang / log par zhugs pa rnams bstan pa 'di la thabs legs par 'jug par mdzad pa 'di ni phun sum tshogs pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang ma dad pa rnams dang / log par zhugs pa rnams bstan pa 'di la thabs legs par 'jug par mdzad pa 'di ni phun sum tshogs pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second perfection is that he causes those who have no faith and those who have entered wrong paths to enter this teaching by means of skillful methods.

original: gzhan yang zhugs zin pa rnams chos bzhin du bsdu ba rnam pa bzhis sdud par mdzad pa 'di ni ston pa phun sum tshogs pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhugs zin pa rnams chos bzhin du bsdu ba rnam pa bzhis sdud par mdzad pa 'di ni ston pa phun sum tshogs pa gsum pa'o //
translated: The third perfection is that he attracts those who have entered the path by means of the four kinds of proper activities.

original: chos bzhin du bsdu ba rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos bzhin du bsdu ba rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four kinds of proper activities?

original: nang du yang dag 'jog pa'i gdams ngag 'tsham pa lkog tu ston te /
analyzed: nang du yang dag 'jog pa'i gdams ngag 'tsham pa lkog tu ston te /
translated: He gives appropriate instructions for the correct practice of meditation.

original: mi 'tsham pas ma yin pa dang / 'gal bar byed pa la mngon sum du 'tsham pa'i ngo bzlog gi tshig gis sma 'bebs te mi 'tsham pas ma yin pa dang / zhen pa la brten pa'i rtog pa rnams la nang gi zhi ba bstan pa dang /
analyzed: mi 'tsham pas ma yin pa dang / 'gal bar byed pa la mngon sum du 'tsham pa'i ngo bzlog gi tshig gis sma 'bebs te mi 'tsham pas ma yin pa dang / zhen pa la brten pa'i rtog pa rnams la nang gi zhi ba bstan pa dang /
translated: He teaches the inner pacification of the conceptual thoughts that are based on attachment.

original: rtag tu dus dus su dam pa'i chos nyan du gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu dus dus su dam pa'i chos nyan du gzhug pa'o //
translated: He causes them to listen to the holy Dharma at the appropriate time.

original: de la dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa dang / spyod pa dang 'gal ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma rtogs pa ni nang du yang dag 'jog pa'i gdams ngag 'tsham pa lkog tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa dang / spyod pa dang 'gal ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma rtogs pa ni nang du yang dag 'jog pa'i gdams ngag 'tsham pa lkog tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: The instruction in inner pacification is the appropriate secret teaching for those who have not understood the Dharma that is contrary to the practice, which is counterfeit as the holy Dharma.

original: 'gal bar byed pa bden pa dang sma dbab pas 'dul bar rig nas kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems kyis byed pa ni 'tsham par mngon sum du sma 'bebs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gal bar byed pa bden pa dang sma dbab pas 'dul bar rig nas kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems kyis byed pa ni 'tsham par mngon sum du sma 'bebs pa yin no //
translated: When he knows that the one who is to be corrected is to be disciplined by the truth and by censure, he censures him in public with an unafflicted mind.

original: bden pa rnam par nges pa'i tshul gyis 'dod pa'i yon tan rnams la zhugs pa'i rtog pa rnams la nyes par mthong nas mthar gyis bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar gyi zhen pa la @246a * //
analyzed: bden pa rnam par nges pa'i tshul gyis 'dod pa'i yon tan rnams la zhugs pa'i rtog pa rnams la nyes par mthong nas mthar gyis bsam gtan bzhi pa la snyoms par 'jug pa'i bar gyi zhen pa la @246a * //
translated: Having seen the faults of the discursive thoughts that are engaged in the objects of desire by the method of determining the truths, he gradually enters the fourth meditation.

original: brten pa'i rtog pa rnams zhi ba ni nang zhi ba yin no //
analyzed: brten pa'i rtog pa rnams zhi ba ni nang zhi ba yin no //
translated: The pacification of the discursive thoughts that are based on attachment is inner pacification.

original: bdag kyang yongs su ngal bar mi byed la gzhan dag kyang 'dzin du 'jug pa'i sgo nas ni rtag tu dus dus su dam pa'i chos nyan du gzhug pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag kyang yongs su ngal bar mi byed la gzhan dag kyang 'dzin du 'jug pa'i sgo nas ni rtag tu dus dus su dam pa'i chos nyan du gzhug pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that he always causes the Dharma to be heard at the proper time by not tiring himself and by engaging others.

original: nyan thos phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyan thos phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two kinds of perfection of the disciple?

original: 'di la nyan thos ni thog ma kho nar ston pa'i lta ba rung bar bya ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di la nyan thos ni thog ma kho nar ston pa'i lta ba rung bar bya ba 'di lta ste /
translated: Here, the disciple first makes the view of the teacher acceptable, that is,

analyzed: chos rnams la bdag med par lta ba la zhugs te /
translated: he enters into the view that dharmas are without self.

original: de ni chos rnams la bdag tu sgro btags nas log par mngon par zhen par yang mi byed la kun rdzob kyang chud gson par mi byed de lhag pa'i bsam pas rjes su 'gro bar yang mi byed la rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa las kyang 'gal bar
analyzed: de ni chos rnams la bdag tu sgro btags nas log par mngon par zhen par yang mi byed la kun rdzob kyang chud gson par mi byed de lhag pa'i bsam pas rjes su 'gro bar yang mi byed la rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa las kyang 'gal bar

original: mi byed pa 'di ni nyan thos phun sum tshogs pa dang po'o //
analyzed: mi byed pa 'di ni nyan thos phun sum tshogs pa dang po'o //
translated: This is the first perfection of the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: de lta ba rung bar byas pa la zhugs nas /üîΩchos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la nan tan du sgrub cing chos bzhin du bsdu ba rnam pa bzhis bsdus pas chos gang sdug bsngal ba dang bcas shing phongs pa dang bcas pa de dag ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes nas
analyzed: de lta ba rung bar byas pa la zhugs nas / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la nan tan du sgrub cing chos bzhin du bsdu ba rnam pa bzhis bsdus pas chos gang sdug bsngal ba dang bcas shing phongs pa dang bcas pa de dag ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes nas
translated: Having engaged in that which is suitable to see,üîΩhe practices in accordance with the Dharma and accomplishes the Dharma. By gathering through the four kinds of gathering, he fully understands

original: spong bar byed do //
analyzed: spong bar byed do //
translated: and abandons those phenomena that are associated with suffering and deprivation.

analyzed: chos gang sdug bsngal ba med cing phongs pa med pa de dag ni mngon sum du byed de /
translated: He actualizes those phenomena that are free from suffering and deprivation.

original: 'di ni nyan thos phun sum tshogs pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni nyan thos phun sum tshogs pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the second perfection of the disciples.

original: de ltar na ston pa dang / nyan thos phun sum tshogs pas bsdus pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi bstan pa 'di ni gcig tu nges par kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnam par dag pa mkhas pa rnams kyis 'jug par bya ba'i 'os yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na ston pa dang / nyan thos phun sum tshogs pas bsdus pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi bstan pa 'di ni gcig tu nges par kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnam par dag pa mkhas pa rnams kyis 'jug par bya ba'i 'os yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the teaching of the Buddhas, which is included in the perfection of the teacher and the perfection of the disciples, is to be known as being absolutely without defilement, as being pure, as being worthy of being entered by the wise.

original: gzhi bsdu ba las skye mched rab tu rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba ste bsdu ba gnyis pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: gzhi bsdu ba las skye mched rab tu rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba ste bsdu ba gnyis pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the second chapter on the analysis of the sense bases in the Compendium of Bases.

original: // / spyi sdom ni /
analyzed: // / spyi sdom ni /
translated: The general summary:

original: rnam par gzhag par bya ba dang // kun rdzob dang ni don dam dang // reg pa'i rkyen dang srid 'gag dang // zas su 'gyur ba tha ma yin //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag par bya ba dang // kun rdzob dang ni don dam dang // reg pa'i rkyen dang srid 'gag dang // zas su 'gyur ba tha ma yin //
