analyzed: sdom ni / rnam par gzhag par bya ba dang // sdug bsngal phung po bden pa brtag / bstan pa yongs su bsdu ba dang // shes pa cha phra mtha' brtag dang // dpyod dang mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang // zab mo yang ni tha ma yin //
translated: The analysis of investigation, overestimation, and the profound.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum @246b du rnam par gzhag par bya ste /üîΩsngon gyi mtha' nas dbus kyi mthar ji ltar 'byung ba dang / dbus kyi mtha' nas phyi ma'i mthar ji ltar 'byung ba dang / ji ltar dbus kyi mthar byung ste 'dug pa rnam par byang bar yang 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum @246b du rnam par gzhag par bya ste / sngon gyi mtha' nas dbus kyi mthar ji ltar 'byung ba dang / dbus kyi mtha' nas phyi ma'i mthar ji ltar 'byung ba dang / ji ltar dbus kyi mthar byung ste 'dug pa rnam par byang bar yang 'gyur ba'o //
translated: In brief, dependent origination should be presented in three parts:üîΩHow it occurs from the prior limit to the present, how it occurs from the present to the future, and how it occurs in the present and is purified.

original: de la sngon gyi mtha' nas dbus kyi mthar ji ltar byung ba dang byung nas kyang dbus kyi mthar ji ltar 'dug ce na /
analyzed: de la sngon gyi mtha' nas dbus kyi mthar ji ltar byung ba dang byung nas kyang dbus kyi mthar ji ltar 'dug ce na /
translated: How does it occur from the prior limit to the present? And how does it occur from the present to the future?

original: ji ltar 'di ni kha cig snga nas mi mkhas pas ma rig pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis las byas shing bsags te de'i rnam par shes pa yang las de'i rjes su 'gro zhing 'chi ba'i dus byed par ma gyur gyi bar du rjes su 'brang ste /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di ni kha cig snga nas mi mkhas pas ma rig pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyis las byas shing bsags te de'i rnam par shes pa yang las de'i rjes su 'gro zhing 'chi ba'i dus byed par ma gyur gyi bar du rjes su 'brang ste /
translated: Just as it is said, ‚ÄúHere, due to the condition of ignorance, some, due to being unskilled from the beginning, create and accumulate meritorious, non-meritorious, and unshakable karma with body, speech, and mind, and until their consciousness follows after that karma and the time of death occurs, it follows after it.

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyur gyur la nang dang phyi rol gyi sred pa yang rnam par shes pa de'i 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa'i tshe grogs byed pa'i tshul gyis nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyur gyur la nang dang phyi rol gyi sred pa yang rnam par shes pa de'i 'bras bu mngon par 'grub pa'i tshe grogs byed pa'i tshul gyis nye bar gnas so //
translated: When it becomes the cause of the consciousness that links to the next birth, craving for internal and external things abides as a companion that assists in the actualization of the result of that consciousness.‚Äù

original: de 'chi ba'i dus byas nas sngon gyi mtha' nas da ltar gyi dus su lus mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te mthar gyis ma'i mngal du rgyu'i rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis nying mtshams sbyor ba'i 'bras bu'i rnam par shes pa 'di lta ste /üîΩmer mer po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyis gong nas gong du mngal na gnas pa de ming dang gzugs nas 'khogs pa la thug pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de 'chi ba'i dus byas nas sngon gyi mtha' nas da ltar gyi dus su lus mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te mthar gyis ma'i mngal du rgyu'i rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis nying mtshams sbyor ba'i 'bras bu'i rnam par shes pa 'di lta ste / mer mer po la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyis gong nas gong du mngal na gnas pa de ming dang gzugs nas 'khogs pa la thug pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: When that person dies, the consciousness that is the cause, in the present, of the formation of the body, connects with the consciousness that is the result of the karma accumulated in the past.üîΩIn this way, the consciousness gradually enters the mother‚Äôs womb and, through the different stages of the embryo, the fetus, and so on, the being in the womb develops until birth.

original: nying mtshams sbyor bar sbyar ba'i mod la rnam par shes pa de skye bar 'gyur ba'i las gang yin pa de ni rnam par smin pa'i sgo nas 'bras bu smin zin pa yin no //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor bar sbyar ba'i mod la rnam par shes pa de skye bar 'gyur ba'i las gang yin pa de ni rnam par smin pa'i sgo nas 'bras bu smin zin pa yin no //
translated: The karma that causes the consciousness to connect with the womb and be reborn is already the result of a previous ripening.

original: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i rnam pa shes pa de yang ming dang gzugs de nyid la gnas shing 'dug go //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i rnam pa shes pa de yang ming dang gzugs de nyid la gnas shing 'dug go //
translated: The consciousness that arises from that ripening is called ‚Äúname-and-form.‚Äù

original: de yang mi ga la sogs pa rten drug po rnams la gnas shing 'dug ste /
analyzed: de yang mi ga la sogs pa rten drug po rnams la gnas shing 'dug ste /
translated: It is located in the six sense bases such as the eyes.

original: des na ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: des na ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called consciousness conditioned by name and form.

original: dbang po'i gzugs ni lhan cig byung ba dang / ming 'gags ma thag pa ni rnam par shes pa drug po rnams kyi mthun mthun gyi rten yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i gzugs ni lhan cig byung ba dang / ming 'gags ma thag pa ni rnam par shes pa drug po rnams kyi mthun mthun gyi rten yin te /
translated: The form of the sense faculties is the simultaneous support of the six consciousnesses, and the immediately past state of name is the support of the six consciousnesses.

original: de la brten nas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du rnam par shes pa 'jug par 'gyur ro //üîΩdbang po gzugs can lnga'i rten ni dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po @247a * //
analyzed: de la brten nas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du rnam par shes pa 'jug par 'gyur ro // dbang po gzugs can lnga'i rten ni dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po @247a * //
translated: Consciousness operates in dependence on that until the end of life.üîΩThe support of the five physical sense faculties is the great elements of the sense faculties and the form generated by the great elements that are the abode of the sense faculties.

original: rnams dang / dbang po'i gnas 'byung ba chen pos bskyed pa'i gzugs yin pa dang / ming gang yin pa ste gang gis dbang po rnams zin cing rgyud la gtogs la rgyun gyis gnas pa de gnyi ga bsdus pa ni rjes su 'jug pa'i rten yin te /
analyzed: rnams dang / dbang po'i gnas 'byung ba chen pos bskyed pa'i gzugs yin pa dang / ming gang yin pa ste gang gis dbang po rnams zin cing rgyud la gtogs la rgyun gyis gnas pa de gnyi ga bsdus pa ni rjes su 'jug pa'i rten yin te /
translated: Name is that which sustains the sense faculties, belongs to the continuum and remains in a continuum. Both of these are the support of engagement.

original: de ltar na rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Thus, name-and-form has consciousness as its condition, and consciousness has name-and-form as its condition.

original: de ltar gyi dus na tshe'i tshad ji srid kyi bar du mdung khyim gyi tshul du 'dug go //
analyzed: de ltar gyi dus na tshe'i tshad ji srid kyi bar du mdung khyim gyi tshul du 'dug go //
translated: In this way, they exist like a bundle of reeds for as long as life lasts.

original: de ltar na sngon gyi mtha' nas dbus kyi mthar 'du byed rnams kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba skye bar 'gyur la skyes zin pa rnams kyang dbus kyi mthar 'jug go //
analyzed: de ltar na sngon gyi mtha' nas dbus kyi mthar 'du byed rnams kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba skye bar 'gyur la skyes zin pa rnams kyang dbus kyi mthar 'jug go //
translated: Thus, from the prior limit to the middle limit, the members arise in dependence on each other. And, having arisen, they continue to exist in the middle limit.

original: de la mngal nas skye ba'i skye gnas can gyi 'jug pa'i rim pa ni de yin te /
analyzed: de la mngal nas skye ba'i skye gnas can gyi 'jug pa'i rim pa ni de yin te /
translated: This is the order of entry for those who are born from a womb.

original: sgo nga las skye ba dang / drod gsher las skye ba ni ma'i mngal ma gtogs par gzhan thams cad snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sgo nga las skye ba dang / drod gsher las skye ba ni ma'i mngal ma gtogs par gzhan thams cad snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: For those born from eggs and for those born from moisture and heat, the order of entry should be understood in the same way, except for the mother‚Äôs womb.

original: sems can gzugs can 'dod pa na spyod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa rnams las rdzus te skye ba'i skye gnas can ni dbang po yongs su rdzogs bzhin du skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can gzugs can 'dod pa na spyod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa rnams las rdzus te skye ba'i skye gnas can ni dbang po yongs su rdzogs bzhin du skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Sentient beings who are born spontaneously in the realm of desire or the realm of form are born with complete faculties.

original: khyad par ni de yod do //
analyzed: khyad par ni de yod do //
translated: There is a difference, however,

original: gzugs med pa dag ni rnam par shes pa ming la yang brten la gzugs kyi sa bon la yang brten to /
analyzed: gzugs med pa dag ni rnam par shes pa ming la yang brten la gzugs kyi sa bon la yang brten to /
translated: Name-and-form in the formless realm is supported by consciousness and by the seed of form.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi sa bon yang rnam par shes pa la brten cing 'dug ste /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi sa bon yang rnam par shes pa la brten cing 'dug ste /
translated: The seed of name-and-form is supported by consciousness and remains there.

original: gzugs kyi rgyun chad zin pa las kyang gzugs kyi sa bon de las phyi ma la 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rgyun chad zin pa las kyang gzugs kyi sa bon de las phyi ma la 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Even when the stream of form is interrupted, the seed of form arises again later from that seed.

original: 'di la yang bye brag ni de yod do //
analyzed: 'di la yang bye brag ni de yod do //
translated: There is a difference here, however.

original: bsod nams kyi las kyis ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du skye'o //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi las kyis ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha dang mi rnams kyi nang du skye'o //
translated: By meritorious action, one is born among the gods and humans of the realm of desire.

original: bsod nams ma yin pas ni ngan song rnams su'o //
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pas ni ngan song rnams su'o //
translated: By non-meritorious action, one is born in the unfortunate planes of existence.

original: mi g-yo bas ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo bas ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa rnams su'o //
translated: By unmoving action, one is born in the realm of form and the formless realm.

original: dbus kyi mtha' nas phyi ma'i mthar 'du byed rnams kyi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni ji ltar skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: dbus kyi mtha' nas phyi ma'i mthar 'du byed rnams kyi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni ji ltar skye bar 'gyur /
translated: How does the dependent origination of compounded phenomena occur from the middle to the end?

original: ji ltar na mi skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar na mi skye bar 'gyur /
translated: How does it not occur?

original: ji ltar ni ma skyes pa las rnam par byang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar ni ma skyes pa las rnam par byang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does purification occur from that which has not arisen?

original: de ltar dbus kyi mthar byung ba'i gang zag des ni sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar dbus kyi mthar byung ba'i gang zag des ni sngon gyi las kyi 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the person who has arisen in the middle of cyclic existence experiences two types of results of former karma:

original: nang gi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / yul las skyes pa'i tshor ba'i dbang gi @247b 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: nang gi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / yul las skyes pa'i tshor ba'i dbang gi @247b 'bras bu'o //
translated: the internal result of karmic maturation and the result of the power of feeling born from objects.

original: de ni dam pa'i chos ma yin pa la brten pa'am /
analyzed: de ni dam pa'i chos ma yin pa la brten pa'am /
translated: He is attached to the non-Dharma or,

original: yang na sngon goms pas 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis la kun du rmongs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na sngon goms pas 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis la kun du rmongs par 'gyur te /
translated: alternatively, he is confused about the two results due to former habituation.

original: de nang gi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu la kun du rmongs pas yang srid par skye ba mngon par 'grub pa sdug bsngal yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes so //
analyzed: de nang gi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu la kun du rmongs pas yang srid par skye ba mngon par 'grub pa sdug bsngal yin par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes so //
translated: Because of delusion regarding the internal ripened result, one does not know as it really is the suffering that is the actualization of rebirth.

original: de sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha'i ma rig pa'i dbang gis snga ma bzhin du 'du byed rnams byed cing sogs te /
analyzed: de sngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha'i ma rig pa'i dbang gis snga ma bzhin du 'du byed rnams byed cing sogs te /
translated: Because of ignorance regarding the prior limit and the subsequent limit, one performs the formative forces as before, and so on.

original: de'i rnam par shes pa de tshe 'di nyid la las gsar du byed pa las de'i rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i rnam par shes pa de tshe 'di nyid la las gsar du byed pa las de'i rjes su 'gro bar 'gyur te /
translated: That consciousness of his follows after the karma that is newly performed in this life.

original: de ltar na ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams skye la 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa skye'o //
analyzed: de ltar na ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams skye la 'du byed rnams kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa skye'o //
translated: Thus, the formative forces arise with ignorance as their condition, and consciousness arises with the formative forces as its condition.

original: rnam par shes pa de yang tshe 'di la rgyur gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de yang tshe 'di la rgyur gyur ba ste /
translated: That consciousness is the cause in this life.

original: phyi ma la mngon par 'grub pa'i rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi ma la mngon par 'grub pa'i rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it holds the result of consciousness that will be actualized in the next life.

original: rgyud thams cad kyi sgo nas ni rnam par shes pa drug gi tshogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyud thams cad kyi sgo nas ni rnam par shes pa drug gi tshogs zhes bya'o //
translated: By means of the continuum, it is called the collection of the six groups of consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa de yang phyi ma la yang srid par skye ba'i ming dang gzugs kyi sa bon dang ldan no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de yang phyi ma la yang srid par skye ba'i ming dang gzugs kyi sa bon dang ldan no //
translated: That consciousness is endowed with the seed of name-and-form that will produce the next existence.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi sa bon de yang phyi ma la yang srid par skye ba'i skye mched drug gi sa bon dang ldan no //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi sa bon de yang phyi ma la yang srid par skye ba'i skye mched drug gi sa bon dang ldan no //
translated: That seed of name-and-form is endowed with the seed of the six sense bases that will produce the next existence.

original: skye mched drug gi sa bon de yang phyi ma la yang srid par skye ba'i rig pa'i sa bon dang ldan no //
analyzed: skye mched drug gi sa bon de yang phyi ma la yang srid par skye ba'i rig pa'i sa bon dang ldan no //
translated: That seed of the six sense bases is endowed with the seed of contact that will produce the next existence.

original: reg pa'i sa bon de yang phyi ma la yang srid par skye ba'i tshor ba'i sa bon dang ldan te /
analyzed: reg pa'i sa bon de yang phyi ma la yang srid par skye ba'i tshor ba'i sa bon dang ldan te /
translated: That seed of contact is endowed with the seed of feeling that will produce the next existence.

original: 'di yang yang srid par skye ba'i dbus kyi mthar 'phen pa'i rgyu yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di yang yang srid par skye ba'i dbus kyi mthar 'phen pa'i rgyu yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood as the cause that propels the middle part of the next existence.

original: des na rnam par shes pa la sogs pa nas tshor ba la thug pa'i lus mtha' dag 'phangs so //
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa la sogs pa nas tshor ba la thug pa'i lus mtha' dag 'phangs so //
translated: Therefore, from consciousness up to feeling, the entire body is projected.

original: de de ltar rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu la kun du rmongs pa snga ma shos kyis yang srid par skye bar 'phangs nas yul las skyes pa'i 'bras bu la kun du rmongs pa cig shos kyi yul gyi tshor ba la dmigs pa'i sred pa skyed par byed
analyzed: de de ltar rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu la kun du rmongs pa snga ma shos kyis yang srid par skye bar 'phangs nas yul las skyes pa'i 'bras bu la kun du rmongs pa cig shos kyi yul gyi tshor ba la dmigs pa'i sred pa skyed par byed
translated: Having been impelled to rebirth in a new existence by the former delusion regarding the ripened effect, he generates craving that focuses on the feeling of the object, the latter delusion regarding the effect born from the object.

original: do // sred pa des ni 'dod pa yongs su tshol ba'am /
analyzed: do // sred pa des ni 'dod pa yongs su tshol ba'am /
translated: Through that craving, he seeks either sense objects or

original: srid pa yongs su tshol bar byed de 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa'am /
analyzed: srid pa yongs su tshol bar byed de 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa'am /
translated: existence. He takes up the appropriation of sense objects or

original: lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa len par byed de /üîΩnye bar len pa blangs @248a * //
analyzed: lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs dang / bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa len par byed de / nye bar len pa blangs @248a * //
translated: the appropriation of the self-theories of eternalism and annihilationism, wrong ethics and rituals, and wrong view.

original: pa'i srid pa'i nye bar len pa dang bcas shing ldan pa /
analyzed: pa'i srid pa'i nye bar len pa dang bcas shing ldan pa /
translated: Having taken up the appropriation, he is endowed with the appropriation of existence.

original: 'phen pa'i rgyu snga ma la ni srid pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'phen pa'i rgyu snga ma la ni srid pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The former projecting cause is called existence.

original: skye ba mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyus bsdus pa'i srid pa'i 'og tu 'chi ba'i dus byas nas /
analyzed: skye ba mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyus bsdus pa'i srid pa'i 'og tu 'chi ba'i dus byas nas /
translated: After death, he is reborn in a new existence through the cause that actualizes birth.

original: 'phen pa'i rgyus ji ltar 'phangs pa'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed rnams tshor ba la thug pa yan chad rim gyis sam /üîΩcig car 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'phen pa'i rgyus ji ltar 'phangs pa'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i 'du byed rnams tshor ba la thug pa yan chad rim gyis sam / cig car 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The active forces, consciousness, etc., projected by the projecting cause, arise in succession or simultaneously up to the feeling.

original: de ltar na tshe 'di la ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa /
analyzed: de ltar na tshe 'di la ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa /
translated: Thus, in this life, craving arises due to the condition of feeling which arises from the contact of ignorance.

original: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa /üîΩlen pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa /
analyzed: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa / len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa /
translated: Clinging arises due to the condition of craving.üîΩExistence arises due to the condition of clinging.

original: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba ;
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba ;
translated: Birth arises due to the condition of existence.

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi khyad par rnams skye ba'i gnas kha cig tu mngon par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga ba dang na ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi khyad par rnams skye ba'i gnas kha cig tu mngon par 'gyur ro //
translated: Due to the condition of birth, the various sufferings such as old age, sickness, death, etc., arise in some places.

original: kha cig tu ni sa bon dang 'brel bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni sa bon dang 'brel bar rig par bya'o //
translated: In some places, it should be known that they are connected with seeds.

original: de ltar na dbus kyi mtha'i ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed dang / tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa la brten nas phyi ma'i mthar 'du byed rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na dbus kyi mtha'i ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed dang / tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa la brten nas phyi ma'i mthar 'du byed rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the active forces arise in the future due to the condition of craving which is based on the active forces and feeling due to the condition of ignorance at the middle limit.

original: gal te gzhan gyi sgra'am /üîΩsngon gyi tshogs la brten te /üîΩtshe 'di la 'bras bur gyur ba'i 'du byed rnams dang / de dag gi rgyu dang / de dag 'gog pa dang / 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam tshul bzhin du yid la byed na ni de tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'i rgyus yang dag pa'i lta ba yang bskyed pa la bden pa rnams la rim gyis slob pa dang mi slob pa'i ye shes mthong ba rnam par dag pa
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi sgra'am / sngon gyi tshogs la brten te / tshe 'di la 'bras bur gyur ba'i 'du byed rnams dang / de dag gi rgyu dang / de dag 'gog pa dang / 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam tshul bzhin du yid la byed na ni de tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'i rgyus yang dag pa'i lta ba yang bskyed pa la bden pa rnams la rim gyis slob pa dang mi slob pa'i ye shes mthong ba rnam par dag pa
translated: If, in this life, one correctly reflects on the formative forces that are the result, their cause, their cessation, and the path that leads to their cessation,

original: yang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: then, by the cause of correct reflection, one will again attain the pure seeing of the knowledge of the path of insight into the truths, both in the sense of training and of no longer training, with regard to the truths.

original: de ye shes mthong ba des ma rig pa de dang / sred pa de yang ma lus par spong ngo //
analyzed: de ye shes mthong ba des ma rig pa de dang / sred pa de yang ma lus par spong ngo //
translated: By that knowledge of insight, one will completely eliminate that ignorance and that craving.

original: de spangs pas de'i dmigs pa gang yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma shes pas ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba gang yin pa de yang spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de spangs pas de'i dmigs pa gang yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma shes pas ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba gang yin pa de yang spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By eliminating them, one will also eliminate the feeling that arises from the contact that is the coming together of ignorance and that is not the correct understanding of things as they are, which is the object of that ignorance.

original: de spangs pas ma rig pa dang bral ba'i phyir tshe 'di nyid la shes rab rnam par grol ba mngon sum du byed do //
analyzed: de spangs pas ma rig pa dang bral ba'i phyir tshe 'di nyid la shes rab rnam par grol ba mngon sum du byed do //
translated: Because of the abandonment of that, he is free from ignorance, and therefore he actualizes the liberation of wisdom in this very life.

original: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems gang yin pa la mtshungs par ldan pa'i sred pa dang 'dod chags yod pa gang yin pa de yang sems de las bral ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral bas sems rnam par grol ba mngon sum du byed do //üîΩde'i ma rig pa 'gags @248b pas ma rig pa ma spangs par yod pa la 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems gang yin pa la mtshungs par ldan pa'i sred pa dang 'dod chags yod pa gang yin pa de yang sems de las bral ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral bas sems rnam par grol ba mngon sum du byed do // de'i ma rig pa 'gags @248b pas ma rig pa ma spangs par yod pa la 'du byed dang rnam par shes pa la sogs pa nas /
translated: The craving and attachment that are associated with the feeling that arises from contact that is accompanied by ignorance are also associated with that mind. When he is free from that mind and free from attachment, he actualizes the liberation of the mind.

original: tshor ba la thug gi bar du phyi ma'i mtha' las brtsams te skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dag kyang mi skye ba la mi skye ba'i chos can du yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshor ba la thug gi bar du phyi ma'i mtha' las brtsams te skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dag kyang mi skye ba la mi skye ba'i chos can du yang 'gyur te /
translated: Because his ignorance ceases, the formations, consciousness, and so on, up to feeling that exist in the future, which would arise from the non-abandonment of ignorance, will not arise. They will not arise and will not come into existence.

original: de bas na ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag pa'i rim gyis rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i reg pa 'gags pas rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'i bar du 'gag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na ma rig pa 'gags pas 'du byed 'gag pa'i rim gyis rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i reg pa 'gags pas rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'i bar du 'gag ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that through the cessation of ignorance, the formations cease, and so on up to: through the cessation of the contact that arises from ripening, the feeling that arises from ripening ceases.

original: tshe 'di la ma rig pa 'gags pas ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa 'gag / ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa 'gags pas ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba 'gag / ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor
analyzed: tshe 'di la ma rig pa 'gags pas ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa 'gag / ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa 'gags pas ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba 'gag / ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor
translated: In this life, through the cessation of ignorance, the contact that is due to ignorance ceases; through the cessation of the contact that is due to ignorance, the feeling that arises from the contact that is due to ignorance ceases; through the cessation of the feeling that arises from the contact that is due to ignorance, craving ceases.

original: ba 'gags pas sred pa 'gag / sred pa 'gags pas snga ma bzhin du mi skye ba'i chos can gyis len pa la sogs pa nas 'khrug pa yan chad kyi 'du byed rnams 'gag ces bya'o ;
analyzed: ba 'gags pas sred pa 'gag / sred pa 'gags pas snga ma bzhin du mi skye ba'i chos can gyis len pa la sogs pa nas 'khrug pa yan chad kyi 'du byed rnams 'gag ces bya'o ;
translated: Through the cessation of craving, the grasping that is due to the non-arising of phenomena ceases, and so on up to: through the cessation of becoming, the formations cease.

original: / de ltar na tshe 'di la 'du byed de rnams 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de ltar na tshe 'di la 'du byed de rnams 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, in this life, those formations do not come into existence.

original: mi 'jug na tshe 'di la phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su tshe 'di'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi 'jug na tshe 'di la phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su tshe 'di'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does not enter, then in the realm of nirvƒÅ·πáa without remainder in this life, one attains nirvƒÅ·πáa in this life.

original: de'i tshe de'i rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs /
translated: At that time, due to the condition of consciousness, there is name-and-form.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis kyang rnam par shes pa yongs su dag pa rnam par byang ba'i lus so //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis kyang rnam par shes pa yongs su dag pa rnam par byang ba'i lus so //
translated: And due to the condition of name-and-form, there is the body of pure and purified consciousness.

original: ji srid du de'i rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus gnas pa de srid du mi ldan pa'i tshor ba myong ste ldan pa'i ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji srid du de'i rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus gnas pa de srid du mi ldan pa'i tshor ba myong ste ldan pa'i ni ma yin no //
translated: For as long as that body with consciousness remains, for that long one experiences non-associated feeling, not associated feeling.

original: de'i rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus de yang sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa'i tshe'i tshad ji srid yod pa de srid du gnas so //
analyzed: de'i rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus de yang sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa'i tshe'i tshad ji srid yod pa de srid du gnas so //
translated: And that body with consciousness remains for as long as the lifespan projected by previous karma exists.

original: nam de'i tshe zad pa na rnam par shes pas zin pa'i lus dang srog gi dbang po yang spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nam de'i tshe zad pa na rnam par shes pas zin pa'i lus dang srog gi dbang po yang spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: When that lifespan is exhausted, the body and life faculty that are conjoined with consciousness are also abandoned.

original: srog gi dbang po 'di phan chad ma lus par mthar thug par 'gyur te phyis rnam par smin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po 'di phan chad ma lus par mthar thug par 'gyur te phyis rnam par smin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: This life faculty will not continue beyond this point, and there will be no further ripening.

original: rnam par shes pa de yang tshor ba thams cad dang bcas te 'dir rang gi ngang gis 'gag pa dang snga nas kyang rgyu 'gags pa'i phyir gzhan du mtshams sbyor ba med pas ma lus par 'gag ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de yang tshor ba thams cad dang bcas te 'dir rang gi ngang gis 'gag pa dang snga nas kyang rgyu 'gags pa'i phyir gzhan du mtshams sbyor ba med pas ma lus par 'gag ste /
translated: That consciousness, along with all its feelings, will cease naturally right here, and since the cause has already ceased, it will not link up with another existence. Thus, it will cease completely.

original: 'di ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings gtan du zhi ba'i gnas yin te /üîΩde @249a * //
analyzed: 'di ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings gtan du zhi ba'i gnas yin te / de @249a * //
translated: This is the sphere of nirvana without remainder, the state of peace that lasts forever.

original: bas na bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du tshangs par spyod pa mya ngan las 'das par nye bar 'gro ba mthar mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba spyod par byed de de bas na 'di ni sngon gyi mtha' nas dbus kyi mthar 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: bas na bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du tshangs par spyod pa mya ngan las 'das par nye bar 'gro ba mthar mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba spyod par byed de de bas na 'di ni sngon gyi mtha' nas dbus kyi mthar 'jug pa dang /
translated: Therefore, in the presence of the Blessed One, they practice pure conduct that leads to nirvana and will attain the ultimate nirvana. Thus, they enter from the prior limit to the limit of the end.

original: dbus kyi mtha' nas phyi ma'i mthar 'jug pa dang / dbus kyi mthar 'jug cing rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang rnam pa gsum gyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnam par gzhag pa rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dbus kyi mtha' nas phyi ma'i mthar 'jug pa dang / dbus kyi mthar 'jug cing rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang rnam pa gsum gyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba rnam par gzhag pa rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The extensive teaching of the establishment of dependent origination is by means of three topics: the engagement of the middle from the end, the engagement of the end from the middle and the engagement of the end from the middle and the purification.

original: rnam pa dgus sdug bsngal zhing 'dug pa'i yang srid par skye ba'i shing phyi ma la bskyed pa'i phyir mi mkhas pas tshe 'di la gsar du las byas pa gang yin pa de ni de'i sdug bsngal gyi shing gzhon nu lta bu yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa dgus sdug bsngal zhing 'dug pa'i yang srid par skye ba'i shing phyi ma la bskyed pa'i phyir mi mkhas pas tshe 'di la gsar du las byas pa gang yin pa de ni de'i sdug bsngal gyi shing gzhon nu lta bu yin te /
translated: The unwise create karma anew in this life and that is like the young tree of their suffering.

original: gal te mi mkhas pa des zag pa'i gnas kyi chos rnams la da ltar gyi dus kyi sgo nas ni mnog yod par mthong la 'das pa'i dus kyi sgo nas ni lta ba dang ldan pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi sgo nas ni sems 'dogs par byed na de ltar gnas pa de ni sngon ma spangs pa'i srid pa la goms par byas pas yang rgyas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te mi mkhas pa des zag pa'i gnas kyi chos rnams la da ltar gyi dus kyi sgo nas ni mnog yod par mthong la 'das pa'i dus kyi sgo nas ni lta ba dang ldan pa dang / ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi sgo nas ni sems 'dogs par byed na de ltar gnas pa de ni sngon ma spangs pa'i srid pa la goms par byas pas yang rgyas par 'gyur te /
translated: If the unwise person sees the phenomena that are the basis of defilement as existent in the present, as having views in the past and as mentally labeling in the future, then that person who abides in that way will again increase through habituation to existence that was not previously abandoned.

original: de ltar mi mkhas pa'i gang zag de ni yang srid par skye ba'i shing gzhon nu de'i grub pa dang bde ba 'dod pa yin la sred pa'i chags pas kyang brlan pas na snga ma bzhin du len pa'i 'bras bu'i rim gyis phyi ma la yang yongs suüîΩrdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar mi mkhas pa'i gang zag de ni yang srid par skye ba'i shing gzhon nu de'i grub pa dang bde ba 'dod pa yin la sred pa'i chags pas kyang brlan pas na snga ma bzhin du len pa'i 'bras bu'i rim gyis phyi ma la yang yongs suüîΩrdzogs par byed do //
translated: Thus, that unwise person desires the establishment and happiness of the young tree of birth in existence and since he is moistened by the attachment of craving, as before, he will perfect the result of grasping in the future through its stages.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa ni yang srid par skye ba'i las dang yang srid par skye ba'i sdug bsngal gyis shing gzhon nu lta bu la zag pa dang bcas pa byas su zin kyang nyon mongs pa'i gnas kyi 'du byed rnams la skye ba
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa ni yang srid par skye ba'i las dang yang srid par skye ba'i sdug bsngal gyis shing gzhon nu lta bu la zag pa dang bcas pa byas su zin kyang nyon mongs pa'i gnas kyi 'du byed rnams la skye ba
translated: The noble ≈õrƒÅvaka who has heard the teachings, even though he has created contaminated actions like a young tree, sees the formations that are the basis of affliction as having the qualities of arising and disintegration.

original: dang 'jig pa'i chos can du mthong la spong ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa'i khams rnams la yang zhi ba nyid du mthong bas sred pa'i chags bas sbyor ba med pa'i phyir las de 'grib par byed kyi 'phel bar mi byed do //
analyzed: dang 'jig pa'i chos can du mthong la spong ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa'i khams rnams la yang zhi ba nyid du mthong bas sred pa'i chags bas sbyor ba med pa'i phyir las de 'grib par byed kyi 'phel bar mi byed do //
translated: He sees the realms of abandonment, freedom from attachment, and cessation as peace. Since he is not bound by the attachment of craving, he diminishes that action and does not increase it.

original: de bas na mkhas pa de ni shong gzhon nu de'i grub pa dang bde ba 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na mkhas pa de ni shong gzhon nu de'i grub pa dang bde ba 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the wise one does not desire the establishment and happiness of the young tree.

original: srid pa dang srid pa'i rkyen gyis len pa la sogs pa spangs nas yang srid par skye shing de nyid ci nas thams cad kyi thams cad du med par 'gyur ba de lta bur de yang sel bar byed na phyi ma la 'phel bar lta ga la 'gyur
analyzed: srid pa dang srid pa'i rkyen gyis len pa la sogs pa spangs nas yang srid par skye shing de nyid ci nas thams cad kyi thams cad du med par 'gyur ba de lta bur de yang sel bar byed na phyi ma la 'phel bar lta ga la 'gyur
translated: Having abandoned existence and the appropriation conditioned by existence and so on, if one also eliminates that existence, then how could it increase in the future?

original: @249b gzhan yang 'di na gang zag lus mngon par 'grub pa kha cig gis sngon lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las byas shing bsags pa de tshe 'di la ldan te de'i lus de dang lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las de gcig tu
analyzed: @249b gzhan yang 'di na gang zag lus mngon par 'grub pa kha cig gis sngon lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las byas shing bsags pa de tshe 'di la ldan te de'i lus de dang lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las de gcig tu
translated: Moreover, some individuals who establish a body have karma that is accumulated and created to be experienced in other lives and they possess that karma in this life.

original: bsdus pa ni yang srid par skye ba'i shing chen po zhes bya ste ;
analyzed: bsdus pa ni yang srid par skye ba'i shing chen po zhes bya ste ;
translated: The combination of that body and the karma to be experienced in other lives is called the great tree of birth in existence.

original: gal te nyon mongs pa dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la snga ma bzhin du sems 'dogs pa'i bar gyi gnas par gyur na de'i lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las snga ma gang yin pa de ni rtsa ba thur du zug pa dang 'dra bar shingüîΩde'i mdangs gso ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la snga ma bzhin du sems 'dogs pa'i bar gyi gnas par gyur na de'i lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las snga ma gang yin pa de ni rtsa ba thur du zug pa dang 'dra bar shing de'i mdangs gso ba yin no //
translated: The former karma that is to be experienced in this life will be like the trunk of the tree that is driven upward.

original: tshe 'di'i dus gsum gyi sred pa'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de ni rtsa ba'i yal ga dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: tshe 'di'i dus gsum gyi sred pa'i nyon mongs pa gang yin pa de ni rtsa ba'i yal ga dang 'dra ste /
translated: The afflictions of craving in the three times of this life are like the main branches of the tree.

original: shing de'i bcud gso ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shing de'i bcud gso ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that they are the sap of the tree.üîΩThe karma and afflictions that arise from that are like the leaves of the tree.üîΩThe consciousness endowed with all seeds, which is endowed with that karma and those afflictions, will be like the fruit of the tree.

original: de'i rgyu las byung ba las dang nyon mongs pa de dang ldan pa sa bon thams cad dang ldan pa'i rnam par shes pas ni phyi ma la nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe ming dang gzugs la gnas thod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu las byung ba las dang nyon mongs pa de dang ldan pa sa bon thams cad dang ldan pa'i rnam par shes pas ni phyi ma la nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe ming dang gzugs la gnas thod par 'gyur ro //
translated: When it is time for the consciousness to be reborn in the next life, it will be like the fruit falling to the ground and the seed being planted in the earth.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyis shing de ni yun ring por gnas pa yin la gang zag de yang de'i grub pa dang bde ba 'dod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal gyis shing de ni yun ring por gnas pa yin la gang zag de yang de'i grub pa dang bde ba 'dod par rig par bya ste /
translated: Thus, the tree is long-lasting, and the person is known to desire its production and happiness.

original: 'di ni dkar po'i phyogs kyang snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni dkar po'i phyogs kyang snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The white side should be understood as before.

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten pa'i lam snga ma dang / 'jig rten pa'i slob dpon thams cad bor nas byang chub kyi snying po la zhugs te /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten pa'i lam snga ma dang / 'jig rten pa'i slob dpon thams cad bor nas byang chub kyi snying po la zhugs te /
translated: Here, the Bodhisattva, having abandoned the former mundane path and all mundane teachers, entered the seat of enlightenment.

original: nyid kyis gzhan la phan par bzhed pas sems can la thugs brtse ba mngon sum du mdzad nas bden pa dpyod pa rtsom par mdzad do //
analyzed: nyid kyis gzhan la phan par bzhed pas sems can la thugs brtse ba mngon sum du mdzad nas bden pa dpyod pa rtsom par mdzad do //
translated: Having directly realized compassion for sentient beings, he, desiring to benefit others, began to investigate the truths.

original: de de'i tshe sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dpyad par bzhed de rga shi sdug bsngal gyi bden par gtogs pa lugs su 'byung ba ma yin pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba brtag pa'i sgo nas brtag par mdzad de /
analyzed: de de'i tshe sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dpyad par bzhed de rga shi sdug bsngal gyi bden par gtogs pa lugs su 'byung ba ma yin pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba brtag pa'i sgo nas brtag par mdzad de /
translated: At that time, he wished to investigate the truth of suffering, and he investigated it through the gateway of the non-sequential dependent origination included in the truth of suffering of old age and death.

original: de rgyu cha phra ba dang / rgyu rags pa dang / nor pa med pa rnam pa gsum gyis rga shi'i tshul bzhin du dpyod par mdzad do ;
analyzed: de rgyu cha phra ba dang / rgyu rags pa dang / nor pa med pa rnam pa gsum gyis rga shi'i tshul bzhin du dpyod par mdzad do ;
translated: He analyzes the mode of aging and death by way of three aspects: subtle cause, gross cause, and non-erroneous cause.

original: / de la mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang skye ba yin la /
analyzed: / de la mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yang skye ba yin la /
translated: Here, the cause of manifest existence is birth.

original: mngon par 'grub pa yang skye ba yin te /
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa yang skye ba yin te /
translated: Manifest existence is also birth.

original: snga ma ni cha phra ba yin la phyi ma ni rags pa yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩde la snga ma cha phra ba shos yod pa las kyang rga shi 'byung la phyi ma rags pa shos kyi rkyen las kyang rga shi 'byung ngo snyam du @250a * //
analyzed: snga ma ni cha phra ba yin la phyi ma ni rags pa yin par rig par bya'o // de la snga ma cha phra ba shos yod pa las kyang rga shi 'byung la phyi ma rags pa shos kyi rkyen las kyang rga shi 'byung ngo snyam du @250a * //
translated: The former should be understood as the subtle aspect, and the latter as the gross aspect.üîΩHe analyzes, thinking, ‚ÄúAging and death occur from the existence of the former, the subtlest aspect, and aging and death occur from the condition of the latter, the grossest aspect.‚Äù

original: dpyod de / phyi ma'i rga shi gang yin pa de ni cha phra ba'i skye ba'i rgyu las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: dpyod de / phyi ma'i rga shi gang yin pa de ni cha phra ba'i skye ba'i rgyu las byung ba yin no //
translated: The aging and death that are the latter are produced from the cause of birth that is the subtlest aspect.

original: tshe 'di'i rga shi gang yin pa de ni rags pa'i skye ba'i rgyu las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: tshe 'di'i rga shi gang yin pa de ni rags pa'i skye ba'i rgyu las byung ba yin no //
translated: The aging and death that are in this life are produced from the cause of birth that is the grossest aspect.

original: de la nor ba med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nor ba med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the non-erroneous cause?

original: skye ba'i gnas gzhan du gtogs pa'i skye ba rnam pa gnyis ni gzhan du rga shi'i 'bras bu smin par mi byed do //
analyzed: skye ba'i gnas gzhan du gtogs pa'i skye ba rnam pa gnyis ni gzhan du rga shi'i 'bras bu smin par mi byed do //
translated: The two types of birth that belong to other abodes of rebirth do not ripen as the effect of aging and death in other abodes of rebirth.

original: rga shi ji lta ba bzhin du skye ba dang / srid pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa yang tshul bzhin dpyod pa rnam pa gnyis kyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rga shi ji lta ba bzhin du skye ba dang / srid pa dang / len pa dang / srid pa yang tshul bzhin dpyod pa rnam pa gnyis kyis rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as with aging and death, birth, becoming, grasping, and existence should be understood in two ways, according to the method of analysis.

original: de ltar na rga shi la brten te lugs su 'byung ba ma yin pa'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i tshul gyis brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rga shi la brten te lugs su 'byung ba ma yin pa'i sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i tshul gyis brtags pa yin no //
translated: Thus, in dependence on aging and death, the truth of suffering and the truth of the origin of suffering, which are not in the forward order, are investigated according to the method of dependent origination.

original: de la kun 'byung ba'i bden pa dang mthun pa'i chos rnams ni snying po dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: de la kun 'byung ba'i bden pa dang mthun pa'i chos rnams ni snying po dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: In this regard, the dharmas that are in conformity with the truth of the origin of suffering are like the essence.

original: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa de nyid ni snum lta bu yin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa de nyid ni snum lta bu yin no //
translated: The truth of the origin of suffering itself is like the oil.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni 'bar ba lta bu yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni 'bar ba lta bu yin no //
translated: The truth of suffering is like the burning.

original: gang zag mi mkhas pa ni snum lugs pa lta bu dang snying po bskul ba lta bu yin te /
analyzed: gang zag mi mkhas pa ni snum lugs pa lta bu dang snying po bskul ba lta bu yin te /
translated: The unwise person is like one who is greedy for the oil and the essence.

original: sdug bsngal 'bar ba de yang yun ring por 'bar ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'bar ba de yang yun ring por 'bar ro //
translated: And that blazing suffering burns for a long time.

original: de las bzlog pa ni dkar po'i phyogs brtags pa'i tshul gyis lam dang 'gog pa'i bden pa brtags pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni dkar po'i phyogs brtags pa'i tshul gyis lam dang 'gog pa'i bden pa brtags pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of that should be understood as the investigation of the truths of the path and cessation, in terms of the method of investigating the bright side.

original: gang zag ni gnyis te /üîΩbdag la gnod pa byed par zhugs te bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal 'bar ba rgyud gcig la yod pa gnas par bya ba'i phyir snum ldugs shing snying po skul bar byed pa dang / gang zag cig shos ni bdag nyid dang gzhan skye bo'i tshogs chen po la gnod par zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zag ni gnyis te / bdag la gnod pa byed par zhugs te bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal 'bar ba rgyud gcig la yod pa gnas par bya ba'i phyir snum ldugs shing snying po skul bar byed pa dang / gang zag cig shos ni bdag nyid dang gzhan skye bo'i tshogs chen po la gnod par zhugs pa yin te /
translated: There are two kinds of persons:üîΩOne kind of person is engaged in harming himself, and he maintains the blazing of his own suffering in his continuum, as if he were pouring oil on a fire and stirring its flames.üîΩThe other kind of person is engaged in harming himself and a great multitude of other people.

original: de ni bdag nyid dang gzhan rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi me'i phung po chen po la 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ni bdag nyid dang gzhan rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi me'i phung po chen po la 'di lta ste /
translated: He maintains the great mass of the fire of suffering of himself and others, as if he were pouring oil on a great mass of fire and stirring its flames.

original: me'i phung po de yun ring por gnas par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: me'i phung po de yun ring por gnas par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to maintain that fire for a long time,üîΩhe makes a great effort to gather the fuel of action that produces the mass of suffering.

original: dam pa'i chos ma yin pa sngon du btang ba thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i log par bsgrub par bsdus pa'i shing dang / rtsva dang / ba lang gi lci ba skam po lta bu sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ma yin pa sngon du btang ba thos pa dang bsams pa dang bsgoms pa las byung ba'i log par bsgrub par bsdus pa'i shing dang / rtsva dang / ba lang gi lci ba skam po lta bu sgrub par byed do //
translated: He practices with the wood, grass, and dry cow dung that is included in the wrong practice that is preceded by what is not the true Dharma, which is included in the learning, reflection, and meditation that arise.

original: 'di la bcom ldan 'das ni byang chub sems dpar gyur ba na byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs nas rga shi la dmigs te rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i sgo nas phyi ma'i mtha'i sdug bsngal gyi bden @250b ba la lugs su 'byung ba ma yin pa'i
analyzed: 'di la bcom ldan 'das ni byang chub sems dpar gyur ba na byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs nas rga shi la dmigs te rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i sgo nas phyi ma'i mtha'i sdug bsngal gyi bden @250b ba la lugs su 'byung ba ma yin pa'i
translated: Here, the Blessed One, when he was a bodhisattva, while sitting at the seat of enlightenment, observed aging and death, and through dependent origination, he engaged in the forward order of the truth of suffering in the future.

original: tshul gyis 'jug ste /
analyzed: tshul gyis 'jug ste /
translated: He properly paid attention to the present up to existence.üîΩHaving investigated the future suffering and the future origin of suffering, he did not consider that to be enough.

original: srid pa'i bar du tshul bzhin yid la byed cing phyi ma'i mtha'i sdug bsngal dang phyi ma'i mtha'i sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba yang brtags nas de de tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin te /üîΩphyi ma'i mtha'i kun 'byung ba de'i rgyur gyur pa ;
analyzed: srid pa'i bar du tshul bzhin yid la byed cing phyi ma'i mtha'i sdug bsngal dang phyi ma'i mtha'i sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba yang brtags nas de de tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin te /üîΩphyi ma'i mtha'i kun 'byung ba de'i rgyur gyur pa ;
translated: He investigated the cause of the future origin of suffering.

original: / da ltar gyi sdug bsngal thams cad la yang lugs su 'byung ba ma yin par tshor ba dang reg pa dang skye mched drug dang ming dang gzugs dang rnam par shes pas bsdus pa la rtog par mdzad do //
analyzed: / da ltar gyi sdug bsngal thams cad la yang lugs su 'byung ba ma yin par tshor ba dang reg pa dang skye mched drug dang ming dang gzugs dang rnam par shes pas bsdus pa la rtog par mdzad do //
translated: He also considers the present suffering, which is included in feeling, contact, the six sense spheres, name and form, and consciousness, in a manner that is not in accordance with the natural order.

original: de la ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal gang yin pa de ni phyis 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de la ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal gang yin pa de ni phyis 'byung ba yin no //
translated: He understands that the future suffering will arise later,

original: de'i kun 'byung ba yang phyis 'byung ba yin no snyam du yang dag par mkhyen nas ma 'ongs pa'i dus la brten te gang yod pa las 'byung bar 'gyur snyam du rtog go //
analyzed: de'i kun 'byung ba yang phyis 'byung ba yin no snyam du yang dag par mkhyen nas ma 'ongs pa'i dus la brten te gang yod pa las 'byung bar 'gyur snyam du rtog go //
translated: and that its origination will also arise later. Having understood this, he considers what exists from which it will arise, in dependence on the future time.

original: tshe 'di'i sdug bsngal rnam par shes pa la thug pa'i bar de ni sngon gyi kun 'byung ba las byung zhing grub pa yin no //
analyzed: tshe 'di'i sdug bsngal rnam par shes pa la thug pa'i bar de ni sngon gyi kun 'byung ba las byung zhing grub pa yin no //
translated: The present suffering, up to consciousness, has arisen from a previous origination and has been established.

original: byung ba gang yin pa de la ni 'di ltar 'byung snyam du brtag pa'i mi rigs te /
analyzed: byung ba gang yin pa de la ni 'di ltar 'byung snyam du brtag pa'i mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable to consider that which has arisen as if it will arise.

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' de ni da ltar gyi sdug bsngal byung zin pa la gzigs nas phyis 'byung ba brtag pa'i yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i sems ldog par 'gyur ro //üîΩde'i gnas phyi ma'i mtha'i kun 'byung ba'i bden pa rim gyis yang dag par gzigs nas /
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' de ni da ltar gyi sdug bsngal byung zin pa la gzigs nas phyis 'byung ba brtag pa'i yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i sems ldog par 'gyur ro // de'i gnas phyi ma'i mtha'i kun 'byung ba'i bden pa rim gyis yang dag par gzigs nas /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattva, having seen the present suffering that has already arisen, turns away from the mental activity that investigates future suffering.üîΩHaving seen the truth of the future arising of suffering,

original: phyi ma'i mtha'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i gnas phyi ma'i mtha'i kun 'byung ba'i bden pa yang yang dag par gzigs te /
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i gnas phyi ma'i mtha'i kun 'byung ba'i bden pa yang yang dag par gzigs te /
translated: he sees the truth of the future arising of suffering that is the basis of the truth of the future arising of suffering.

original: yang rnam par shes pa las lugs su 'byung ba la 'jug ste /
analyzed: yang rnam par shes pa las lugs su 'byung ba la 'jug ste /
translated: Again, he enters into the forward order of consciousness.

original: de ltar na des rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba lugs su 'byung ba dang / lugs su 'byung ba ma yin pa tshul bzhin du sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na des rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba lugs su 'byung ba dang / lugs su 'byung ba ma yin pa tshul bzhin du sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba brtags pa yin no //
translated: In this way, he properly investigates the forward and reverse orders of dependent origination, as well as the arising of suffering and its origin.

original: de'i 'og tu 'gog pa'i bden pa brtag par bzhen nas rga shi nyid nas ma rig pa'i bar las lugs su 'byung ba ma yin par 'jug go //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'gog pa'i bden pa brtag par bzhen nas rga shi nyid nas ma rig pa'i bar las lugs su 'byung ba ma yin par 'jug go //
translated: Then, wishing to investigate the truth of cessation, he enters into the reverse order, from aging and death to ignorance.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: da ltar gyi sdug bsngal gyi bden pa byung zin pa de ji ltar byas na gtan 'gag par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: da ltar gyi sdug bsngal gyi bden pa byung zin pa de ji ltar byas na gtan 'gag par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: The present truth of suffering has already arisen. How can it be completely stopped?

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i las gsar du ma byas na 'gag par 'gyur ro snyam du rtog pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdes de ltar bden pa gsum po rnam par @251a * //üîΩdpyad nas 'gog pa'i bden pa 'di thob par byung ba'i lam ni gang yin /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i las gsar du ma byas na 'gag par 'gyur ro snyam du rtog pa'i phyir ro // des de ltar bden pa gsum po rnam par @251a * // dpyad nas 'gog pa'i bden pa 'di thob par byung ba'i lam ni gang yin /
translated: He thinks that it will cease if he does not create new karma conditioned by ignorance.üîΩThus, having investigated the three truths, he thinks, ‚ÄúWhat is the path that leads to the attainment of the truth of cessation?

original: srang ni gang yin zhig gu snyam du tshol bar byed de /
analyzed: srang ni gang yin zhig gu snyam du tshol bar byed de /
translated: What is the scale?

original: de snga ma bzhin du sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pas sngon gyi 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba zag pa zad par bya ba'i gdams ngag ston pa dang 'dra ba mngon sum du mdzad cing de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de snga ma bzhin du sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pas sngon gyi 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba zag pa zad par bya ba'i gdams ngag ston pa dang 'dra ba mngon sum du mdzad cing de 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: As before, he actualized the recollection of past lives, which is like the instruction for eliminating the contaminants of the mundane correct view.üîΩHe thought,

original: drang srong snga ma rnams kyis bgrod cing rjes su bgrod pa'i lam snga ma bdag gis rnyed do snyam ste /
analyzed: drang srong snga ma rnams kyis bgrod cing rjes su bgrod pa'i lam snga ma bdag gis rnyed do snyam ste /
translated: I have found the former path that was traversed and followed by former sages.

original: 'di ni de'i 'jig rten pa'i yid la byed pa kho nas bden pa bzhi pa dpyad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de'i 'jig rten pa'i yid la byed pa kho nas bden pa bzhi pa dpyad pa yin no //
translated: This is the analysis of the fourth truth by the mundane mental contemplation alone.

original: des yang dag pa'i lta ba de nyid kyis rjes su 'gro zhing bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs pas /
analyzed: des yang dag pa'i lta ba de nyid kyis rjes su 'gro zhing bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs pas /
translated: Through that correct view, he followed the path and realized the four truths.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba na slob pa dang mi slob pa'i ye shes gzigs pa zag pa med pa shin tu rnam par dag pas mngon sum gyi tshul du thugs su chud de /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya ba na slob pa dang mi slob pa'i ye shes gzigs pa zag pa med pa shin tu rnam par dag pas mngon sum gyi tshul du thugs su chud de /
translated: When he fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete enlightenment, he directly understood with the uncontaminated, extremely pure knowledge and vision of a learner and nonlearner the four truths.

original: des gang gi don du bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du dka' ba spyad pa'i don de brnyes nas gzhan rnams la phan par bzhed pas lhar bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi phyir shin tu skal ba dang ldan pa su yang rung ba de dag la 'phags pa'i bden
analyzed: des gang gi don du bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du dka' ba spyad pa'i don de brnyes nas gzhan rnams la phan par bzhed pas lhar bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyi phyir shin tu skal ba dang ldan pa su yang rung ba de dag la 'phags pa'i bden
translated: Having attained the goal for which he practiced austerities for three incalculable eons, he wishes to benefit others.

analyzed: pa bzhi yang dag par rtogs pa'i bgo bsha' mdzad cing skyed par mdzad do //

translated: the proper designation of dependently arisen phenomena from the perspective of their lack of activity, the accomplishment of benefit for others based on that, and the accomplishment of benefit for oneself.üîΩProper designation from the perspective of their lack of activity is the proper designation of dependently arisen phenomena from the perspective of their lack of activity.

original: tshe 'di dang sngon gyi mtha'i sdug bsngal lugs su 'byung ba ma yin pa'i sgo nas gang du ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa /

analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis kyang ming dang gzugs 'byung ste /

translated: Based on that correct designation, abiding in dependent origination, one teaches the Dharma to others beginning with the truths. This is accomplishing the benefit for others.

analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes la gnas pas phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings thob pas na bdud rtsi'i dbyings lus kyi mngon sum du byas nas bsgrubs te gnas so /

translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the ≈õrƒÅvaka?

analyzed: bam po bcu gsum pa byes pa phyi rol gyi mu stegs can ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi las byung ba'i lus kyi mi rtag pa rags pa mthong nas lus 'dug cing 'tsho ba de'i 'phel ba dang 'grib pa dang / 'chi ba'i tshe dang skye ba'i tshe'i 'dor ba dang len pa la bltas nas lus 'di las skyo zhing ma chags la rnam par grol @252a * // bar 'gyur te /

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

translated: Thus, although he has purified consciousness in this and that meditative attainment, he still abides in a state of affliction, grasping at ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mi mkhas pas tshe zad cing las zad nas yang phyir ldog par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is not skilled in dependent origination, he returns again when his life and karma are exhausted.

translated: But the noble disciple who is skilled in dependent origination sees the impermanence of the body, which is derived from the four great elements, in a subtle way, but not so the impermanence of consciousness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

translated: Because the impermanence of the body, which is derived from the four great elements, is evident at another time, but the impermanence of consciousness is not evident in each moment because it continues in a homogeneous series.

original: rnam par shes pa'i mi rtag pa ni skad cig re re'i dmigs pa las dmigs pa 'pho zhing 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis rnam pa du sar snang mod kyi 'on kyang rnam par shes pa'i mi rtag pa ni rags shing rnam pa du mar 'dug bzhin du de ni

translated: The impermanence of consciousness is of many kinds, because of the way in which the object of perception changes and is transformed from one moment to the next.

analyzed: rtogs par dka' ba dang / 'jug par dka' ba'i phyir mchog tu cha phra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: But the impermanence of consciousness is to be known as the most subtle, because it is difficult to understand and difficult to penetrate, even though it is present in a gross and manifold way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes rab kyi mig gi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi mig gi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the domain of the eye of wisdom.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi las byung ba'i lus kyi skye ba dang / 'grib pa dang / len pa dang / 'dor ba'i mi rtag pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i sha'i mig gi yul du'ang 'gyur ro //

translated: The impermanence of the body, which is produced from the four great elements, and which is subject to birth, decline, appropriation, and abandonment, is the domain of the eye of flesh, which is not in accord with reality.

analyzed: rnam par shes pa mi rtag pa'i cha phra ba de la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos de 'jug par 'dod pa na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid tshul bzhin du yid la byed cing reg pa las byung ba rang
translated: When the noble disciple who is skilled in dependent origination wishes to enter the subtle aspect of impermanence of consciousness, he properly attends to dependent origination itself and, from contact,

original: de de ltar ye shes mthong ba dang ldan pas rim gyis tshor ba'i rten du gyur pa'i @252b lus las kyang skyo bar 'gyur la rgyur gyur pa'i reg pa las kyang skyo bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de de ltar ye shes mthong ba dang ldan pas rim gyis tshor ba'i rten du gyur pa'i @252b lus las kyang skyo bar 'gyur la rgyur gyur pa'i reg pa las kyang skyo bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, through possessing the vision of wisdom, he gradually becomes disenchanted with the body that is the basis of feeling and also becomes disenchanted with contact that is the cause of feeling.

original: de ma yin pa'i rgyur gyur pa ming gis bsdus pa'i 'du byed du gtogs pa thams cad las kyang phung po dang bcas pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su rnam par grol zhing gtan du yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i rgyur gyur pa ming gis bsdus pa'i 'du byed du gtogs pa thams cad las kyang phung po dang bcas pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su rnam par grol zhing gtan du yongs su grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And from all the formations included in names that are not causes, he is completely liberated and is eternally liberated in the realm of nirvƒÅ·πáa without any remainder of the aggregates.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa'i dge slong ni rnam pa gsum gyis mtha' gsum yang dag par dpyad pas sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la mkhas pa'i dge slong ni rnam pa gsum gyis mtha' gsum yang dag par dpyad pas sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The monk who is skilled in dependent origination completely eliminates suffering by correctly analyzing the three extremes in three ways.

original: rnam pa gsum po ni gang /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po ni gang /
translated: What are the three ways?

original: mtha' gsum po de dag ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtha' gsum po de dag ni gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three extremes?

original: sdug bsngal gyi gnas dang / sdug bsngal gyi gzhi dang / sdug bsngal gyi gzhi'i gnas te rnam pa gsum po 'di rnams kyi mtha' gsum ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi gnas dang / sdug bsngal gyi gzhi dang / sdug bsngal gyi gzhi'i gnas te rnam pa gsum po 'di rnams kyi mtha' gsum ste /
translated: The three extremes are the basis of suffering, the ground of suffering, and the basis of the ground of suffering.

original: dbus kyi mtha' dang / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i mtha' 'di rnams kyi mtha' gsum ste /
analyzed: dbus kyi mtha' dang / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i mtha' 'di rnams kyi mtha' gsum ste /
translated: The three extremes are the middle extreme, and the past and future extremes.

original: dbus kyi mtha' dang / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i mtha' 'di rnams yang dag par dpyod do //
analyzed: dbus kyi mtha' dang / 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i mtha' 'di rnams yang dag par dpyod do //
translated: He examines the middle, the end, and the past and future of the end.

original: de la sdug bsngal gyi nang gi rten ni phung po yin te /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal gyi nang gi rten ni phung po yin te /
translated: The internal basis of suffering is the aggregates,

original: grang pa dang tsha ba la sogs pa dang / na ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi khyad par rnams tshe 'di nyid la skye ba'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: grang pa dang tsha ba la sogs pa dang / na ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi khyad par rnams tshe 'di nyid la skye ba'i gnas yin no //
translated: because they are the basis for the arising of the various sufferings of this life, such as cold, heat, sickness, death, and so on.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de yod na de la brten nas de dag skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod na de la brten nas de dag skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when they exist, the various sufferings arise in dependence on them.üîΩThe external basis of suffering is the aggregates that are the support for the collection of parents, etc.,

original: phyi rol gyi pha ma la sogs pa'i tshogs yongs su 'dzin pa'i phung po ni yongs su tshol ba la sogs pa'i mtshon dang / dbyug pa 'chang ba man chad dang / mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi khyad par rnams kyi gnas yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi pha ma la sogs pa'i tshogs yongs su 'dzin pa'i phung po ni yongs su tshol ba la sogs pa'i mtshon dang / dbyug pa 'chang ba man chad dang / mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa la sogs pa sdug bsngal gyi khyad par rnams kyi gnas yin te /
translated: because they are the basis for the various sufferings of this life, such as the pain of being struck by weapons, sticks, and so on, and the suffering of grief, lamentation, and so on.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩsnga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩsnga ma bzhin no //
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause when they exist, the various sufferings arise in dependence on them.

original: phung po de gnyis ka yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu ni sred pa ste /
analyzed: phung po de gnyis ka yongs su 'dzin pa'i rgyu ni sred pa ste /
translated: The cause of grasping both of these aggregates is craving.

original: kun 'byung ba'i gnas kyi sred pa des phung po 'di bskyed pa 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi gzhi'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i gnas kyi sred pa des phung po 'di bskyed pa 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi gzhi'o //
translated: The craving that is the source of the origin of suffering generates these aggregates, which are the basis of suffering.

original: sred pa de yang dga' zhing bde ba'i yul gzugs kyi yul la gnas te /
analyzed: sred pa de yang dga' zhing bde ba'i yul gzugs kyi yul la gnas te /
translated: Moreover, that craving is based on the object of form, which is the cause of pleasure and happiness.

original: skye ba 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi gzhi'i gnas yin no //üîΩ'dod chags dang zhe sdang gi me tsha bas gdungs pa'i phyir yul la sred cing skom pa gang su yang rung ba dag ni zas bzang po dug dang sbyar ba bzhin du dga' zhing bde ba'i gzugs kyi yul gyi ro myong bar byed cing 'dor bar mi byed
analyzed: skye ba 'di ni sdug bsngal gyi gzhi'i gnas yin no // 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gi me tsha bas gdungs pa'i phyir yul la sred cing skom pa gang su yang rung ba dag ni zas bzang po dug dang sbyar ba bzhin du dga' zhing bde ba'i gzugs kyi yul gyi ro myong bar byed cing 'dor bar mi byed
translated: This birth is the basis of the origin of suffering.üîΩWhoever is tormented by the heat of the fire of passion and aversion and is thirsty for objects craves objects and does not abandon them, just as one who is thirsty craves and seeks water.

original: de / de dag ni sred pa 'phel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de / de dag ni sred pa 'phel bar byed pa'o //
translated: They experience the taste of the object of form, which is the cause of pleasure and happiness, as if it were good food mixed with poison.

original: sred pa 'phel @253a * //
analyzed: sred pa 'phel @253a * //
translated: They increase craving.

original: bar byed pa gang yin pa de dag ni phyi ma phung po 'phel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bar byed pa gang yin pa de dag ni phyi ma phung po 'phel bar byed pa'o //
translated: Those who increase craving increase the aggregates in the future.

original: phyi ma la phung po 'phel bar byed pa gang yin pa de dag ni sdug bsngal 'phel par byed pa ste /
analyzed: phyi ma la phung po 'phel bar byed pa gang yin pa de dag ni sdug bsngal 'phel par byed pa ste /
translated: Those that increase the aggregates in the future increase suffering.

original: de ltar na de dag ni yang dag par 'chi bar 'gyur ba yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni yang dag par 'chi bar 'gyur ba yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Thus, they should be known as those who die properly.

original: 'di ni da ltar byung ba dpyad pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni da ltar byung ba dpyad pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the analysis of the present.

original: da ltar byung ba'i tshul gyis ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i tshul yang rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i tshul gyis ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i tshul yang rtogs par bya ste /
translated: The modes of the past and future should be understood through the mode of the present.

original: 'di ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dpyad pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dpyad pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the analysis of the past and future.

original: de yang tha snyad bzhi la brten pa'i tshad ma gsum la brten nas dpyad pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang tha snyad bzhi la brten pa'i tshad ma gsum la brten nas dpyad pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, this analysis is based on the three valid cognitions that rely on the four conventions.

original: de la mthong ba gang yin pa dang / rnam par shes pa gang yin pa'i tha snyad 'di ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma'o //
analyzed: de la mthong ba gang yin pa dang / rnam par shes pa gang yin pa'i tha snyad 'di ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma'o //
translated: The convention of what is seen and the convention of what is cognized are direct perception.

original: bye brag phyed pa'i tha snyad gang yin pa 'di ni rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'o //
analyzed: bye brag phyed pa'i tha snyad gang yin pa 'di ni rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma'o //
translated: The convention of distinguishing is inference.

original: thos pa'i tha snyad gang yin pa 'di ni yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma'o ;
analyzed: thos pa'i tha snyad gang yin pa 'di ni yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad ma'o ;
translated: This is the valid cognition of trustworthy scripture.

original: / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dpyod pa ni rnam pa lngas yang dag par zhugs na sdug bsngal zad cing sdug bsngal mthar byed par gyur te /
analyzed: / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dpyod pa ni rnam pa lngas yang dag par zhugs na sdug bsngal zad cing sdug bsngal mthar byed par gyur te /
translated: When one engages in the analysis of dependent origination in five ways, one will put an end to suffering and make suffering cease.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams skye ba'i gzhi yongs su dpyod pa dang / 'gog pa'i gzhi yongs su dpyod pa dang / 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams skye ba'i gzhi yongs su dpyod pa dang / 'gog pa'i gzhi yongs su dpyod pa dang / 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos la zhugs pa dang /
translated: The analysis of the basis of the arising of dependently arisen phenomena, the analysis of the basis of cessation, the correct knowledge of the path that leads to cessation, the practice of the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma,

original: rtogs pa la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa'o //
translated: and the absence of conceit about realization.

original: de ltar na de'i dpyod pa de legs par brtsams pa dang / 'bras bur grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de'i dpyod pa de legs par brtsams pa dang / 'bras bur grub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, that analysis is well undertaken and is successful.

original: de la ma 'ongs pa'i phung po'i rgyu'i sdug bsngal nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de la ma 'ongs pa'i phung po'i rgyu'i sdug bsngal nas bzung ste /
translated: Here, beginning with the suffering that is the cause of the future aggregates,

original: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs kyi bar du lugs su 'byung ba ma yin pa rnam pa bzhis dpyod cing khong du chud la sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs kyi bar du lugs su 'byung ba ma yin pa rnam pa bzhis dpyod cing khong du chud la sgrub par byed do //
translated: He analyzes, penetrates, and accomplishes the sequence of the twelve members of dependent origination in four ways, from the condition of ignorance up to the condition of consciousness.

original: rgyu yod na 'bras bu yod pa dang / rgyu med na 'bras bu med de zhes phyi ma la rnam pa gnyis kyis dpyod cing yongs su dpyod par byed do //
analyzed: rgyu yod na 'bras bu yod pa dang / rgyu med na 'bras bu med de zhes phyi ma la rnam pa gnyis kyis dpyod cing yongs su dpyod par byed do //
translated: He analyzes and fully analyzes the future in two ways: if there is a cause, there is an effect; if there is no cause, there is no effect.

original: yongs su dpyad nas rgyu med par 'gyur ba'i lam gang yin pa de khong du chud do //
analyzed: yongs su dpyad nas rgyu med par 'gyur ba'i lam gang yin pa de khong du chud do //
translated: Having fully analyzed, he penetrates the path that leads to the absence of causes.

original: khong du chud nas de bzhin du yang dag par zhugs pa de ni rjes su mthun pa'i chos dpyod pa yin te /
analyzed: khong du chud nas de bzhin du yang dag par zhugs pa de ni rjes su mthun pa'i chos dpyod pa yin te /
translated: Having penetrated, he thus correctly engages in the analysis of the Dharma that accords with reality.

original: de ni ma rig pa'i rkyen @253b gyis byung ba'i bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i las gsar gyi rgyu yod pa las bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo bar 'gro ba de'i 'bras bu rnam par shes pa yod pa tshe 'di nyid la yang dpyod par byed do //
analyzed: de ni ma rig pa'i rkyen @253b gyis byung ba'i bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo ba'i las gsar gyi rgyu yod pa las bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa dang / mi g-yo bar 'gro ba de'i 'bras bu rnam par shes pa yod pa tshe 'di nyid la yang dpyod par byed do //
translated: He analyzes the existence of the result of the karma of merit, demerit, and unshakable karma, which is produced by the condition of ignorance, and which is the cause of the new karma of merit, demerit, and unshakable karma, in this very life.üîΩHaving analyzed that, he understands and accomplishes that if that does not exist, that also will not exist, as before.

original: de med na de yang med par 'gyur ba yang dpyad nas snga ma bzhin du khong du chud cing sgrub par byed de yang dag par sgrub pa pha na ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i las gsar yang mi byed la las rnying rnams kyang myong nas zadüîΩpar byed do //
analyzed: de med na de yang med par 'gyur ba yang dpyad nas snga ma bzhin du khong du chud cing sgrub par byed de yang dag par sgrub pa pha na ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i las gsar yang mi byed la las rnying rnams kyang myong nas zad par byed do //
translated: When he accomplishes that, he does not produce new karma produced by the condition of ignorance, and having experienced the old karma, he exhausts it.
