original: snga ma bzhin du tshe 'di pa'i lam dang / lam gyi 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa yang tshe 'di nyid la thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du tshe 'di pa'i lam dang / lam gyi 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa yang tshe 'di nyid la thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: As before, he attains the path of this very life and the result of the path, nirvana, in this very life.

original: des de'i tshe nyon mongs pa'i me'i bag la nyal gyi tsha ba dang 'brel pa rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus rdza mkhan gyis so gtong ba'i tsha ba dang ldan pa las bum pa phung ba bzhin du mchog tu bsil ba'i mya ngan las 'das paüîΩla bzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: des de'i tshe nyon mongs pa'i me'i bag la nyal gyi tsha ba dang 'brel pa rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus rdza mkhan gyis so gtong ba'i tsha ba dang ldan pa las bum pa phung ba bzhin du mchog tu bsil ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bzhag pa yin no //
translated: At that time, the body together with consciousness, which is connected with the heat of the latent dispositions of the fire of the afflictions, is placed in the supreme coolness of nirvana,üîΩlike a pot made by a potter, which is connected with the heat of the firing, is destroyed.

original: de'i nyon mongs pa'i tsha ba de yang thams cad kyi thams cad du bral ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i nyon mongs pa'i tsha ba de yang thams cad kyi thams cad du bral ba yin no //
translated: And that heat of the afflictions is completely separated from it.

original: gyo mo lta bu'i lus rnam par shes pa dang bcas pas bsdus pa'i phung po de yang bsil bar gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: gyo mo lta bu'i lus rnam par shes pa dang bcas pas bsdus pa'i phung po de yang bsil bar gyur pa yin te /
translated: And that body together with consciousness, which is like a potsherd, that is, the aggregates that are included in the body, becomes cool.

original: de snga ma bzhin du lus kyi tha ma'i tshor ba myong ba na zhes bya ba nas rgyas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de snga ma bzhin du lus kyi tha ma'i tshor ba myong ba na zhes bya ba nas rgyas par rig par bya'o //
translated: As before, when experiencing the final feelings of the body, and so on, it should be understood in detail.

original: de ji srid 'tsho'i bar du rtag tu gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ji srid 'tsho'i bar du rtag tu gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: It remains there for as long as one lives.

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu las phyir nyams shing ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams mngon par 'du byed pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu las phyir nyams shing ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams mngon par 'du byed pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The result of arhatship would not be lost, and ignorance would not be the condition for the formation of karma.

original: rtogs pa la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: rtogs pa la mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the absence of pride in realization?

original: de de'i tshe rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i ye shes mthong ba shin tu rnam par dag pa dang ldan te /
analyzed: de de'i tshe rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la dmigs pa'i ye shes mthong ba shin tu rnam par dag pa dang ldan te /
translated: At that time, he possesses the wisdom that sees dependent origination, which is completely pure.

original: de 'di snyam du yang dag par na 'di na su yang 'khor ba yang med la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yang med do //
analyzed: de 'di snyam du yang dag par na 'di na su yang 'khor ba yang med la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yang med do //
translated: He thinks, ‚ÄúIn reality, no one here is in cyclic existence, nor is anyone attaining nirvana.

original: chos de dang de dag skyes pa las chos de dang de dag skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: chos de dang de dag skyes pa las chos de dang de dag skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: When those dharmas arise, those dharmas arise.

original: de dang de dag 'gags pas de dang de dag 'gag par 'gyur bar zad do snyam du sems so //
analyzed: de dang de dag 'gags pas de dang de dag 'gag par 'gyur bar zad do snyam du sems so //
translated: When those cease, those cease.‚Äù

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can ni gnyis te /
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal can ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of pride:

original: slob pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can dang / mi slob pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can no //
analyzed: slob pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can dang / mi slob pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can no //
translated: the pride of the learner and the pride of the non-learner.

original: de la slob pa'i mngon pa'i @254a * //
analyzed: de la slob pa'i mngon pa'i @254a * //
translated: Those who are still learning and have manifest conceit say:

original: nga rgyal can ni gang gzhan dag la yang 'di skad kun du sbyor ba gsum spangs pas na bdag ni som nyi las brgal to //
analyzed: nga rgyal can ni gang gzhan dag la yang 'di skad kun du sbyor ba gsum spangs pas na bdag ni som nyi las brgal to //
translated: ‚ÄúI have crossed over doubt‚Äù because they have abandoned the three fetters.

original: rang gi rtogs pa slob pa'i rnam par grol ba la bdag gis the tshom med par gyur to //üîΩ'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba'i lta bar gyur pa thams cad spangs pas na /
analyzed: rang gi rtogs pa slob pa'i rnam par grol ba la bdag gis the tshom med par gyur to // 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba'i lta bar gyur pa thams cad spangs pas na /
translated: ‚ÄúI have no doubt‚Äù with regard to the realization of the liberation of those still learning.

original: lta ba'i zug rngu phyung po zhes rjod par byed pa'o //üîΩmi slob pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can ni 'di skad du bdag gis ni 'di las gong du bya ba'am /
analyzed: lta ba'i zug rngu phyung po zhes rjod par byed pa'o // mi slob pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can ni 'di skad du bdag gis ni 'di las gong du bya ba'am /
translated: ‚ÄúI have extracted the thorn‚Äù because they have abandoned all the afflicted views that arise from the root of the afflicted view of the self.üîΩThose who are no longer learning and have manifest conceit say:üîΩ‚ÄúI have nothing more to do‚Äù or ‚ÄúI have done what had to be done.‚Äù

original: byas pa rab tu rnam par dbye ba med do zhes rjod par byed de de gnyi ga yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'am mya ngan las 'das pa las brtsams nas /
analyzed: byas pa rab tu rnam par dbye ba med do zhes rjod par byed de de gnyi ga yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'am mya ngan las 'das pa las brtsams nas /
translated: Both of these are said with reference to dependent origination or nirvana.

original: 'phags pa'i gtam zab mo 'jig rten las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang ldan pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gtam zab mo 'jig rten las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang ldan pa /
translated: They are noble teachings that are profound, transcendent, and endowed with emptiness.

original: rkyen 'di pa nyid kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs su 'byung ba brjod pa na gtam de khong du mi chud cing rjes su mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: rkyen 'di pa nyid kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs su 'byung ba brjod pa na gtam de khong du mi chud cing rjes su mi 'jug ste /
translated: When the forward order of dependent origination is described in terms of this very conditionality, they do not understand and do not follow that discourse.

original: de gnyis de'i rgyus rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud par bya ba la rang gi rgyud la som nyi skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gnyis de'i rgyus rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khong du chud par bya ba la rang gi rgyud la som nyi skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of that, they doubt their own continuum in order to understand dependent origination correctly, just as it is.

original: nyon mongs pa spong ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du bya ba la yang yid gnyis skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spong ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa mngon sum du bya ba la yang yid gnyis skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They also doubt the direct realization of nirvana, the abandonment of the afflictions.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar slob pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gyis ni bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa dang 'brel pa dang yid la byed pa'i rjes su zhugs pa dang / spel mar 'gyur ba'i nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal cha phra ba khong du chud la zhi gnas kyis kyang de'i rgyud nye bar brtan par gyur pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar slob pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can gyis ni bdag tu 'dzin pa dang / bdag gir 'dzin pa dang 'brel pa dang yid la byed pa'i rjes su zhugs pa dang / spel mar 'gyur ba'i nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal cha phra ba khong du chud la zhi gnas kyis kyang de'i rgyud nye bar brtan par gyur pa dang /
translated: Those who are conceited about higher knowledge in this way are related to the conception of i and mine, they engage in mental activity, they understand the subtle conception of i that is mixed with pride, and their mental continuum is stabilized by serenity.

original: nyon mongs pa rags pas kyang ma 'dres te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rags pas kyang ma 'dres te /
translated: They are not mixed with coarse afflictions.

original: des na de ma thob pa la thob po snyam du 'du shes par gyur la gzhan dag la yang brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na de ma thob pa la thob po snyam du 'du shes par gyur la gzhan dag la yang brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, they think, I have attained what has not been attained and they proclaim this to others.

original: mi slob pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can ni bdag ni zhi ba'o //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can ni bdag ni zhi ba'o //
translated: Those who are conceited about higher knowledge of no learning think, I am peaceful,

original: bdag ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //üîΩbdag ni sred pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o // bdag ni sred pa med pa'o //
translated: I am nirvana,üîΩI am free of craving,

original: bdag ni nye bar len pa med pa'o snyam ste /
analyzed: bdag ni nye bar len pa med pa'o snyam ste /
translated: I am free of appropriation.

original: kun du spyod pa cha phra mo ma spangs la nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal de khong du ma chud nas ma thos pa la thob po snyam du 'du shes par 'gyur la gzhan dag la yang brjod do //
analyzed: kun du spyod pa cha phra mo ma spangs la nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal de khong du ma chud nas ma thos pa la thob po snyam du 'du shes par 'gyur la gzhan dag la yang brjod do //
translated: Without abandoning the subtle aspects of conduct, without understanding the pride thinking ‚ÄúI am,‚Äù they think ‚ÄúI have attained what I have not heard‚Äù and they tell others.

original: mi slob pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can de yang sngar slob pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can du @254b gyur pa kho nar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can de yang sngar slob pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can du @254b gyur pa kho nar rig par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that one who has the pride of being a nonlearner was previously one who had the pride of being a learner.

original: don du bden pa'i slob par gyur pa las phyis mi slob pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can du 'gyur ba ni med do //
analyzed: don du bden pa'i slob par gyur pa las phyis mi slob pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can du 'gyur ba ni med do //
translated: One who is a learner in fact does not later become one who has the pride of being a nonlearner.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gang gis de ma thob pa la thob po snyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal la mngon par zhen nas dus gzhan du gnas par 'gyur zhing gzhan dag la yang brjod par 'gyur ba de lta bur de'i nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pa rgyun mi 'chad pa de
analyzed: gang gis de ma thob pa la thob po snyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal la mngon par zhen nas dus gzhan du gnas par 'gyur zhing gzhan dag la yang brjod par 'gyur ba de lta bur de'i nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pa rgyun mi 'chad pa de
translated: Because their affliction of conduct is uninterrupted, they think ‚ÄúI have attained what I have not attained‚Äù and they become attached to the pride of being a nonlearner. They remain in that state and tell others.

original: 'dra bar sems kyis khyab par byas te gnas par mi 'gyur gyi brjed ngas pas de'i nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pa chung ngu yun ring po mi gnas pa dang ldan pa tsam du zad de myur ba kho nar khong du chud cing phyir mid par 'gyurüîΩba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dra bar sems kyis khyab par byas te gnas par mi 'gyur gyi brjed ngas pas de'i nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pa chung ngu yun ring po mi gnas pa dang ldan pa tsam du zad de myur ba kho nar khong du chud cing phyir mid par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They quickly understand and swallow it.

original: de gnyis de ltar sngar ni ma thob pa la thob po snyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can du gyur la /
analyzed: de gnyis de ltar sngar ni ma thob pa la thob po snyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal can du gyur la /
translated: They are conceited, thinking, I have attained what I had not attained before.

original: da ltar gyi ni som nyi dang yid gnyis su gyur nas yi chad pa'i phyir nyams par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: da ltar gyi ni som nyi dang yid gnyis su gyur nas yi chad pa'i phyir nyams par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Now, they are despondent, having doubts and second thoughts.üîΩIf I have not attained it, then others have not attained it either.

original: gal te bdag gi thob pa med na ni de lta na gzhan dag gi yang med par 'gyur ro snyam du 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba ngan song du 'gro ba'i rgyu yang dag par blangs pas na phongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bdag gi thob pa med na ni de lta na gzhan dag gi yang med par 'gyur ro snyam du 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba ngan song du 'gro ba'i rgyu yang dag par blangs pas na phongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are impoverished because they have taken up wrong views that deprecate the noble ones and lead to lower rebirths.

original: 'phags pa'i gtam zab mo nas snga ma bzhin du mos pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i gtam zab mo nas snga ma bzhin du mos pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the profound teaching of the noble ones?

original: gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan pas 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas su bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan pas 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas su bstan pa ste /
translated: It is the teaching of the conditioned and the unconditioned, by means of the three natures and dependent origination, and by means of nirvana.

original: 'di ltar 'dus byas ni mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dus byas ni mi rtag pa'o //
translated: Thus, the conditioned is impermanent.

original: 'dus ma byas ni rtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni rtag pa'o //
translated: The unconditioned is permanent.

original: 'dus byas rnams sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: 'dus byas rnams sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: The conditioned is suffering.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o ;
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni zhi ba'o ;
translated: Nirvana is peace.

original: /'dus byas de dag thams cad ni bsdus na /
analyzed: /'dus byas de dag thams cad ni bsdus na /
translated: When all the conditioned is summarized,

original: sdug bsngal tsam dang / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu tsam du zad do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal tsam dang / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu tsam du zad do //
translated: it is reduced to suffering and the cause of suffering.

original: 'dus ma byas de yang bsdus na sdug bsngal rgyu dang bcas pa 'gog pa tsam du zad do zhes bstan pa'i //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas de yang bsdus na sdug bsngal rgyu dang bcas pa 'gog pa tsam du zad do zhes bstan pa'i //
translated: When the unconditioned is summarized, it is reduced to the mere cessation of suffering and its cause.

original: tshe 'di la mya ngan las 'das pa thob cing sdug bsngal chad par gyur ba'i dge slong gi ni yang srid par skye ba'i rgyu'i lam dang phyi ma la de'i 'bras bu sdug bsngal 'byung bar mi 'gyur la phung po'i lhag ma med par mya ngan las 'das
analyzed: tshe 'di la mya ngan las 'das pa thob cing sdug bsngal chad par gyur ba'i dge slong gi ni yang srid par skye ba'i rgyu'i lam dang phyi ma la de'i 'bras bu sdug bsngal 'byung bar mi 'gyur la phung po'i lhag ma med par mya ngan las 'das
translated: For the monk who has attained nirvana in this life and has cut off suffering, the path that is the cause of rebirth in a new existence and the suffering that is its result in the next life will not occur.

original: pa'i tshe yang de'i sdug bsngal nying mtshams sbyor bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i tshe yang de'i sdug bsngal nying mtshams sbyor bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And when he attains nirvana without remainder, his suffering will not be reborn.

original: sngon gyi rgyus drangs @255a * //
analyzed: sngon gyi rgyus drangs @255a * //
translated: The aggregates drawn by previous causes

original: pa'i phung po yang rang gi ngang gis 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i phung po yang rang gi ngang gis 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: will cease by themselves.

original: sdug bsngal gyi mtha' ni de yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi mtha' ni de yin te /
translated: This is the end of suffering.

original: 'di nas su yang sngon 'khor bar 'gyur ba yang med la /
analyzed: 'di nas su yang sngon 'khor bar 'gyur ba yang med la /
translated: No one will transmigrate in samsara from here,üîΩand no one will attain nirvana in the present.

original: da ltar yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yang med do zhes don 'di ston pa'i gtam gang yin pa de ni 'phags pa'i gtam zab mo nas sngar smos pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: da ltar yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yang med do zhes don 'di ston pa'i gtam gang yin pa de ni 'phags pa'i gtam zab mo nas sngar smos pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement that should be known as the profound statement of the noble ones, as mentioned above.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rang bzhin gyis mchog tu zab pa yang kha cig la gsal ba kho nar snang ba gang yin pa de ni rnam pa gnyis las 'gyur te ston pas kyang de bzhin du legs par bstan la gang zag de yang zhi ba mo
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rang bzhin gyis mchog tu zab pa yang kha cig la gsal ba kho nar snang ba gang yin pa de ni rnam pa gnyis las 'gyur te ston pas kyang de bzhin du legs par bstan la gang zag de yang zhi ba mo
translated: The dependent origination that is naturally and supremely profound appears to some as if it were clear. That is due to two factors: the teacher has taught it well, and the person has a peaceful mind.üîΩ

original: brtags pa mkhas pa mdzangs pa gsal ba yin te gang la bstan pa dang / su nyan pa'o //
analyzed: brtags pa mkhas pa mdzangs pa gsal ba yin te gang la bstan pa dang / su nyan pa'o //
translated: The dependent origination that is naturally supremely profound appears to some as if it were clear. That is due to two factors: the teacher has taught it well, and the person is skilled in discerning the meaning of the scriptures.

original: tshig gi don 'di rnams ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshig gi don 'di rnams ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The meaning of these terms is as follows:

original: rnam grangs bsdu ba las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam grangs bsdu ba las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: They are as they appear in the Compendium of Enumerations.

original: de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhis mchog tu zab par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhis mchog tu zab par rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, dependent origination should be known as supremely profound in four ways:

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu cha phra ba shes par dka' ba dang / bdag med pa shes par dka' ba dang / bral ba'i sems can rnams ldan par shes par dka' ba dang / ldan pa'i sems can rnams 'bral bar shes par dka' ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu cha phra ba shes par dka' ba dang / bdag med pa shes par dka' ba dang / bral ba'i sems can rnams ldan par shes par dka' ba dang / ldan pa'i sems can rnams 'bral bar shes par dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to know the subtle cause and effect, it is difficult to know selflessness, it is difficult to know that beings who are separated are united, and it is difficult to know that beings who are united are separated.

original: de la rgyu dang 'bras bu cha phra ba shes par dka' ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rgyu dang 'bras bu cha phra ba shes par dka' ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the difficulty of knowing the subtle cause and effect?

original: bden pa brtag pa'i tshul la brten te /
analyzed: bden pa brtag pa'i tshul la brten te /
translated: It is based on the method of investigating the truth.

original: srid pa'i yan lag rga shi la sogs pa nas rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs la thug pa rnams kyi rkyen yod pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag rga shi la sogs pa nas rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs la thug pa rnams kyi rkyen yod pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: From the link of aging and death in existence up to consciousness and name-and-form, one should know the conditions that exist.

original: rkyen yod pa yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: rkyen yod pa yang gang zhe na /
translated: What are the existing conditions?

original: gang gi rgyus skye ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi rgyus skye ba ste /
translated: It is that by which birth arises.

original: gang ma spangs na skye bar 'gyur ba dang / skyes pa'i 'og tu yang rga shir 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gang ma spangs na skye bar 'gyur ba dang / skyes pa'i 'og tu yang rga shir 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
translated: If it is not abandoned, birth will occur, and after birth, aging and death will also occur.

original: de la skye ba'i rgyu yang skye ba yin la de'i rgyu las byung ba'i mngon par 'grub pa yang skye ba yin te /
analyzed: de la skye ba'i rgyu yang skye ba yin la de'i rgyu las byung ba'i mngon par 'grub pa yang skye ba yin te /
translated: The cause of birth is also birth, and the manifestation that arises from its cause is also birth.

original: skye ba snga ma shos yod na /
analyzed: skye ba snga ma shos yod na /
translated: If the prior birth exists,

original: skye ba phyi ma shos 'byung la skye ba phyi ma shos yod na rga shi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba phyi ma shos 'byung la skye ba phyi ma shos yod na rga shi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the subsequent birth occurs, and if the subsequent birth exists, aging and death occur.

original: de la skye ba snga ma shos ni skye ba phyi ma shos kyi rgyu dang / rga shi'i gzhi yin no //
analyzed: de la skye ba snga ma shos ni skye ba phyi ma shos kyi rgyu dang / rga shi'i gzhi yin no //
translated: In this regard, the prior birth is the cause of the subsequent birth and the basis of aging and death.

original: skye ba phyi ma shos ni rga shi'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: skye ba phyi ma shos ni rga shi'i rkyen yin no //
translated: The subsequent birth is the condition of aging and death.

original: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa la ni skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa la ni skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ste /
translated: The collection of all of these is called ‚Äúaging and death with birth as a condition.‚Äù

original: @255b 'di ni rga shi'i rkyen yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: @255b 'di ni rga shi'i rkyen yod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the way in which the condition of aging and death should be understood.

original: skye ba ji lta ba bzhin du srid pa dang len pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: skye ba ji lta ba bzhin du srid pa dang len pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Craving and grasping should be understood in the same way as birth.

original: len pa rnam par gzhag pa ni de la spyir na 'dun pa'i 'dod chags ni len pa'o //
analyzed: len pa rnam par gzhag pa ni de la spyir na 'dun pa'i 'dod chags ni len pa'o //
translated: Grasping is generally attachment that is craving.

original: nye bar len pa bzhi po rnams ni len pa rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: nye bar len pa bzhi po rnams ni len pa rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: The four appropriators are established as appropriators.

original: ji ltar zhe na ;
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na ;
translated: How so?

original: sred pa ni 'dod pa yongs su tshol ba'i sgo nas las kun du slong ba yin no //
analyzed: sred pa ni 'dod pa yongs su tshol ba'i sgo nas las kun du slong ba yin no //
translated: Craving is the instigator of action by way of the pursuit of pleasure.

original: srid pa 'dod pa'i sgo nas kyang las kun nas slong ba yin no //
analyzed: srid pa 'dod pa'i sgo nas kyang las kun nas slong ba yin no //
translated: Becoming is the instigator of action by way of the desire for existence.

original: las de gnyi ga'i sgo nas ni sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa'i tshor ba la brten to //
analyzed: las de gnyi ga'i sgo nas ni sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa'i tshor ba la brten to //
translated: Action is the basis of pleasant and unpleasant feelings by way of both.

original: de yang skye mched drug gi sgo nas ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba gang yin pa de'i rkyen gyis 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de yang skye mched drug gi sgo nas ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba gang yin pa de'i rkyen gyis 'byung ngo //
translated: And that is produced by the condition of feeling that arises from contact with ignorance, by way of the six sense spheres.

original: gang de'i rkyen du mi 'gyur ba'i tshor ba gzhan yang yod de /
analyzed: gang de'i rkyen du mi 'gyur ba'i tshor ba gzhan yang yod de /
translated: There is another feeling that is not a condition for that.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is

original: rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba dang / rig pa yang ma yin ma rig pa yang ma yin pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba dang / rig pa yang ma yin ma rig pa yang ma yin pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'o //
translated: feeling that arises from contact with knowledge, and feeling that arises from contact with neither-knowledge-nor-ignorance.

original: tshor ba de dag thams cad kyang de dang reg pa 'dra ba'i reg pa'i rkyen las byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba de dag thams cad kyang de dang reg pa 'dra ba'i reg pa'i rkyen las byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that all these feelings arise from the condition of contact that is similar to that.

original: de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: rig pa dang ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni tshig bla dgas kyi 'dus te reg pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa dang ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni tshig bla dgas kyi 'dus te reg pa'o //
translated: Contact associated with knowledge and ignorance is contact associated with verbal expression.

original: de las bzlog pa ni thogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa'o //üîΩrig pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa'i tshig bla dags kyi 'dus te reg pa dang 'brel pa de yang ci rigs par dag pa'i chos thos pa dang / dam pa'i chos ma yin pa thos pa la dmigs pa yang dag pa dang /üîΩlog pa'i thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa'i shes pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i ming gi rkyen las byung ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni thogs pa'i 'dus te reg pa'o // rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa dang / ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa'i tshig bla dags kyi 'dus te reg pa dang 'brel pa de yang ci rigs par dag pa'i chos thos pa dang / dam pa'i chos ma yin pa thos pa la dmigs pa yang dag pa dang / log pa'i thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa'i shes pa dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i ming gi rkyen las byung ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of that is contact associated with obstruction.üîΩThat contact associated with knowledge and ignorance, which is associated with contact associated with verbal expression, arises from the condition of name, which is either the knowledge of hearing the true Dharma, the knowledge of hearing the non-Dharma,üîΩor the knowledge of hearing, reflection, and meditation, as appropriate.

original: rig pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: rig pa yang ma yin /
translated: It should be understood that it is not associated with knowledge.

original: ma rig pa yang ma yin pa'i 'dus te reg pas bsdus pa thob pa'i 'dus te reg pa ni nang dang phyi rol gyi gzugs kyi rkyen las byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa yang ma yin pa'i 'dus te reg pas bsdus pa thob pa'i 'dus te reg pa ni nang dang phyi rol gyi gzugs kyi rkyen las byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Contact that is included in the union of the three that is not due to ignorance should be known as arising from the condition of internal and external form.

original: de yang bsdus na ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis reg pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang bsdus na ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis reg pa yin no //
translated: That is also included in contact that has the condition of name-and-form.

original: ming dang gzugs de yang skye mched drug po nyid de cha gnyis su byas nas reg pa'i rkyen du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs de yang skye mched drug po nyid de cha gnyis su byas nas reg pa'i rkyen du 'gyur te /
translated: Name-and-form is the six sense spheres themselves, which become the condition of contact when divided into two parts.

original: yid kyi skye mched gzugs med pa de las gzhan pa'i gzugs med pa'i chos rnams dang @256a * //
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched gzugs med pa de las gzhan pa'i gzugs med pa'i chos rnams dang @256a * //
translated: The mental sense sphere is one part, and the formless phenomena that are other than that are the second part.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa cha gcig tu byas pa ni ming yin no //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa cha gcig tu byas pa ni ming yin no //
translated: The first part is name.

original: de ma yin pa'i gzugs can gyi skye mched rnams cha gcig tu byas pa ni gzugs yin no //
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i gzugs can gyi skye mched rnams cha gcig tu byas pa ni gzugs yin no //
translated: The second part, the sense spheres that have form, is form.

original: ming dang gzugs de yang tshe 'di la nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pas 'phangs pa dang / zin pa'i rkyen las byung ba ste /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs de yang tshe 'di la nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pas 'phangs pa dang / zin pa'i rkyen las byung ba ste /
translated: Name-and-form arises from the condition of the consciousness that connects with this life and is projected by it.

original: de dang ma bral na med par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de dang ma bral na med par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If it is not separated from that, it does not cease to exist.

original: rnam par shes pa de yang nying mtshams sbyor ba blangs nas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de yang nying mtshams sbyor ba blangs nas /
translated: Moreover, that consciousness, having taken up the connection,

original: ming dang gzugs kho na la gnas te lhan cig 'byung ba dang / de ma thag tu skye ba'i tshul gyis 'jug go //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kho na la gnas te lhan cig 'byung ba dang / de ma thag tu skye ba'i tshul gyis 'jug go //
translated: remains in name-and-form alone, and functions by the mode of co-arising and immediate arising.

original: de bas na de yang tshe 'di la ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: de bas na de yang tshe 'di la ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen las byung ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, it also arises from the condition of name-and-form in this life.

original: sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa'i ming dang / gzugs dang rnam par shes pa ni gcig la gcig brten pa dang / gcig gi rkyen gcig yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa'i ming dang / gzugs dang rnam par shes pa ni gcig la gcig brten pa dang / gcig gi rkyen gcig yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Name-and-form and consciousness projected by past karma should be understood as mutually dependent and as conditions for each other.

original: de ltar na srid pa'i yan lag rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs la thug pa 'di rnams kyang snga ma bzhin du rga shi'i rgyud bzhin du ci rigs par rkyen yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na srid pa'i yan lag rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs la thug pa 'di rnams kyang snga ma bzhin du rga shi'i rgyud bzhin du ci rigs par rkyen yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: Thus, these members of existence up to consciousness and name-and-form, as well as aging and death, should be understood as having conditions in the same way as explained above, in whatever way is appropriate.

original: 'di ni rgyu dang 'bras bu cha phra ba shes par dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rgyu dang 'bras bu cha phra ba shes par dka' ba yin no //
translated: This is the subtle cause and effect that is difficult to understand.

original: de shes par dka' bas na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab cing mchog tu zab pa yin no //
analyzed: de shes par dka' bas na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab cing mchog tu zab pa yin no //
translated: Since it is difficult to understand, dependent origination is profound and supremely profound.

original: bdag med pa dang shes par dka' ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdag med pa dang shes par dka' ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is meant by ‚Äúselflessness‚Äù and ‚Äúdifficult to understand‚Äù?

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa de ji tsam pa de tsam du sems can gyi ris thams cad la spyir sems can zhes bya ba'i tshig bla dags 'byung ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam par gzhag pa de ji tsam pa de tsam du sems can gyi ris thams cad la spyir sems can zhes bya ba'i tshig bla dags 'byung ste /
translated: To the extent that the principles of cause and effect in dependent origination are understood, to that extent the general designation ‚Äúliving beings‚Äù is applied to the entire realm of living beings.

original: tshig bla dags de'i lam yang de kho na yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩde la gnas nas sems can gyi ris tha dad pa'i bye brag gis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshig bla dags de'i lam yang de kho na yin par rig par bya'o // de la gnas nas sems can gyi ris tha dad pa'i bye brag gis 'di lta ste /
translated: It should be understood that this designation is based on the very same principle.

original: bya dang nya dang sdig sbrul dang / lha dang mi zhes bya ba'i nges pa'i tshig 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya dang nya dang sdig sbrul dang / lha dang mi zhes bya ba'i nges pa'i tshig 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: On the basis of that principle, the specific designations of the various classes of living beings come into being, such as ‚Äúbird,‚Äù ‚Äúfish,‚Äù ‚Äúsnake,‚Äù ‚Äúgod,‚Äù and ‚Äúhuman.‚Äù

original: gdags pa ni so so'i ming gis dbye ba ste /
analyzed: gdags pa ni so so'i ming gis dbye ba ste /
translated: Designation is the application of individual names.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: ne tso dang / ri skegs dang / rma bya dang / rnam thos kyi bu dang / yul 'khor srung dang / 'phags skyes po dang / mig mi bzang dang / sh'a ri'i bu dang / bzang po dang / skyabs med zas sbyin dang / don thams cad grub pa zhes bya ba'i bye brag gis 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: ne tso dang / ri skegs dang / rma bya dang / rnam thos kyi bu dang / yul 'khor srung dang / 'phags skyes po dang / mig mi bzang dang / sh'a ri'i bu dang / bzang po dang / skyabs med zas sbyin dang / don thams cad grub pa zhes bya ba'i bye brag gis 'jug pa ste /
translated: the parrot, the myna bird, the peacock, Vaisravana, Dhritarashtra, Virudhaka, Virupaksha, Sariputra, Bhadrapala, Anathapindada, and Sarvarthasiddha.

original: de tsam gyis ni tha snyad du gdags pa'i skyes bu de dag la tshig @256b 'jug par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni tha snyad du gdags pa'i skyes bu de dag la tshig @256b 'jug par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: These terms are applied to these individuals in the conventional sense.

original: de rnams kyi tshor ba gang ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi tshor ba gang ci yang rung ste /
translated: Whatever feelings they have,

original: rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba dang / ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba dang / rig pa yang ma yin ma rig pa yang ma yin pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba de dag thams cad ni ming dang /
analyzed: rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba dang / ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba dang / rig pa yang ma yin ma rig pa yang ma yin pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba de dag thams cad ni ming dang /
translated: whether they arise from contact with awareness, from contact with non-awareness, or from contact with that which is neither aware nor non-aware, all of them are associated with name-and-form.

original: gzugs dang ldan te /
analyzed: gzugs dang ldan te /
translated: Name-and-form is the basis for the arising of feelings.

original: ming dang gzugs ma lus par 'gags na tshor ba 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ma lus par 'gags na tshor ba 'byung ba med do //
translated: When name-and-form ceases completely, feelings do not arise.

original: 'di ni bdag med par shes par dka' ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag med par shes par dka' ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this is difficult to know without a self.

original: de la bral ba'i sems can rnams ldan par shes par dka' ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bral ba'i sems can rnams ldan par shes par dka' ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the difficulty of knowing that beings are endowed with what is lacking?

original: 'di ltar 'di las phyi rol ba'i mu stegs can ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor bas zin pa ni rnam pa gsum gyi sgo nas bdag med pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i 'du byed dag la bdag tu brtags nas lta zhing stonüîΩpar byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di las phyi rol ba'i mu stegs can ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor bas zin pa ni rnam pa gsum gyi sgo nas bdag med pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i 'du byed dag la bdag tu brtags nas lta zhing ston par byed de /
translated: Thus, non-Buddhist philosophers, who are seized by the feeling that arises from the contact of ignorance, imagine a self in the formations that arise through dependent origination, and they teach it in three ways.

original: sgo gsum po gang zhe na /
analyzed: sgo gsum po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three ways?

original: 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba ni 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i tshor ba rnam pa gsum las gcig la ni tshor bar bya ba'i bdag gir lta la /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba ni 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i tshor ba rnam pa gsum las gcig la ni tshor bar bya ba'i bdag gir lta la /
translated: One who is not free from attachment to the objects of desire views the self as the experiencer of one of the three kinds of feeling that are associated with desire.

original: gcig la ni tshor ba por bdag tu lta'o //
analyzed: gcig la ni tshor ba por bdag tu lta'o //
translated: He views the self as the experiencer of the other two.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral la bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba ni bde ba'i tshor ba gcig pu myong zhing myong bar bya ba de la yang bdag gir rtogs pa na /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral la bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba ni bde ba'i tshor ba gcig pu myong zhing myong bar bya ba de la yang bdag gir rtogs pa na /
translated: One who is free from attachment to the desire realm but not free from attachment to the third absorption experiences only the feeling of pleasure.

original: tshor ba de las tha dad pa'i tshor ba po'i bdag tshor ba de'i sgo nas tshor ba'i chos can tshor ba de yang rig pa gang yin pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: tshor ba de las tha dad pa'i tshor ba po'i bdag tshor ba de'i sgo nas tshor ba'i chos can tshor ba de yang rig pa gang yin pa mthong ngo //
translated: When one conceives of that feeling as mine, one sees a self that is a feeler separate from that feeling, and one sees that feeling as the property of the feeler.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i gong ma'i sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba cha phra ba khong du ma chud nas /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i gong ma'i sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba cha phra ba khong du ma chud nas /
translated: One who has not understood the subtle feeling of neither pleasure nor pain above the third absorption,

original: tshor ba med na ni bdag gis bdag ni tshor ba med do snyam du brtags nas lta bar byed de /
analyzed: tshor ba med na ni bdag gis bdag ni tshor ba med do snyam du brtags nas lta bar byed de /
translated: when there is no feeling, thinks, ‚ÄúI am without feeling,‚Äù and views it.

original: de de dag gi rnam pa gsum gyi sgo nas bdag tu lta ba de dag thams cad ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de de dag gi rnam pa gsum gyi sgo nas bdag tu lta ba de dag thams cad ni mi rung ngo //
translated: All of these views of the self in terms of those three aspects are untenable.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshor ba gsum po rnams mi rtag pas bdag kyang mi rtag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshor ba gsum po rnams mi rtag pas bdag kyang mi rtag pa'i phyir te /
translated: Since the three feelings are impermanent, the self would also be impermanent.

original: tshor ba gsum po de bdag tu mthong bas de'i phyir mi rung ngo //
analyzed: tshor ba gsum po de bdag tu mthong bas de'i phyir mi rung ngo //
translated: Since the three feelings are seen as the self, that is not tenable.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / de'i gong gang na tshor ba'i bde ba med pa de na yang bde ba tshor ba po yang med pas na /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / de'i gong gang na tshor ba'i bde ba med pa de na yang bde ba tshor ba po yang med pas na /
translated: Also, in the fourth absorption and above, where the feeling of pleasure does not exist, there is no one who feels pleasure.

original: de na bde ba'i tshor ba'i sgo nas tshor ba'i chos can gyis bdag yod par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de na bde ba'i tshor ba'i sgo nas tshor ba'i chos can gyis bdag yod par mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore it is not tenable that the self exists there as a phenomenon that feels pleasure through the feeling of pleasure.

original: @257a * // gcig tu na bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / de'i gong ma gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag na /
analyzed: @257a * // gcig tu na bsam gtan bzhi pa dang / de'i gong ma gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag na /
translated: In the fourth absorption and above,üîΩif the self did not exist as the experiencer of the feeling of pleasure, then the thought ‚ÄúI am happy‚Äù would not arise from the feeling of pleasure that arises from the attainment of peace.

original: gal te sor sor nyams su myong ba'i bdag med du zin na ni de dag gi zhi ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa las byung ba'i tshor bas bdag zhi bar gyur to snyam du 'dzin pa yang med par 'gyur ba zhig ni de yang yod de de bas na
analyzed: gal te sor sor nyams su myong ba'i bdag med du zin na ni de dag gi zhi ba'i snyoms par 'jug pa las byung ba'i tshor bas bdag zhi bar gyur to snyam du 'dzin pa yang med par 'gyur ba zhig ni de yang yod de de bas na
translated: But that thought does exist.

original: de yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore that is not tenable.

original: de la gal te rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab pa ma yin du zin na ni de de ltar de ma shes pas /
analyzed: de la gal te rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab pa ma yin du zin na ni de de ltar de ma shes pas /
translated: If dependent origination were not profound, then it would not be the case that through not understanding it,üîΩ

original: de dag gi lta ba mi rung bar mi 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: de dag gi lta ba mi rung bar mi 'gyur ba'i rigs so //
translated: If dependent origination were not profound, then it would not be the case that their views are untenable because of not understanding it.

original: chos 'di pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa ni rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor bas zin pa na thams cad la yang mi rigs par shes pas bdag tu mi lta'o //
analyzed: chos 'di pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa ni rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor bas zin pa na thams cad la yang mi rigs par shes pas bdag tu mi lta'o //
translated: The noble disciples of the Buddha, who are learned and have experienced the feelings that arise from contact with right knowledge, do not view a self because they know that everything is untenable.

original: de ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa la mkhas te /
analyzed: de ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa la mkhas te /
translated: They are skilled in conventional and ultimate truth.

original: de bzhin 'ongs pa shi phan chad yod par mi 'dzin pas na snga ma bzhin du yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pa'i bar du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin 'ongs pa shi phan chad yod par mi 'dzin pas na snga ma bzhin du yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin pa'i bar du sbyar ro //
translated: Since they do not hold that the TathƒÅgata exists after death, the same should be applied to the statement that he does not exist after death, up to the statement that he both exists and does not exist after death.

original: rnam par grol ba'i sems de nyid la yang gang 'di skad du yod par 'gyur ram zhes 'dri na /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i sems de nyid la yang gang 'di skad du yod par 'gyur ram zhes 'dri na /
translated: If one were to ask about the liberated mind, ‚ÄúWill it exist?‚Äù

original: de yang de kho na bzhin te lan mi 'debs so //
analyzed: de yang de kho na bzhin te lan mi 'debs so //
translated: then, just as before, the answer would be that it is not tenable to say that it will exist.

original: med par 'gyur ba dang / gnyi ga dang / gnyi gar mi 'gyur ba de dag thams cad kyang de kho na bzhin te /
analyzed: med par 'gyur ba dang / gnyi ga dang / gnyi gar mi 'gyur ba de dag thams cad kyang de kho na bzhin te /
translated: All of these, whether they are existent, nonexistent, both, or neither, are just as they are.

original: lan mi 'debs so //
analyzed: lan mi 'debs so //
translated: I do not respond.

original: de ltar shes pa sngon du btang ste /
analyzed: de ltar shes pa sngon du btang ste /
translated: Having understood this,

original: lan mi 'debs pa la mi shes pa yin no snyam du brnyas pa byed pa de ni de nyid kyi mi shes pa chen po dang log par lta ba yin no //
analyzed: lan mi 'debs pa la mi shes pa yin no snyam du brnyas pa byed pa de ni de nyid kyi mi shes pa chen po dang log par lta ba yin no //
translated: if you think that my not responding is a sign of ignorance and you despise me, then that is your own great ignorance and wrong view.

original: phyi rol pa de lta bu'i lta ba spyod pa de ni snga ma bzhin du lta ba rnam pa gsum la brten nas /
analyzed: phyi rol pa de lta bu'i lta ba spyod pa de ni snga ma bzhin du lta ba rnam pa gsum la brten nas /
translated: As before, the non-Buddhist who practices such a view, based on the three types of views,

original: tshe 'di la bdag gzugs can nam ;
analyzed: tshe 'di la bdag gzugs can nam ;
translated: in this life imputes the self to beüîΩeither having form,

original: gzugs can ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa'am /
translated: or formless,

original: chung ngu'am tshad med par 'dogs so //
analyzed: chung ngu'am tshad med par 'dogs so //
translated: or small, or immeasurable.

original: ji ltar tsha 'di la nor bar brtags nas dmigs shing ston pa de bzhin du phyis kyang phyi ma mthong ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar tsha 'di la nor bar brtags nas dmigs shing ston pa de bzhin du phyis kyang phyi ma mthong ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as in this life he imputes and demonstrates the self through error, so he will see the self in the future in the same way.

original: rnam pa du mar nor bar bdag tu rtog mod kyi /
analyzed: rnam pa du mar nor bar bdag tu rtog mod kyi /
translated: Although he imagines the self in many ways,

original: 'on kyang de'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba bag la nyal dang ldan pa ni rnam pa gcig pur zad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba bag la nyal dang ldan pa ni rnam pa gcig pur zad do //
translated: But the latent proclivity of the afflicted view of the self is not abandoned.

original: de ma spangs pas srid pa'i rtse mor song du zin kyang 'jig pa'i rten pa'i lam dma' ba'i sgo nas de dang bral mod kyi ldan pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ma spangs pas srid pa'i rtse mor song du zin kyang 'jig pa'i rten pa'i lam dma' ba'i sgo nas de dang bral mod kyi ldan pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Even if one has gone to the summit of existence, one is not separated from it by the mundane path, because it is not abandoned.

original: 'di ni bral ba'i sems can rnams ldan par shes par dka' ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni bral ba'i sems can rnams ldan par shes par dka' ba yin te /
translated: It is difficult to know that beings are separated from it.

original: @257b de la ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa 'ba' zhig shes pas 'jug go //
analyzed: @257b de la ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa 'ba' zhig shes pas 'jug go //
translated: One should know that only those who are skilled in dependent origination can understand this.

original: de la ldan pa'i sems can rnams 'bral bar shes par dka' ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ldan pa'i sems can rnams 'bral bar shes par dka' ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is difficult to know about beings who are separated from it?

original: 'di la 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa ni rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang ldan na tshe 'di yang bdag tu mi dmigs shing mi 'dogs la de ltar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di la 'phags pa nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa ni rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang ldan na tshe 'di yang bdag tu mi dmigs shing mi 'dogs la de ltar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the noble disciple who has learning, when he is endowed with feeling that arises from the contact of consciousness, does not apprehend or designate a self in this life, nor does he think that he will become such in the future.

original: lus dang bral ba'i 'og tu yang bdag tu mi dmigs shing mi 'dogs so //
analyzed: lus dang bral ba'i 'og tu yang bdag tu mi dmigs shing mi 'dogs so //
translated: And after separation from the body, he does not apprehend or designate a self.

original: rnam par shes pa'i gnas bdun la sems can thams cad btags nas thur du nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa'i skye mched dang ; yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba rnam par shes pa'i skye mched dang rnam par shes pa'i gnas de dag dang / skye mched de gnyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i bden pa'i tshul gyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du brtags na //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i gnas bdun la sems can thams cad btags nas thur du nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa'i skye mched dang ; yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba rnam par shes pa'i skye mched dang rnam par shes pa'i gnas de dag dang / skye mched de gnyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i bden pa'i tshul gyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du brtags na //
translated: Having designated all sentient beings in the seven abodes of consciousness, he investigates the truth of dependent origination in accordance with reality by means of the two bases of consciousness: the base of the consciousness that is presently connecting to rebirth and the base of the consciousness that will arise again.

original: dgra bcom pa shes rab rnam par grol ba'am /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa shes rab rnam par grol ba'am /
translated: The arhat who is liberated by wisdom,

original: gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba rnam par thar pa brgyad la bsam gtan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i cha las rnam par grol ba rnam par thar pa brgyad la bsam gtan par 'gyur te /
translated: or the one who is liberated in both ways, is absorbed in the eight liberations.

original: de ni tshe 'di la skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi bar snang mod kyi 'on kyang de ni de dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni tshe 'di la skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi bar snang mod kyi 'on kyang de ni de dang bral ba yin no //
translated: Although birth, aging, and death appear in this life, he is free from them.

original: tshor ba myong bar snang mod kyi /
analyzed: tshor ba myong bar snang mod kyi /
translated: Although the experience of feeling appears,

original: 'on kyang de ni tshor ba dang bral lo //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni tshor ba dang bral lo //
translated: But it is devoid of feeling.

original: rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs su snang mod kyi 'on kyang de ni de dang bral te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs su snang mod kyi 'on kyang de ni de dang bral te /
translated: Although consciousness and name-and-form appear, still they are devoid of them.

original: 'di ni ldan pa'i sems can rnams 'bral bar shes par dka' ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni ldan pa'i sems can rnams 'bral bar shes par dka' ba yin te /
translated: This is the difficulty of discerning the separation of embodied beings.

original: de ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa 'ba' zhig gis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so //
analyzed: de ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa 'ba' zhig gis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes so //
translated: Only one who is skilled in dependent origination knows it as it really is.

original: rnam pa 'di bzhis ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mchog tu zab par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'di bzhis ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mchog tu zab par rig par bya'o //
translated: By these four aspects, dependent origination should be understood as extremely profound.üîΩThe summary:üîΩThe distinctions, the conventional, the ultimate,üîΩreality, its function,

original: sdom ni / khyad par kun rdzob don dam dang // chos nyid dang ni de byed dang // stong nyid chen po rnam par 'byed //
analyzed: sdom ni / khyad par kun rdzob don dam dang // chos nyid dang ni de byed dang // stong nyid chen po rnam par 'byed //
translated: the great emptiness, the analysis,

original: gang gis byas pa tha ma yin //
analyzed: gang gis byas pa tha ma yin //
translated: and the last, the one who does.

original: chos 'dul ba 'di la ni byis pa dang mkhas pa gnyis sngon gyi mtha' nas dbus kyi mthar thug pa'i nyon mongs pa gnyis las rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos 'dul ba 'di la ni byis pa dang mkhas pa gnyis sngon gyi mtha' nas dbus kyi mthar thug pa'i nyon mongs pa gnyis las rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: In this Dharma and Vinaya, the bodies of both the childish and the wise are formed from the two afflictions, from the prior limit to the middle limit, along with consciousness.

original: lus de'i rkyen gyis phyi rol gyi sems can dang / sems can ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i ming dang gzugs kyis bsdus pa'i yul gyi tshor ba rnam pa gsum myong mod kyi 'on kyang @258a * //
analyzed: lus de'i rkyen gyis phyi rol gyi sems can dang / sems can ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i ming dang gzugs kyis bsdus pa'i yul gyi tshor ba rnam pa gsum myong mod kyi 'on kyang @258a * //
translated: Due to the condition of that body, the three types of feeling are experienced in relation to external objects, which are included in name-and-form, called sentient and non-sentient beings.

original: mkhas pa ni byis pa las sngon gyi mtha' dang / da ltar gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i sgo nas khyad che bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa ni byis pa las sngon gyi mtha' dang / da ltar gyi mtha' dang / phyi ma'i mtha'i sgo nas khyad che bar rig par bya'o //
translated: However, the wise should be known as greatly superior to the childish in terms of the prior limit, the present limit, and the future limit.

original: de la dbus kyi mtha' gtogs pa'i khyad par ni rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa gang las lus grub par gyur ba de gnyis tshe 'di la spong bar 'gyur la des de gnyis spangs pas phyi ma la yang lus 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la dbus kyi mtha' gtogs pa'i khyad par ni rtsa ba'i nyon mongs pa gang las lus grub par gyur ba de gnyis tshe 'di la spong bar 'gyur la des de gnyis spangs pas phyi ma la yang lus 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The difference included in the middle limit is that the two afflictions from which the body is formed are abandoned in this life, and by abandoning those two, the body is not taken up again in the future.

original: 'di ni phyi ma'i mthar gtogs pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'di ni phyi ma'i mthar gtogs pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: This is the distinction that pertains to the future.

original: ci'i phyir mkhas pas mkhas pa thob par gyur te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mkhas pas mkhas pa thob par gyur te /
translated: Why is the wise one called wise?

original: de'i tshe 'di la kun 'byung ba'i bden pa dang bral bar gyur la phyi ma'i mthar yang sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang bral bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di la kun 'byung ba'i bden pa dang bral bar gyur la phyi ma'i mthar yang sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang bral bar 'gyur /
translated: At that time, he is free from the truth of origination in this life and he will be free from the truth of suffering in the future.

original: ci'i phyir byis pa rnams byis par gyur te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir byis pa rnams byis par gyur te /
translated: Why is the fool called a fool?

original: gang gis na de gnyis spong mi nus par gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis na de gnyis spong mi nus par gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is he unable to abandon both?

original: mkhas pas ni sngon ye shes kyi tshogs kyis bsdus pa'i tshangs par spyod pa btsal ba spyad la byis pas ni ma spyad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mkhas pas ni sngon ye shes kyi tshogs kyis bsdus pa'i tshangs par spyod pa btsal ba spyad la byis pas ni ma spyad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the wise one has practiced the pure life that is included in the collection of knowledge in the past, but the fool has not.

original: 'di ni byis pa las mkhas pa khyad par du gyur ba sngon gyi mthar gtogs pa gang yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni byis pa las mkhas pa khyad par du gyur ba sngon gyi mthar gtogs pa gang yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the distinction that pertains to the past between the wise one and the fool.

original: 'di la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa /
analyzed: 'di la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa /
translated: Here, the wise one is skilled in dependent origination.

original: thos pa dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa'i nyan thos ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
analyzed: thos pa dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa'i nyan thos ni kun rdzob dang don dam pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes te /
translated: The noble disciple who has learning knows the conventional and the ultimate just as they are, in reality.

original: rab tu shes pas na tshe 'di la rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus dang / chos thams cad la bdag med par shes nas /
analyzed: rab tu shes pas na tshe 'di la rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus dang / chos thams cad la bdag med par shes nas /
translated: Because he knows them, he does not cling to the body with consciousness in this life, nor to any dharma, having understood that all dharmas are without self.üîΩThis is mine.

original: 'di ni bdag gi'o //üîΩ'di ni bdag yin no snyam du mngon par zhen pa med do //üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi'o // 'di ni bdag yin no snyam du mngon par zhen pa med do // 'di lta ste /
translated: This is my self.

original: don dam pa la mkhas pa des ni de ltar log par mngon par zhen pa med pas sems can rnams kyi 'du byed kyi rgyur gtogs pa'i las bdag gir bya ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa'i phyir gzhan gyi byed pa po
analyzed: don dam pa la mkhas pa des ni de ltar log par mngon par zhen pa med pas sems can rnams kyi 'du byed kyi rgyur gtogs pa'i las bdag gir bya ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa'i phyir gzhan gyi byed pa po
translated: Because of his skill in the ultimate, he does not cling to them in this way. He knows that the karma of beings, which is the cause of their conditioning, is their own.

original: gzhan ma yin la ma byas par yang bde legs su 'gyur ba med par rig nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir brtson par byed do //üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin la ma byas par yang bde legs su 'gyur ba med par rig nas nyon mongs pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir brtson par byed do //üîΩ'di lta ste /
translated: He knows that there is no other agent, and that there is no well-being without action. Knowing this, he strives for freedom from the afflictions.üîΩBecause of his skill in the conventional, he does not deny the conventional world.

original: kun rdzob la mkhas pa des ni yang dag pa ma yin pa la sgo 'dogs pa dang / yod pa'i dngos po chud gzon pa yongs su spangs nas /üîΩsngon sems pas mong par 'dus byas shing /
analyzed: kun rdzob la mkhas pa des ni yang dag pa ma yin pa la sgo 'dogs pa dang / yod pa'i dngos po chud gzon pa yongs su spangs nas / sngon sems pas mong par 'dus byas shing /
translated: The one who is skilled in the conventional avoids the superimposition of the unreal and the wasting of real things.üîΩHe has previously cultivated the practice of the dependent origination that arises from hearing and reflection, through the door of aspiration,

original: smon pa'i sgo nas 'dod pa'i yid smon du byas pa'i tshe 'di rnam @258b par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa'i rnam pa thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa la brten
analyzed: smon pa'i sgo nas 'dod pa'i yid smon du byas pa'i tshe 'di rnam @258b par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus la zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom pa'i rnam pa thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa la brten
translated: and he has made a vow. When he is in a state of desire, he is supported by that very practice of the dependent origination, which is the cultivation of serenity and insight in the body with consciousness.

original: pa de nyid kyis rjes su 'jug pas rnam par shes pa dang / reg pa dang/ tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang sems pa'i tshogs rnams la ni sdug bsngal bar rtog go //
analyzed: pa de nyid kyis rjes su 'jug pas rnam par shes pa dang / reg pa dang/ tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang sems pa'i tshogs rnams la ni sdug bsngal bar rtog go //
translated: He understands that the aggregates of consciousness, contact, feeling, perception, and volition are suffering.

original: sred pa'i tshogs la dbye ba'i sgo nas brtags pa ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa brtags pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sred pa'i tshogs la dbye ba'i sgo nas brtags pa ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa brtags pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The investigation of the aggregate of craving by way of its divisions should be understood as the investigation of the truth of the origin.

original: de bden pa 'di gnyis kyi 'byung ba dang 'jig par shes pas na //
analyzed: de bden pa 'di gnyis kyi 'byung ba dang 'jig par shes pas na //
translated: Since he knows the origination and cessation of these two truths,

original: rgyu kun 'byung bar gyur na ji ltar kun 'byung bar gyur pa dang / rgyu 'gags na ji ltar 'gag par 'gyur ba de yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgyu kun 'byung bar gyur na ji ltar kun 'byung bar gyur pa dang / rgyu 'gags na ji ltar 'gag par 'gyur ba de yang 'di lta ste /
translated: he also knows how the origination of a cause is the origination of a result, and how the cessation of a cause is the cessation of a result.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i 'jig rten pa'i yid la byed pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pas so //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i 'jig rten pa'i yid la byed pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pas so //
translated: He knows this through the mundane attention of the stage of meditative equipoise, in accordance with reality.

original: de yid la byed pa de nyid la kun du brten pa'i rgyus gang gi tshe bden pa mngon par rtogs par byed pas na /
analyzed: de yid la byed pa de nyid la kun du brten pa'i rgyus gang gi tshe bden pa mngon par rtogs par byed pas na /
translated: When he causes the realization of the truth by means of that very attention,

original: des sngar thos pa dang bsams pa las byung bas ni 'jig rten 'byung ba dang / 'jig rten 'gag pa legs par mthong zhing legs par khong du chud do //
analyzed: des sngar thos pa dang bsams pa las byung bas ni 'jig rten 'byung ba dang / 'jig rten 'gag pa legs par mthong zhing legs par khong du chud do //
translated: he sees and understands well the origination and cessation of the world through the attention that arises from hearing and reflection.

original: bsgoms pa las byung bas ni legs par yid la byas so //
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung bas ni legs par yid la byas so //
translated: He attends to it well through the attention that arises from meditative development.

original: bden pa mngon par rtogs pa la bab pa'i tshe ni ji snyed yod pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin yod pa'i sgo nas legs par brten pa dang / legs par rtogs te go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: bden pa mngon par rtogs pa la bab pa'i tshe ni ji snyed yod pa dang / ji lta ba bzhin yod pa'i sgo nas legs par brten pa dang / legs par rtogs te go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: When one has reached the realization of the truths, one has well-founded and well-penetrated knowledge of things in their diversity and in their real nature, respectively.

original: de de'i tshe thos pa dang bsams pa las byung bas ni dam pa'i chos 'di la zhugs so //
analyzed: de de'i tshe thos pa dang bsams pa las byung bas ni dam pa'i chos 'di la zhugs so //
translated: At that time, one has entered the true Dharma through the knowledge that arises from hearing and reflection.

original: bsgoms pa las byung bas ni nye bar zhugs so //
analyzed: bsgoms pa las byung bas ni nye bar zhugs so //
translated: One has approached it through the knowledge that arises from meditative realization.

original: bden pa khong du chud pa'i sgo nas ni dam pa'i chos rtogs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bden pa khong du chud pa'i sgo nas ni dam pa'i chos rtogs zhes bya'o //
translated: One is said to have penetrated the true Dharma through the realization of the truths.

original: gang gi phyir zhugs pa dang / nye bar gyur bar zhugs pa de'i phyir ni gting slebs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhugs pa dang / nye bar gyur bar zhugs pa de'i phyir ni gting slebs so //
translated: One has reached the bottom because one has entered and approached it.

original: gang gi phyir dam pa'i chos rtogs pa de'i phyir ni kun du gting slebs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dam pa'i chos rtogs pa de'i phyir ni kun du gting slebs so //
translated: One has completely reached the bottom because one has penetrated the true Dharma.

original: slob pa'i shes rab la ni 'jig rten gyi 'byung ba dang / nub pa'i shes rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: slob pa'i shes rab la ni 'jig rten gyi 'byung ba dang / nub pa'i shes rab ces bya'o //
translated: The wisdom of the learner is called the wisdom of the world‚Äôs arising and passing away.

original: de yang zag pa med pa dang / 'phags pa'i rgyu la dmigs pas ni 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: de yang zag pa med pa dang / 'phags pa'i rgyu la dmigs pas ni 'phags pa'o //
translated: It is noble because it focuses on the uncontaminated and the cause of the noble.

original: nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal thams cad zad par bya ba'i phyir nges par 'byung bas na de'i phyir @259a * //üîΩnges par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal thams cad zad par bya ba'i phyir nges par 'byung bas na de'i phyir @259a * // nges par 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is a going-forth because it goes forth to the exhaustion of all the defilements and sufferings.

original: gtan du mthar thug par 'gro bas na de'i phyir nges par byed do //
analyzed: gtan du mthar thug par 'gro bas na de'i phyir nges par byed do //
translated: It is a definite-release because it definitely releases from the three realms.

original: de de dang ldan na gong du nyon mongs pa thams cad spong par bya'o snyam nas de nyid lan mang du byed de sdug bsngal thams cad zad par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam la nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de de dang ldan na gong du nyon mongs pa thams cad spong par bya'o snyam nas de nyid lan mang du byed de sdug bsngal thams cad zad par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam la nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When one possesses it, one frequently practices it, thinking that one should abandon all the defilements above. One goes forth to the path of cultivation in order to exhaust all suffering.

original: de ltar na de la las dang po pa'i sa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de ltar na de la las dang po pa'i sa nas bzung ste /
translated: Thus, it is taught that the path of cultivation is from the stage of the beginner

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i lam la thug pa'i bar du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu'i lam la thug pa'i bar du bstan pa yin no //
translated: up to the path of the fruit of arhatship.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos rnams ni rgyu gnyis kyis cha gnyis su rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos rnams ni rgyu gnyis kyis cha gnyis su rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: Dependent origination and the dharmas of dependent origination are posited as two parts by way of two causes:

original: ji ltar 'jug pa dang / gang rnams 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jug pa dang / gang rnams 'jug pa'o //
translated: how they engage and what they engage.

original: de la srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis ni 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de la srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis ni 'jug pa'o //
translated: The twelve members of existence are the process of becoming.

original: de dag kyang ci rigs par rigs pa'i rgyu dang 'brus bu'i rim pas 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dag kyang ci rigs par rigs pa'i rgyu dang 'brus bu'i rim pas 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: And they are the process of becoming because they are the process of cause and effect in their proper order.

original: rigs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rim pa de thog ma med pa'i dus nas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i lugs gang yin pa de ni chos nyid do //
analyzed: rigs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rim pa de thog ma med pa'i dus nas gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i lugs gang yin pa de ni chos nyid do //
translated: The order of cause and effect in its proper order is the nature of things, which has been going on from beginningless time.

original: da ltar gyi dus kyi sgo nas ni chos gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus kyi sgo nas ni chos gnas pa nyid do //
translated: The present time is the stability of the nature of things.

original: 'das pa'i dus kyi sgo nas ni chos mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus kyi sgo nas ni chos mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: The past time is the immutability of the nature of things.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi sgo nas ni chos ji lta ba nyid do //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi sgo nas ni chos ji lta ba nyid do //
translated: The future time is the suchness of things.

original: rgyu med pa ma yin pa'i sgo nas ni de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid do //üîΩyang dag pa ji lta ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i sgo nas ni yang dag pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu med pa ma yin pa'i sgo nas ni de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid do // yang dag pa ji lta ba'i rgyu las byung ba'i sgo nas ni yang dag pa nyid do //
translated: The absence of a cause is suchness and unerring suchness.üîΩThe arising of a true cause is reality.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba'i 'bras bu'i sgo nas ni bden pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba'i 'bras bu'i sgo nas ni bden pa nyid do //
translated: The result of reality is truth.

original: shes bya yang dag pa'i sgo nas ni de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: shes bya yang dag pa'i sgo nas ni de kho na nyid do //
translated: Reality is from the perspective of the object of knowledge.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba'i ye shes kyi gnas kyi sgo nas ni ma nor ba nyid dang / phyin ci ma log pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba'i ye shes kyi gnas kyi sgo nas ni ma nor ba nyid dang / phyin ci ma log pa nyid do //
translated: Non-erroneousness and non-reversal are from the perspective of the basis of knowledge of reality as it is.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i tshig rnam par gzhag pa'i gnas kyi sgo nas ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'di dang mthun pa nyid do //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i tshig rnam par gzhag pa'i gnas kyi sgo nas ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'di dang mthun pa nyid do //
translated: Consistency with dependent origination is from the perspective of the basis of the arrangement of the words of dependent origination.

original: 'di gnyis la mkhas pa'i thos pa dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos ni dus gsum gyi tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yongs su shes nas yongs su spong bar yang byed cing bden pa mngon par rtogs par yang byed la phyi rol gyi ltaüîΩbar gyur ba rnams dang 'bral bar yang 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di gnyis la mkhas pa'i thos pa dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos ni dus gsum gyi tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa yongs su shes nas yongs su spong bar yang byed cing bden pa mngon par rtogs par yang byed la phyi rol gyi lta bar gyur ba rnams dang 'bral bar yang 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The noble ≈õrƒÅvaka who is learned and skilled in these two, having fully understood and abandoned improper mental activity in the three times, realizes the truths and attains freedom from external views.

original: snga ma bzhin du @259b zhugs pa nas rgyas par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du @259b zhugs pa nas rgyas par shes par bya'o //
translated: As before, it should be understood in detail.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas zhugs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i yang dag pa'i 'jug pa ye shes kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas gsung gis yang dag par ston par mdzad kyi 'byin pa
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas zhugs pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i yang dag pa'i 'jug pa ye shes kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas gsung gis yang dag par ston par mdzad kyi 'byin pa
translated: The tathƒÅgatas fully awaken to the perfect entry of cause and effect that has been engaged since beginningless time, and they teach it with their speech.

original: dang / byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dang / byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They do not create it.

original: de la thog ma med pa'i dus nas rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i chos nyid ye gnas pa gang yin pa de ni de dang ldan pa'i ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs de brda sprod pa dang mthun pa rnams kyi lugs gnas par
analyzed: de la thog ma med pa'i dus nas rgyu dang 'bras bu gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i chos nyid ye gnas pa gang yin pa de ni de dang ldan pa'i ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs de brda sprod pa dang mthun pa rnams kyi lugs gnas par
translated: The reality that has existed since beginningless time as the cause and effect of one thing after another is the element, lineage, and basis of those who possess it, in order to make the collection of names, words, and letters that are consistent with grammar

original: bya ba'i phyir khams dang rigs dang gnas yin no //
analyzed: bya ba'i phyir khams dang rigs dang gnas yin no //
translated: abide in a natural state.

original: de byed la des nyams su myong ba dang / gzhan byed la gzhan gyis myong ngo zhes bya ba ni rgyu gnyis kyis lan gdab par mi bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de byed la des nyams su myong ba dang / gzhan byed la gzhan gyis myong ngo zhes bya ba ni rgyu gnyis kyis lan gdab par mi bya ba yin te /
translated: It is not to be answered by saying that one person does it and another experiences it, or that one person does it and another experiences it.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?üîΩBecause they are the same in terms of being related as cause and effect in the continuum of conditioning factors, and they are different in terms of being sequential, and because a distinct agent and experiencer is not observed apart from that, one should not accept and should not adhere to such statements.

original: 'du byed kyi rgyud kyi rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel ba'i sgo nas gcig yin pa dang / snga phyi'i sgo nas tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir dang / de las tha dad pa'i byed pa po dang tshor ba po mi dmigs pa'i phyir de lta bu'i smra ba khas mi len cing mngon par zhen par mi byed par dbu ma'i lam gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu tsam du zad pa gang yin pa de kho na'i lanüîΩ'debs par byed do //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rgyud kyi rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel ba'i sgo nas gcig yin pa dang / snga phyi'i sgo nas tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir dang / de las tha dad pa'i byed pa po dang tshor ba po mi dmigs pa'i phyir de lta bu'i smra ba khas mi len cing mngon par zhen par mi byed par dbu ma'i lam gyi rgyu dang 'bras bu tsam du zad pa gang yin pa de kho na'i lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: One should only respond with the mere cause and effect of the middle way.

original: gang zag bdag med pa gang yin pa dang / chos bdag med pa gang yin pa'i bdag med pa thams cad ni spyir na stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag bdag med pa gang yin pa dang / chos bdag med pa gang yin pa'i bdag med pa thams cad ni spyir na stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: All forms of selflessness, which is the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena, are generally called ‚Äúemptiness.‚Äù

original: de la gang zag bdag med pa ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i 'du byed rnams las don tha dad pa'i bdag med pa'i phyir ro //

original: chos bdag med pa ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i 'du byed gang yin pa de dag nyid bdag med de mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos bdag med pa ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i 'du byed gang yin pa de dag nyid bdag med de mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //

original: gang du de gnyi ga gcig tu bsdus te bstan pa de ni chen po stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang du de gnyi ga gcig tu bsdus te bstan pa de ni chen po stong pa nyid ces bya'o //

original: gang tha snyad kyi sgo nas ma yin par lta ba la brten nas 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos 'di dag ni gzhan yin no zhe'am /

analyzed: 'di ltar de ni stong pa nyid cig shos kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi lta ba la brten nas 'dug pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that view of emptiness is based on the view of the opposite extreme, that is, of existence.

original: log par lta ba'i mtha' 'di gnyi ga spangs nas rgyu dang 'bras bu tsam du zad par lta ba ni dbu ma'i lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: log par lta ba'i mtha' 'di gnyi ga spangs nas rgyu dang 'bras bu tsam du zad par lta ba ni dbu ma'i lam zhes bya'o //
translated: The middle way is the view that rejects both extremes of the view of annihilation and the view of permanence and is the mere view of cause and effect.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba ni shes bya de bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba ni shes bya de bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //
