original: phyin ci ma log pa nyid ni shes pa de bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩ'du byed de dag yod na 'du byed 'di rnams sam /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa nyid ni shes pa de bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro // 'du byed de dag yod na 'du byed 'di rnams sam /
translated: It is nonerroneous, because it is the suchness of knowledge.

original: 'di'i 'du byed rnams zhes 'dogs par byed kyi /
analyzed: 'di'i 'du byed rnams zhes 'dogs par byed kyi /
translated: If those formations exist, then one designates them as ‚Äúthese formations‚Äù or ‚Äúhis or her formations.‚Äù

original: gal te de kho na bzhin du yang dag par yod du zin na 'du byed thams cad 'gags shing spangs par gyur ba na gang la ni 'du byed rnams zhes bya /
analyzed: gal te de kho na bzhin du yang dag par yod du zin na 'du byed thams cad 'gags shing spangs par gyur ba na gang la ni 'du byed rnams zhes bya /

original: gang gis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang gis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ste /
translated: And by whom would they be called ‚Äúformations‚Äù?

original: 'di ltar de'i tshe gnyi ga mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i tshe gnyi ga mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because at that time, neither of them can be apprehended.

original: / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Dependent origination is as follows:

original: bstan pa dang / rnam par dbye ba'i phyir rnam pa gnyis kyis rnam pa thams cad gdags par rig par bya ste /üîΩgnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: bstan pa dang / rnam par dbye ba'i phyir rnam pa gnyis kyis rnam pa thams cad gdags par rig par bya ste / gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: It should be understood that all of its aspects are designated by means of two kinds of existence:

original: ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa dang / ji snyed yod pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa dang / ji snyed yod pa'o //
translated: the way things are and the multiplicity of things.üîΩWhat is the way things are?

original: de la ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa ni ma rig pa la sogs pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos rnams gang dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu rim pa bzhin du 'tsham par 'byung ba dang / rgyu ma spangs na 'bras bu ma spangs par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: de la ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa ni ma rig pa la sogs pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos rnams gang dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu rim pa bzhin du 'tsham par 'byung ba dang / rgyu ma spangs na 'bras bu ma spangs par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: The way things are is the regular occurrence of the phenomena of dependent origination, such as ignorance, etc., in which the cause and effect are in accordance with each other, and in which the effect does not cease as long as the cause does not cease.

original: rgyu ma spangs par skye ba las 'bras bu ma spangs par skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa @260b 'di ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ma spangs par skye ba las 'bras bu ma spangs par skye bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa @260b 'di ni ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa'o //
translated: The way things are is that as long as the cause does not cease, the effect does not cease.

original: ji snyed yod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ji snyed yod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the multiplicity of things?

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa 'du byed rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa 'du byed rnams kyi rnam pa thams cad gang yin pa ste /
translated: The multiplicity of things is the various aspects of the phenomena of dependent origination, such as ignorance, etc.üîΩWhat are those various aspects?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: ma rig pa'i sngon gyi mtha'i mi shes pa zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar te /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i sngon gyi mtha'i mi shes pa zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar te /
translated: The ignorance of the prior limit is called nescience.

original: rnam grangs de rnams kyi rnam par dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /üîΩrnam grangs bsdu ba las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs de rnams kyi rnam par dbye ba ni 'di lta ste / rnam grangs bsdu ba las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The analysis of these synonyms is as follows:üîΩThey should be understood according to the Compendium of Ascertainments.

original: rnam par dbye ba rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa yang snag ma bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa yang snag ma bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: The presentation of the analyses should be understood according to the Compendium of the Mahayana.

original: 'di ni ji snyed yod pa ste /üîΩde ltar na ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa dang / ji snyed yod pa 'di las brtsams te /
analyzed: 'di ni ji snyed yod pa ste / de ltar na ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa dang / ji snyed yod pa 'di las brtsams te /
translated: This is the extent of existence.

original: bstan cing rnam par dbye'o //
analyzed: bstan cing rnam par dbye'o //
translated: Thus, the extent of existence and the mode of existence are explained and analyzed.

original: de la bstan pa ni dang po'o //
analyzed: de la bstan pa ni dang po'o //
translated: Among them, the explanation is the first.

original: de nyid rgyas par rnam par dbye ba ni rnam par dbye ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid rgyas par rnam par dbye ba ni rnam par dbye ba'o //
translated: The analysis is the extensive explanation of that.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba ni rang gis byas pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa dang / gnyis kas byas pa dang / gnyi gas ma byas pa rgyu med pa las byung ba rnam pa gnyis kyis 'dogs par mi byed cing lan 'debs par mi byed de /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba ni rang gis byas pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa dang / gnyis kas byas pa dang / gnyi gas ma byas pa rgyu med pa las byung ba rnam pa gnyis kyis 'dogs par mi byed cing lan 'debs par mi byed de /
translated: One should not impute or reply that pleasure and pain are self-made, other-made, made by both, or that they arise without a cause.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: snga ma bzhin du 'du byed thams cad byed pa med pa'i phyir dang / de ma yin pa'i byed pa po'i sems can mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde la 'du byed rnams byed pa med pas na tshor ba yang de nyid yin la /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du 'du byed thams cad byed pa med pa'i phyir dang / de ma yin pa'i byed pa po'i sems can mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro // de la 'du byed rnams byed pa med pas na tshor ba yang de nyid yin la /
translated: As before, because all formations are without an agent, and because a sentient being who is not that agent is not observed.

original: myong ba yang de nyid yin pa lta bur bde ba dang sdug bsngal rang gis byas par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: myong ba yang de nyid yin pa lta bur bde ba dang sdug bsngal rang gis byas par mi rung ngo //
translated: Therein, because formations are without an agent, it is not tenable that pleasure and pain are self-made, as if they were the very agent and also the experience.

original: de ma yin pa'i byed pa po'i sems can mi dmigs pas na tshor ba yang gzhan la myong ba yang gzhan par yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i byed pa po'i sems can mi dmigs pas na tshor ba yang gzhan la myong ba yang gzhan par yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Because a sentient being who is not that agent is not observed, it is not tenable that pleasure and pain are made by another, as if the agent were one and the experience were another.

original: tshor ba la sred pa dang gzhan dag gis tshor ba bsgrubs zhes byar yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: tshor ba la sred pa dang gzhan dag gis tshor ba bsgrubs zhes byar yang mi rung ngo //
translated: It is also not tenable to say that craving for feeling is produced by other feelings.

original: rkyen rnams yod pa las tshor ba skye bar 'gyur bas na de'i phyir rgyu med pa las skyes zhes byar yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rkyen rnams yod pa las tshor ba skye bar 'gyur bas na de'i phyir rgyu med pa las skyes zhes byar yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Since feeling arises from the existence of conditions, it is also not tenable to say that it arises without a cause.

original: de bas na rgyu mi mthun par smra ba'i mtha' rnam pa gsum po dang / phyi ma rgyu med par smra ba'i mtha' spangs nas snga ma bzhin du dbu ma'i lam bstan pa khong du chud pa dang / nan tan du bsgrubs pas sdug bsngal zad par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de bas na rgyu mi mthun par smra ba'i mtha' rnam pa gsum po dang / phyi ma rgyu med par smra ba'i mtha' spangs nas snga ma bzhin du dbu ma'i lam bstan pa khong du chud pa dang / nan tan du bsgrubs pas sdug bsngal zad par 'gyur ro /
translated: Therefore, having abandoned the three extremes of propounding discordant causes and the extreme of propounding that the subsequent is without a cause, the path of the middle way is taught as before. By understanding and earnestly practicing this, suffering will be brought to an end.

original: // / sdom ni /
analyzed: // / sdom ni /
translated: The summary:

original: reg rkyen lta ba phun sum tshogs //
analyzed: reg rkyen lta ba phun sum tshogs //
translated: Contact, conditions, view, perfection,üîΩElements, complete knowledge, repulsiveness,

original: 'byung dang kun shes mi sdug dang // chos gnas shes dang @261a * //
analyzed: 'byung dang kun shes mi sdug dang // chos gnas shes dang @261a * //
translated: Knowledge of the abiding nature of phenomena,

original: brtson 'grus brtsams //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams //
translated: and the commencement of effort.

original: skye ba yang ni tha ma yin //
analyzed: skye ba yang ni tha ma yin //
translated: Birth is the last.

original: reg pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i tshor ba thams cad yod pa la rgyu med pa dang / rgyu mi mthun par smra ba'i dge sbyong ba dang / bram ze rnams kyis chos 'di ba'i nyan thos dma' ba dang / mchog tu gyur pa'am ston pa la de nyid kyis byas pa de nyid kyis nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: reg pa'i rkyen gyis byung ba'i tshor ba thams cad yod pa la rgyu med pa dang / rgyu mi mthun par smra ba'i dge sbyong ba dang / bram ze rnams kyis chos 'di ba'i nyan thos dma' ba dang / mchog tu gyur pa'am ston pa la de nyid kyis byas pa de nyid kyis nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba nas /
translated: the ≈õrƒÅvakas of the inferior and supreme teachings of the Buddha, and the teachers themselves, say that they are created by themselves and experienced by themselves.

original: snga ma bzhin du dri ba dris na legs par len gdab pa rnam pa gsum yod de 'di lta ste /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du dri ba dris na legs par len gdab pa rnam pa gsum yod de 'di lta ste /
translated: If you ask them questions as before, they have three types of responses:

original: rang gi gzhung gis lan gdab pa dang / gzhan tshar gcad pas lan gdab pa dang / mngon par zhen pa yod pa dang / med pa las kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur bas lan gdab pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi gzhung gis lan gdab pa dang / gzhan tshar gcad pas lan gdab pa dang / mngon par zhen pa yod pa dang / med pa las kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar 'gyur bas lan gdab pa'o //
translated: a response with their own scriptures, a response with the refutation of others, and a response with the thorough affliction and purification that come from having or not having attachment.

original: de la gang de skad du 'dri ba la bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: de la gang de skad du 'dri ba la bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yin te /
translated: To that, if you ask, ‚ÄúWhat is the cause of pleasure and pain?‚Äù they say, ‚ÄúPleasure and pain arise dependently.‚Äù

original: 'di ni kho bo cag gi gzhung yin no zhes lan 'debs pa 'di ni rang gi gzhung gis lan gdab pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni kho bo cag gi gzhung yin no zhes lan 'debs pa 'di ni rang gi gzhung gis lan gdab pa'o //
translated: This is our position.

original: de la gang 'di skad du bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba rang gis byas pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa dang / gnyi gas byas pa dang / gnyi gas ma byas pa rgyu med pa las byung bar rtog pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: de la gang 'di skad du bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba rang gis byas pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa dang / gnyi gas byas pa dang / gnyi gas ma byas pa rgyu med pa las byung bar rtog pa yang rung ste /
translated: In this regard, if you imagine that pleasure and pain are self-produced, produced by another, produced by both, or arise without a cause,

original: thams cad du yang tshor ba ni reg pa las 'byung bar snang na de dag gis rang gis byas pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa la sogs par rtog pa don med pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: thams cad du yang tshor ba ni reg pa las 'byung bar snang na de dag gis rang gis byas pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa la sogs par rtog pa don med pas ci zhig bya /

original: gal te tshor ba'i rgyu reg pa yin par mngon sum du mi snang na ni /
analyzed: gal te tshor ba'i rgyu reg pa yin par mngon sum du mi snang na ni /
translated: If the cause of feeling were not clearly evident,

original: de ma yin pa'i rgyu yongs su btsal ba yang legs par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i rgyu yongs su btsal ba yang legs par 'gyur ba zhig na /

original: reg pa yang snang bas legs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: reg pa yang snang bas legs pa ma yin no //

original: zhes lan 'debs par byed na gang de ltar lan 'debs pa 'di ni gzhan tshar bcad pas lan gdab pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes lan 'debs par byed na gang de ltar lan 'debs pa 'di ni gzhan tshar bcad pas lan gdab pa yin no //
translated: If you reply in this way, then you reply by refuting the other.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ltar de dag ni rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis tshar gcod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni rgyu rnam pa gnyis kyis tshar gcod par 'gyur te /
translated: Because they are refuted by two reasons:

original: dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa phrad pa tsam du zad pa ma gtogs par de ma yin pa'i byed pa po bstan par mi nus pa gang yin pa dang / reg pa rgyu yin par 'jig rten thams cad kyi mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang ldan pa sun dbyung mi nus pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa phrad pa tsam du zad pa ma gtogs par de ma yin pa'i byed pa po bstan par mi nus pa gang yin pa dang / reg pa rgyu yin par 'jig rten thams cad kyi mngon sum gyi tshad ma dang ldan pa sun dbyung mi nus pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: the fact that apart from the mere contact of faculty, object, and consciousness, one cannot demonstrate any other agent, and the fact that the cause of contact cannot be refuted by any valid knowledge of the world.

original: de dag ni rang @261b gi gzhung yang mi tshugs la gzhan gyi gzung yang sun mi phyin pas na tshar gcod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni rang @261b gi gzhung yang mi tshugs la gzhan gyi gzung yang sun mi phyin pas na tshar gcod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since they do not even uphold their own texts and since they cannot refute the opponent, they are refuted.

original: gang de skad du dris na bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba rang gis byas pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa dang / gnyi gas byas pa yang kho bo cag gi ni dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa phrad pa tsam du zad pa'i sgo nas 'dogs par byed de /
analyzed: gang de skad du dris na bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba rang gis byas pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa dang / gnyi gas byas pa yang kho bo cag gi ni dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa phrad pa tsam du zad pa'i sgo nas 'dogs par byed de /
translated: ‚ÄúWe impute pleasure and pain from the mere contact of sense faculty, object, and consciousness.

original: de yang bdag tu mngon par zhen pa med pas byed do //
analyzed: de yang bdag tu mngon par zhen pa med pas byed do //
translated: And that is done without clinging to a self.‚Äù

original: de la der mngon par zhen pa ni khyed log par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: de la der mngon par zhen pa ni khyed log par gyur pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúClinging to that‚Äù refers to your error.

original: 'drad bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'drad bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: You should not cling to that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mngon par zhen pa las gyur ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa yin la mngon par zhen pa med pa las gyur pa ni rnam par byang ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes lan 'debs so //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa las gyur ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa yin la mngon par zhen pa med pa las gyur pa ni rnam par byang ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes lan 'debs so //
translated: Because the afflicted is due to clinging, and the purified is due to the absence of clinging.‚Äù

original: mngon par zhen pa las gyur pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa las gyur pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the afflicted due to clinging?

original: gang dag gi sngon gyi mthar de ni nga yin no //
analyzed: gang dag gi sngon gyi mthar de ni nga yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the past, I was that.‚Äù

original: 'di ni bdag gi yin no snyam du mngon par zhen par gyur pa mi mkhas pa de dag gi ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi yin no snyam du mngon par zhen par gyur pa mi mkhas pa de dag gi ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas snga ma bzhin te /
translated: The condition of ignorance of those who are unskilled and who conceive of the idea this is mine is the formation of karma.

original: dbus kyi mthar bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba'i kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbus kyi mthar bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba'i kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The middle is the affliction of pleasure and pain.

original: gang dag dbus kyi mtha' mngon par zhen pa de ni nga yin no //
analyzed: gang dag dbus kyi mtha' mngon par zhen pa de ni nga yin no //
translated: The middle is the idea I am.

original: 'di ni bdag gi yin no du phyi ma'i mthar bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba'i kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi yin no du phyi ma'i mthar bde ba dang sdug bsngal ba'i kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The end is the affliction of pleasure and pain.

original: rnam par byang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is purification?

original: gang dag gi sngon gyi mtha' dang / dbus kyi mtha' rnams la bdag dang bdag gir 'du byed rnams la mngon par zhen par ma gyur pa de dag ni sngon gyi mthar tshor ba'i rgyu 'gags pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das la phyi ma'i mthar yang tshor ba'i rgyu 'gags nas yongs su mya ngan
analyzed: gang dag gi sngon gyi mtha' dang / dbus kyi mtha' rnams la bdag dang bdag gir 'du byed rnams la mngon par zhen par ma gyur pa de dag ni sngon gyi mthar tshor ba'i rgyu 'gags pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das la phyi ma'i mthar yang tshor ba'i rgyu 'gags nas yongs su mya ngan
translated: Those who do not conceive of the idea of the self and the idea of mine in the past, the present, and the future, are liberated through the cessation of the cause of feeling in the past, and through the cessation of the cause of feeling in the future.

original: las 'da' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: las 'da' bar 'gyur te /
translated: It would transcend karma.üîΩüîΩ

original: 'di ni mngon par zhen pa dang / mngon par zhen pa med pa las gyur pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bas lan gdab pa ste gsum pa'o /
analyzed: 'di ni mngon par zhen pa dang / mngon par zhen pa med pa las gyur pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bas lan gdab pa ste gsum pa'o /
translated: This is the third reply, the reply concerning the defilement and purification of the one who is attached and the one who is not attached.

original: // / rgyu med pa dang rgyu mi mthun pa spangs nas rgyu las byung ba'i chos rnams kyi rgyu rnam pa lnga yang dag par mthong nas /üîΩchos 'dul ba 'di las mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir lta ba phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la bsam pa @262a * //
analyzed: // / rgyu med pa dang rgyu mi mthun pa spangs nas rgyu las byung ba'i chos rnams kyi rgyu rnam pa lnga yang dag par mthong nas / chos 'dul ba 'di las mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir lta ba phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la bsam pa @262a * //
translated: Having seen the five kinds of causes of conditioned things, having abandoned the absence of cause and the absurd consequence of the presence of a cause,

original: dag pa'i phyir lta ba drang po dang ldan pa dang / shes bya la shes pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir sangs rgyas la shes nas dad pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: dag pa'i phyir lta ba drang po dang ldan pa dang / shes bya la shes pa rnam par dag pa'i phyir sangs rgyas la shes nas dad pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: he becomes endowed with perfect view, because he is not carried away from this doctrine and discipline. He becomes endowed with a straight view, because his intention is pure with regard to nirvana. He becomes endowed with faith in the Buddha through knowledge, because his knowledge of the knowable is pure.

original: rgyu gsum po 'di rnams dang go rims bzhin du dam pa'i chos la zhugs pa dang / nye bar zhugs pa dang ; khong du chud par zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyu gsum po 'di rnams dang go rims bzhin du dam pa'i chos la zhugs pa dang / nye bar zhugs pa dang ; khong du chud par zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: These three causes should be respectively connected with the terms: ‚Äúto enter into the true Dharma,‚Äù ‚Äúto enter into the vicinity of the true Dharma,‚Äù and ‚Äúto understand the true Dharma.‚Äù

original: rgyu dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi rgyu rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /üîΩngan 'gro'i rgyu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa'i chos rnams kyi rgyu rnam pa lnga gang zhe na / ngan 'gro'i rgyu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the five kinds of causes of conditioned dharmas?

original: mi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //üîΩbde 'gro'i rgyu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'o // bde 'gro'i rgyu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The cause of bad destinies is the unwholesome and the roots of the unwholesome.

original: dge ba dang dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //üîΩrnam par shes pa dang rnam par shes pa'i gnas rnams kyi gnas pa'i rgyu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge ba dang dge ba'i rtsa ba'o // rnam par shes pa dang rnam par shes pa'i gnas rnams kyi gnas pa'i rgyu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The cause of good destinies is the wholesome and the roots of the wholesome.üîΩThe cause of the persistence of consciousness and the bases of consciousness is the four nutriments.

original: zas bzhi'o // tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ni 'di lta ste /üîΩzag pa rnams so //üîΩrnam par byang ba'i rgyu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: zas bzhi'o // tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ni 'di lta ste / zag pa rnams so // rnam par byang ba'i rgyu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The cause of the defilement of this life and the next life is the contaminants.

original: bden pa rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: bden pa rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ste /
translated: The cause of purification is the truths and dependent origination.

original: gang rgyu de rnams kyi rang bzhin la yang rang bzhin du rgyu la yang rgyur /
analyzed: gang rgyu de rnams kyi rang bzhin la yang rang bzhin du rgyu la yang rgyur /
translated: The perfection of view is when one correctly knows the nature of those causes as nature, the cause as cause,

original: rgyu 'gags pa la yang 'gag par /
analyzed: rgyu 'gags pa la yang 'gag par /
translated: the cessation of the cause as cessation,

original: de 'gag par 'gyur ba'i lam la yang lam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes na lta ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de 'gag par 'gyur ba'i lam la yang lam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes na lta ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and the path to the cessation of that as the path.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i gzhi brtag pa'i mtha' ni ma rig pa la thug pas na de'i gong du rgyu brtag pa med de /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i gzhi brtag pa'i mtha' ni ma rig pa la thug pas na de'i gong du rgyu brtag pa med de /
translated: Since the limit of investigation of the basis of dependent origination is ignorance, there is no investigation of cause above that.

original: de brtag pa nyid ni rang gis don yongs su rdzogs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de brtag pa nyid ni rang gis don yongs su rdzogs pa kho na'o //
translated: The investigation of that itself is completely fulfilled by the investigation of ignorance.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las gzhi bsdu ba /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las gzhi bsdu ba /
translated: The Summary of the Levels of Yogic Practice

original: bam po bcu bzhi pa /
analyzed: bam po bcu bzhi pa /
translated: The fourteenth section

original: gsum po 'di dag ni tshe 'di la shes bya'i gzhi yin te /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni tshe 'di la shes bya'i gzhi yin te /
translated: These three are the basis of objects of knowledge in this life:

original: 'byung ba dang ; grub pa dang / tshe'i tshad ji tsam pa dang / ma shi'i bar du rgyud la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang ; grub pa dang / tshe'i tshad ji tsam pa dang / ma shi'i bar du rgyud la gnas pa ste /
translated: the elements, the established, and the measure of life, which remain in the mindstream until death.

original: de dag la slob pa yang dag par nan tan du sgrub pa na /
analyzed: de dag la slob pa yang dag par nan tan du sgrub pa na /
translated: When one who is training in those correctly practices them,

original: slob par 'dogs pa dang / mi slob pa ni bdag gi thams cad zad de yang zad par bya ba med do zhes zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes kyis rtogs nas rtogs pa'i chos can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: slob par 'dogs pa dang / mi slob pa ni bdag gi thams cad zad de yang zad par bya ba med do zhes zad pa dang mi skye ba'i ye shes kyis rtogs nas rtogs pa'i chos can zhes bya'o //
translated: The learner is one who is in the process of eliminating the defilements, and the post-learner is one who has eliminated all defilements and is no longer subject to any more elimination.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: skye mched drug dang skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa dang / reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'o //
analyzed: skye mched drug dang skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa dang / reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'o //
translated: The six sense-spheres, the contact that is conditioned by the six sense-spheres, and the feeling that is conditioned by contact.

original: de la thos pa dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos ni tshor ba gang ci myong yang rung ste /
analyzed: de la thos pa dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos ni tshor ba gang ci myong yang rung ste /
translated: The noble disciple who is endowed with learning, whatever feeling he experiences,

original: de yongs su @262b shes nas de dag las skyo bar bya ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba dang / 'gog par bya ba'i phyir nan tan du sgrub pa na tshor ba de dag reg pa'i zas las byung bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: de yongs su @262b shes nas de dag las skyo bar bya ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral bar bya ba dang / 'gog par bya ba'i phyir nan tan du sgrub pa na tshor ba de dag reg pa'i zas las byung bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: knows it fully. When he practices in order to become disenchanted with, dispassionate toward, and freed from those feelings, he knows that those feelings arise from the nutriment of contact.

original: reg pa'i zas de yang skye mched drug las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: reg pa'i zas de yang skye mched drug las byung ba yin no //
translated: He knows that that contact that is the nutriment of feeling arises from the six sense-spheres.

original: de ni reg pa'i zas kyi rgyu skye mched drug las skyo bar bya ba'i phyir dang / reg pa'i zas de 'gag par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni reg pa'i zas kyi rgyu skye mched drug las skyo bar bya ba'i phyir dang / reg pa'i zas de 'gag par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin no //
translated: He has entered in order to become disenchanted with the six sense-spheres, which are the cause of the food of contact, and in order to make an end of the food of contact.

original: des tshor ba dang / reg pa dang / skye mched drug po byung ba thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas 'di dag thams cad ni mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'gags pas 'gag pa'i chos can yin no snyam du rig ste /
analyzed: des tshor ba dang / reg pa dang / skye mched drug po byung ba thams cad gcig tu bsdus nas 'di dag thams cad ni mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'gags pas 'gag pa'i chos can yin no snyam du rig ste /
translated: He has understood that all the arising of feeling, contact and the six sense-spheres is included in this, and that they are all subject to cessation through the impermanence of the aggregates.

original: tshe 'di la byung ba mi rtag pa rnam pa gsum po de dag thams cad la yang snga ma bzhin du skyo bar bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshe 'di la byung ba mi rtag pa rnam pa gsum po de dag thams cad la yang snga ma bzhin du skyo bar bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin no //
translated: He has entered in order to become disenchanted with all that has arisen in this life, in the three ways as before.

original: de bas na yang dag par zhugs pa'i rtag 'grus can gyi slob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na yang dag par zhugs pa'i rtag 'grus can gyi slob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called a ‚Äòlearner who is constant in practice and properly engaged‚Äô.

original: de bzhin du nan tan du sgrub pa na len pa med pa'i rnam par grol ba'i phyir rtogs pa'i chos can gyi rtag 'grus can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nan tan du sgrub pa na len pa med pa'i rnam par grol ba'i phyir rtogs pa'i chos can gyi rtag 'grus can zhes bya'o //
translated: Similarly, when he is practising earnestly, he is called a ‚Äòlearner who is constant in practice and has realized the Dharma‚Äô because he is liberated by the non-appropriation of the aggregates.

original: ma thob pa dang mngon sum du ma byas pa mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir rtag tu gus par sbyor bar byed pas na slob pa rtag 'grus can no //üîΩtshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ma thob pa dang mngon sum du ma byas pa mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir rtag tu gus par sbyor bar byed pas na slob pa rtag 'grus can no // tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: He is a learner who is always diligent because he is always diligently engaged in order to attain what has not been attained and to manifest what has not been manifested.üîΩHe is a learner who is always diligent because he is always diligently engaged in order to avoid regression from the easeful abiding in this life.

original: rtag tu gus par sbyor bar byed pas ni rtogs pa'i chos can gyi rtag 'grus can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtag tu gus par sbyor bar byed pas ni rtogs pa'i chos can gyi rtag 'grus can zhes bya'o //
translated: He is a learner who is always diligent because he is always diligently engaged in order to avoid regression from the easeful abiding in this life.

original: bstan par bya ba'i gzhi thams cad kyi dbang gis byung ba'i ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs rnams ni chos kyi khams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bstan par bya ba'i gzhi thams cad kyi dbang gis byung ba'i ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs rnams ni chos kyi khams zhes bya ste /
translated: The collection of names, the collection of phrases, and the collection of syllables that occur by the power of all the bases that are to be taught are called the element of dharmas.

original: gang la las so sor yang dag par rig pa thob nas ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs rnams la ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang la las so sor yang dag par rig pa thob nas ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs rnams la ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin byed par 'gyur te /
translated: When one has attained the analytical knowledges, one can do with the collections of names, phrases, and syllables as one wishes.

original: des na chos kyi khams legs par rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na chos kyi khams legs par rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the well-ascertained element of dharmas.

original: de yang chos kyi khams legs par rtogs pa'i phyir 'dod na byung ba'i ming gi don de nyid rnam grangs gzhan dag gis nyin mtshan bdun gyi bar ram yang na de bas lhag par yang ston to //
analyzed: de yang chos kyi khams legs par rtogs pa'i phyir 'dod na byung ba'i ming gi don de nyid rnam grangs gzhan dag gis nyin mtshan bdun gyi bar ram yang na de bas lhag par yang ston to //
translated: Moreover, in order to understand the element of the Dharma well, the meaning of the term ‚Äúarisen‚Äù is taught for seven days and nights, or even longer, by means of other synonyms.

original: de yang rnam grangs 'di lta bu dag ste /üîΩbyung ba zhes bya ba de bzhin du 'dus byas dang / sems pa las byung ba dang / g-yo ba dang / gnod @263a * //
analyzed: de yang rnam grangs 'di lta bu dag ste / byung ba zhes bya ba de bzhin du 'dus byas dang / sems pa las byung ba dang / g-yo ba dang / gnod @263a * //
translated: And these are the synonyms:

original: pa byed pa dang / nad dang / 'bras zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: pa byed pa dang / nad dang / 'bras zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äúarisen,‚Äù ‚Äúconditioned,‚Äù ‚Äúarisen from intention,‚Äù ‚Äúmoving,‚Äù ‚Äúinjurious,‚Äù ‚Äúdisease,‚Äù ‚Äúfruit,‚Äù and so on.

original: dgra bcom pa kun shes pa dang ldan pa ni shes pa rnam pa drug brda sprod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa kun shes pa dang ldan pa ni shes pa rnam pa drug brda sprod par rig par bya ste /
translated: The arhat who possesses complete knowledge should be known as one who communicates in six ways:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: rnam grangs kyis brda sprod pa dang / rnam grangs ma yin pas brda sprod pa dang / shes pas brda sprod pa dang / spong bas brda sprod pa dang / mdos brda sprod pa dang / rgyas pas brda sprod pa'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs kyis brda sprod pa dang / rnam grangs ma yin pas brda sprod pa dang / shes pas brda sprod pa dang / spong bas brda sprod pa dang / mdos brda sprod pa dang / rgyas pas brda sprod pa'o //
translated: by means of synonyms, by means of non-synonyms, by means of knowledge, by means of abandonment, by means of the sutras, and by means of elaboration.

original: de la rnam grangs kyis brda sprod pa ni ji ltar 'di na kha cig gzhan dag gis dris kyang rung /
analyzed: de la rnam grangs kyis brda sprod pa ni ji ltar 'di na kha cig gzhan dag gis dris kyang rung /
translated: The answer by way of enumeration is like this:üîΩIf someone asks, or if one does not ask,

original: yang na rang gis gzhan dag bstan pa la gces par 'dzin pa bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na rang gis gzhan dag bstan pa la gces par 'dzin pa bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to generate the cherishing of others,

original: 'di skad du bdag ni phyi ma la som nyi med do zhes brda sprod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di skad du bdag ni phyi ma la som nyi med do zhes brda sprod pa'o //
translated: one answers, ‚ÄúI have no doubt about the future.‚Äù

original: rnam grangs ma yin par brda sprod pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs ma yin par brda sprod pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The answer by way of non-enumeration is like this:

original: bdag gi skye ba zad do //
analyzed: bdag gi skye ba zad do //
translated: ‚ÄúMy births are exhausted.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar ro //
translated: And so on, in detail.

original: de la shes pas brda sprod pa ni ji ltar shes shing ji ltar mthong na skye ba zad par 'gyur zhes dris na skye ba'i rgyu 'gags pas na /
analyzed: de la shes pas brda sprod pa ni ji ltar shes shing ji ltar mthong na skye ba zad par 'gyur zhes dris na skye ba'i rgyu 'gags pas na /
translated: The answer by way of knowledge is like this: If one asks, ‚ÄúHow does one know and see that births are exhausted?‚ÄùüîΩThe answer is, ‚ÄúBecause the cause of birth has ceased,üîΩbirth is exhausted.‚Äù

original: skye ba zad do zhes rnam pa de lta bur rnam par grol ba shes pas bsdus pa'i bdag gis zad pa shes pa brda sprod par byed pa ste /üîΩ'di ni shes pas brda sprod pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba zad do zhes rnam pa de lta bur rnam par grol ba shes pas bsdus pa'i bdag gis zad pa shes pa brda sprod par byed pa ste /üîΩ'di ni shes pas brda sprod pa'o //
translated: The answer by way of knowledge is like this: If one asks, ‚ÄúHow does one know and see that births are exhausted?‚Äù

original: de'i rgyas pas brda sprod pa de ni de'i rgyu srid pa yang brda sprod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i rgyas pas brda sprod pa de ni de'i rgyu srid pa yang brda sprod par 'gyur la /
translated: The cause of that is also taught, namely, craving.

original: srid pa'i rgyu dang / de'i rgyu len pa dang / len pa'i mtshan nyid kyang brda sprod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i rgyu dang / de'i rgyu len pa dang / len pa'i mtshan nyid kyang brda sprod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The cause of craving and the characteristics of grasping are also taught.

original: ji ltar shes shing mthong ba de la ni nye bar len pa yang med de de yang brda sprod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar shes shing mthong ba de la ni nye bar len pa yang med de de yang brda sprod par 'gyur ro //
translated: And that which is known and seen is also taught, namely, the non-appropriation of the aggregates.

original: mdor brda sprod pa ni bshad pa 'di dag thams cad kyang tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba de ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba yin par shes nas bdag gi skye ba zad do zhes brda sprod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mdor brda sprod pa ni bshad pa 'di dag thams cad kyang tshor ba gang ci yang rung ba de ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba yin par shes nas bdag gi skye ba zad do zhes brda sprod par byed pa'o //
translated: In brief, the teaching is that whatever feeling there is, that is suffering here. Having understood that, one teaches the exhaustion of one's births.

original: de la spong bas brda sprod pa ni nang rnam par grol bas srid pa thams cad kyi rgyu yongs su zad pa'i phyir spong bas brda sprod par byed do //
analyzed: de la spong bas brda sprod pa ni nang rnam par grol bas srid pa thams cad kyi rgyu yongs su zad pa'i phyir spong bas brda sprod par byed do //
translated: In that regard, the teaching of abandonment is the teaching of abandonment through internal liberation, due to the exhaustion of the cause of all existence.

original: spong bas brda sprod pa de'i ji skad bstan pa de nyid ni rgyas par brda sprod pa'o //
analyzed: spong bas brda sprod pa de'i ji skad bstan pa de nyid ni rgyas par brda sprod pa'o //

translated: It is of great result, because it is the source of perfect enjoyment and retinue.üîΩIt is of great majesty, because it is the source of the perfect body, with its long life, good color, strength, happiness, eloquence, and so on.

original: tshe dang / kha dog dang / stobs dang / bde ba dang spobs pa la sogs pa lus phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo nas ni gzi byin chen por 'gyur ba dang / gnas gsum po de @266b dag nyid yun ring por ldan pa'i sgo nas ni rgyas pa chen por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tshe dang / kha dog dang / stobs dang / bde ba dang spobs pa la sogs pa lus phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo nas ni gzi byin chen por 'gyur ba dang / gnas gsum po de @266b dag nyid yun ring por ldan pa'i sgo nas ni rgyas pa chen por 'gyur ba'o //

translated: It is the goer to perfect enlightenment because it causes the attainment of the enlightenment of the disciples, the solitary sages, and the supreme, perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: gtan du mthar thug pa dang mngon sum du nyams su myong ba'i ston pas yang dag par bstan pas na bde bar gshegs pas gsungs pa'o //

original: bzhi gang zhe na /

analyzed: bu lon gyis gtses pa'i phyir ma yin 'jigs pas gtses pa'i phyir ma yin zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar te /

original: ji ltar 'di na kha cig sgrib pa chung ngus rmongs pa med pas ni glen pa dang / sgrib pa 'bring gis rmongs pa med pas lug ltar lkugs pa ma yin pa dang / sgrib pa chen pos rmongs pa med pas lag brda can ma yin te /

original: de la sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba yod na /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba yod na /
translated: When the Buddhas appear,

original: 'phags pa'i gnas de nyid 'thob pa phun sum tshogs pa ni ji ltar bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa 'di da ltar 'jig rten du 'byung ba zhes rgyas par 'byung ba lta bu ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /

translated: the perfection of attaining the state of the noble ones is as follows: ‚ÄúJust as the Blessed One, the Tathagata Shakyamuni, appears in the world now.‚Äù

analyzed: rnam grangs bsdu ba las rgyas par 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood in detail as it appears in the Compendium of Enumerations.

original: chos kyang ston te snga ma bzhin du nye bar zhi bar byed pa zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos kyang ston te snga ma bzhin du nye bar zhi bar byed pa zhes bya ba nas rgyas par sbyar ro //
translated: The Dharma is also taught, as before, up to ‚Äúleading to complete nirvana.‚Äù

original: de la 'phags pa'i gnas su skyes pas na legs par 'ongs shing legs par rab tu byung ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i gnas su skyes pas na legs par 'ongs shing legs par rab tu byung ba'o //
translated: Having been born in the state of the noble ones, they have come well and gone forth well.

original: dbang po ma tshang ba med pa dang mi glen pa dang / lug ltar lkugs pa ma yin pa dang / lag brda can ma yin pas na mir skye ba 'thob pa legs par 'thob pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po ma tshang ba med pa dang mi glen pa dang / lug ltar lkugs pa ma yin pa dang / lag brda can ma yin pas na mir skye ba 'thob pa legs par 'thob pa yin no //
translated: One obtains a human birth well, because one is not incomplete in one‚Äôs faculties, is not stupid, is not mute like a sheep, and is not one who communicates by gestures.

original: 'di gnyis ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'du byed 'jug pa brtag pa la brtson pa'i the tshom skyed pa'i chos yin te gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'du byed 'jug pa brtag pa la brtson pa'i the tshom skyed pa'i chos yin te gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: These two are the phenomena that generate doubt in one who is intent on investigating the engagement of the formations that are dependently arisen. What are the two?

original: rgyu med par smra ba khas len pa dang / rgyu mi mthun par smra ba khas len pa'o //üîΩde la rgyu med par smra ba khas len pa ni de dag gi rgyu nyid kyang ye ma mthong na /
analyzed: rgyu med par smra ba khas len pa dang / rgyu mi mthun par smra ba khas len pa'o // de la rgyu med par smra ba khas len pa ni de dag gi rgyu nyid kyang ye ma mthong na /
translated: They are the acceptance of the doctrine of causelessness and the acceptance of the doctrine of discordant causes.

original: rgyu med pa rnams ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur snyam du the tshom skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa rnams ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur snyam du the tshom skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: As for the acceptance of the doctrine of causelessness, since one does not even see a cause for these, one doubts how they could arise without a cause.

original: rgyu mi mthun par smra ba khas len pa yang mi 'tsham pa dang mi rigs pa'i rgyus ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur snyam du the tshom skye ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu mi mthun par smra ba khas len pa yang mi 'tsham pa dang mi rigs pa'i rgyus ji ltar 'byung bar 'gyur snyam du the tshom skye ba kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: How could it be that the cause of accepting what is improper and unreasonable should arise?

original: thos pa dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos ni nyes par smra ba rnam pa gnyi ga yang spangs nas yang dag par 'jug pa la rtog par byed do //
analyzed: thos pa dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos ni nyes par smra ba rnam pa gnyi ga yang spangs nas yang dag par 'jug pa la rtog par byed do //
translated: The noble disciple who has learning abandons both kinds of faulty speech and engages in correct speech.

original: de bas na rang gis yang dag pa la yang dag par dmigs pa na shin tu nges pa dang the tshom med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na rang gis yang dag pa la yang dag par dmigs pa na shin tu nges pa dang the tshom med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when one observes what is correct by oneself, one becomes very certain and free from doubt.

original: gang du thos pa dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos zhes smos pa der ni so so'i skye bo yin par rig @267b par bya'o //
analyzed: gang du thos pa dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos zhes smos pa der ni so so'i skye bo yin par rig @267b par bya'o //
translated: Where it is said that ‚Äúthe noble disciple who has learning,‚Äù one should understand that he is an ordinary person.

original: gang du 'phags pa nyan thos 'ba' zhig smos pa der ni bden pa mthong ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang du 'phags pa nyan thos 'ba' zhig smos pa der ni bden pa mthong ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Where it is said that ‚Äúthe noble disciple,‚Äù one should understand that he has seen the truths.

original: chos 'di ba'i gang zag 'di gsum ni sdug bsngal zhing yid mi bde bar gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: chos 'di ba'i gang zag 'di gsum ni sdug bsngal zhing yid mi bde bar gnas pa yin te /
translated: These three kinds of persons who belong to this teaching are miserable and live unhappily.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: ji ltar 'di na kha cig legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba 'di la mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod cing mya ngan las 'da' ba la zhugs te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di na kha cig legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba 'di la mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod cing mya ngan las 'da' ba la zhugs te /
translated: Here, some who desire nirvana and enter the path to nirvana in this well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya

original: rab tu byung ba yin la de yang de lta rab tu byung nas tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs tsam gyis chog par 'dzin cing gnas te /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba yin la de yang de lta rab tu byung nas tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs tsam gyis chog par 'dzin cing gnas te /
translated: go forth. But having gone forth, they are not satisfied with just the ethics and conduct and remain in that state.

original: dus dus su lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab la mi slob pa de ni sngon gyi khyim gyi yul gyi longs spyod las kyang nyams la bla na med pa'i grub pa dang / bde ba mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma thob ste /
analyzed: dus dus su lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab la mi slob pa de ni sngon gyi khyim gyi yul gyi longs spyod las kyang nyams la bla na med pa'i grub pa dang / bde ba mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma thob ste /
translated: They do not train in higher concentration and higher wisdom from time to time. They lose the enjoyments of their former home and country and do not attain the unsurpassed accomplishment and bliss of nirvana.

original: bar ma do'i lam la gnas pas sdug bsngal zhing yid mi bde bas gnas pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bar ma do'i lam la gnas pas sdug bsngal zhing yid mi bde bas gnas pa lta bu'o //
translated: They remain in the middle path and abide in suffering and mental dissatisfaction.

original: gzhan yang 'di na kha cig tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs tsam nyi tshe ni chog par ni mi 'dzin mod kyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di na kha cig tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs tsam nyi tshe ni chog par ni mi 'dzin mod kyi /
translated: Here, some are not satisfied with just ethics and conduct.

original: 'on kyang da dung so so'i skye bo'i sa las yang dag par 'das pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang da dung so so'i skye bo'i sa las yang dag par 'das pa ma yin te /
translated: However, they have not yet transcended the stage of ordinary beings.

original: de so so'i skye bo'i sa las yang dag par ma 'das pas chos rnams la gzhan gyi dring 'jog pa'i phyir kye ma 'di dag ni shes par bya ba shes pa dang / mthong bar bya ba mthong ba yin no snyam ste /
analyzed: de so so'i skye bo'i sa las yang dag par ma 'das pas chos rnams la gzhan gyi dring 'jog pa'i phyir kye ma 'di dag ni shes par bya ba shes pa dang / mthong bar bya ba mthong ba yin no snyam ste /
translated: Since they have not transcended the stage of ordinary beings, they rely on others with regard to phenomena, thinking, ‚ÄúAlas, these are the ones who know what is to be known and see what is to be seen.‚Äù

original: gzhan dag gi ngor lta zhing gzhan dag gi ngor rtog la de de dag las chos mnyan pa dang / gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa tshol bar byed de /
analyzed: gzhan dag gi ngor lta zhing gzhan dag gi ngor rtog la de de dag las chos mnyan pa dang / gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa tshol bar byed de /
translated: They look to others and consider others, and they seek the Dharma, instructions, and teachings from others.

original: bdag nyid kyang som nyi dang bcas te the tshom dang bcas par 'dug pa 'di ni gang zag gnyis pa sdug bsngal zhing mi bde bar gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang som nyi dang bcas te the tshom dang bcas par 'dug pa 'di ni gang zag gnyis pa sdug bsngal zhing mi bde bar gnas pa yin no //
translated: They themselves remain with doubts and uncertainties. This is the second type of person who lives unhappily and unpleasantly.

original: gzhan yang 'di na gang zag kha cig slob pa bzhi mthong ba yin na de bag med par gnas pas tshe 'di la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i skal ba med de des lus phyi ma mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yongs su bzung ba'i phyir phyi ma
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di na gang zag kha cig slob pa bzhi mthong ba yin na de bag med par gnas pas tshe 'di la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i skal ba med de des lus phyi ma mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yongs su bzung ba'i phyir phyi ma
translated: Moreover, some individuals here who have seen the four truths as a learner, but who are heedless, do not have the fortune to attain nirvana in this life, because they have taken up the cause of actualizing a subsequent body.

original: dang bcas par gnas pas sdug bsngal zhing mi bde bar gnas pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dang bcas par gnas pas sdug bsngal zhing mi bde bar gnas pa lta bu'o //
translated: They remain with a subsequent life and remain in suffering and unhappiness.

original: gang zag gsum po de rnams las bzlog pa'i gang zag pa bde ba la reg par gnas pa yang gcig tu nges par bde bar gnas pa'i dgra bcom pa dang gsum yod do //
analyzed: gang zag gsum po de rnams las bzlog pa'i gang zag pa bde ba la reg par gnas pa yang gcig tu nges par bde bar gnas pa'i dgra bcom pa dang gsum yod do //
translated: From among those three individuals, there is one individual who is the opposite of those three, who definitely remains in contact with pleasure, the arhat who remains in pleasure.üîΩThe summary:

original: sdom ni / srid 'gag dge sbyong bram ze dang // nyams @268a * //
analyzed: sdom ni / srid 'gag dge sbyong bram ze dang // nyams @268a * //
translated: The cessation of existence, the ascetic, the brahmin,üîΩThe knowledge of experience,üîΩEngagement, coming and going,

original: su myong ba'i shes pa dang // 'jug dang 'ong zhing 'gro ba dang // sangs rgyas lugs 'byung tha ma yin //
analyzed: su myong ba'i shes pa dang // 'jug dang 'ong zhing 'gro ba dang // sangs rgyas lugs 'byung tha ma yin //
translated: The system of the Buddha, and the last.

original: slob pa bzhi mthong bas ni gzhan la dad pas 'gro ba ma yin par srid pa 'gags na zhi ba mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro snyam du rang gi 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis mthong mod kyi 'on kyang des ni lus kyis mngon sum du
analyzed: slob pa bzhi mthong bas ni gzhan la dad pas 'gro ba ma yin par srid pa 'gags na zhi ba mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro snyam du rang gi 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi mig gis mthong mod kyi 'on kyang des ni lus kyis mngon sum du
translated: Those training in seeing the four truths do not proceed by faith in others, but rather see with their own arya wisdom eye that if existence is blocked, it becomes the peace of nirvana.

original: byed par mi nus te /
analyzed: byed par mi nus te /
translated: However, they are unable to manifest that with their body.

original: dper na la la zhig skom nas khron pa zab mo'i drung du song na /
analyzed: dper na la la zhig skom nas khron pa zab mo'i drung du song na /
translated: For example, if someone thirsty goes to a deep well,

original: thag pa dang bcu ba'i snod med pas sha'i mig gis chu mngon sum du mthong du zin kyang de lus kyi reg par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: thag pa dang bcu ba'i snod med pas sha'i mig gis chu mngon sum du mthong du zin kyang de lus kyi reg par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: they see the water with their physical eye, but it does not come into physical contact with their body because they lack a rope or bucket.

original: slob pas kyang gong ma'i nyon mongs pa spong ba de 'dod de /
analyzed: slob pas kyang gong ma'i nyon mongs pa spong ba de 'dod de /
translated: Similarly, those training desire to abandon higher affliction.

original: shes rab kyi mig gis zhi bar mngon sum du mthong du zin kyang de'i lus kyis mngon sum du byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi mig gis zhi bar mngon sum du mthong du zin kyang de'i lus kyis mngon sum du byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Although they see peace with the eye of wisdom, they are unable to manifest it with their body.

original: dge sbyong dang bram ze kha cig 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug zad par spong ba dang / dge sbyong gi don du bya ba dang / bram ze'i don du bya ba ma thob par 'jig rten na bdag nyid la dge sbyong du 'du shes shing dge sbyong du khas 'che ba dang /
analyzed: dge sbyong dang bram ze kha cig 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug zad par spong ba dang / dge sbyong gi don du bya ba dang / bram ze'i don du bya ba ma thob par 'jig rten na bdag nyid la dge sbyong du 'du shes shing dge sbyong du khas 'che ba dang /
translated: Some ascetics and brahmins do not attain the goal of ascetics and brahmins, yet they think of themselves as ascetics and claim to be ascetics, and they think of themselves as brahmins and claim to be brahmins.

original: bram zer 'du shes shing bram zer khas 'che bar byed la 'jig rten yang de ltar 'dzin mod kyi 'on kyang de dag ni kun rdzob kyi dge sbyong dang bram ze yin gyi don dam pa'i ma yin te /
analyzed: bram zer 'du shes shing bram zer khas 'che bar byed la 'jig rten yang de ltar 'dzin mod kyi 'on kyang de dag ni kun rdzob kyi dge sbyong dang bram ze yin gyi don dam pa'i ma yin te /
translated: Although the world holds them to be ascetics and brahmins, they are only conventional ascetics and brahmins, not ultimate ascetics and brahmins.

original: de dag ni don dam pa'i dge sbyong dang / bram ze rnams kyis dge sbyong dang bram zer mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: de dag ni don dam pa'i dge sbyong dang / bram ze rnams kyis dge sbyong dang bram zer mi 'dzin to //
translated: Ultimate ascetics and brahmins do not hold them to be ascetics and brahmins.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyi rgyu dang / 'gog pa dang 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag gis kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyi rgyu dang / 'gog pa dang 'gog par 'gyur ba'i lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not know, as they really are, the dharmas that are defilements, the cause of the dharmas that are defilements, their cessation, and the path that leads to their cessation.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Herein, the dharmas that are defilements are:

original: rga shis bsdus pa'i sdug bsngal dang skye ba'o //
analyzed: rga shis bsdus pa'i sdug bsngal dang skye ba'o //
translated: the suffering that is included in old age and death and birth.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyi rgyu ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos kyi rgyu ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The cause of the dharmas that are defilements is twofold:

original: sred pa las gyur pa dang ; las las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa las gyur pa dang ; las las gyur pa'o //
translated: that which is due to craving and that which is due to action.

original: de la sred pa las gyur pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la sred pa las gyur pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Herein, that which is due to craving is:

original: lugs su 'byung ba ma yin pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul nyid kyis srid pa dang / len pa dang / sred pa dang / ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / ma rig pa'i 'dus te @268b reg pa de nyid dang /
analyzed: lugs su 'byung ba ma yin pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul nyid kyis srid pa dang / len pa dang / sred pa dang / ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / ma rig pa'i 'dus te @268b reg pa de nyid dang /
translated: the craving that arises from the contact that is accompanied by ignorance, the grasping, the existence, the craving, and the ignorance in the order of dependent origination, and the feeling that arises from the contact that is accompanied by ignorance, and that very contact that is accompanied by ignorance.

original: ma rig pa'i khams dang 'brel pa'i skye mched drug go //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i khams dang 'brel pa'i skye mched drug go //
translated: The six sense spheres are related to the realm of ignorance.

original: de la las las gyur pa ni lugs su 'byung ba ma yin pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul nyid kyis ming dang gzugs dang / rnam par shes pa dang 'du byed rnams te /
analyzed: de la las las gyur pa ni lugs su 'byung ba ma yin pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul nyid kyis ming dang gzugs dang / rnam par shes pa dang 'du byed rnams te /
translated: Karma is name-and-form, consciousness, and volitional action, because they are the mode of dependent origination that is not in accord with reason.

original: de dag dag kyang chos gnas pa'i shes pa tsam gyis kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes na bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i tshe yongs su shes pa'am /
analyzed: de dag dag kyang chos gnas pa'i shes pa tsam gyis kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi shes na bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i tshe yongs su shes pa'am /
translated: If one does not understand these as they really are even through the mere knowledge of the abiding nature of things, how could one understand them through the realization of the truth?

original: yongs su shes nas kyang bsgom pa'i lam gyis slob pa'i sa las yang dag par 'gyur ba'i skal ba lta ga la yod /
analyzed: yongs su shes nas kyang bsgom pa'i lam gyis slob pa'i sa las yang dag par 'gyur ba'i skal ba lta ga la yod /
translated: Or, having understood them, how could one attain the stage of learning through the path of cultivation?

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'du byed rnams la ni rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i chos nyid kyis bden pa bzhi'i tshul mngon par rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'du byed rnams la ni rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i chos nyid kyis bden pa bzhi'i tshul mngon par rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: However, with regard to the volitional actions that arise dependently, one realizes the mode of the four noble truths through the contact that arises from the union of the three factors.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: dmigs pa nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid kyi rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / dmigs pa rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i bdag nyid kyi rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis so //
analyzed: dmigs pa nyams su myong ba'i bdag nyid kyi rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / dmigs pa rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i bdag nyid kyi rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis so //
translated: The feeling that arises from the contact of consciousness with its object is the nature of experience. The wisdom that arises from the contact of consciousness with its object is the nature of discernment.

original: de la srid pa'i yan lag bcu gcig la re re zhing yang bden pa bzhi po rnam par gzhag pas rnam par gzhag na gzhi bzhi bcu rtsa bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la srid pa'i yan lag bcu gcig la re re zhing yang bden pa bzhi po rnam par gzhag pas rnam par gzhag na gzhi bzhi bcu rtsa bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: The eleven members of existence are each established by the four noble truths, so they are established as the fourteen foundations.

original: de la rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'i sgo nas ni de ltar de dag la gzhi bzhi bcu rtsa bzhir tshor bar bya zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'i sgo nas ni de ltar de dag la gzhi bzhi bcu rtsa bzhir tshor bar bya zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The feeling of those fourteen foundations is called ‚Äúfeeling‚Äù from the perspective of the feeling that arises from the contact of consciousness with its object.

original: rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi sgo nas ni gzhi zhi bcu rtsa bzhi po de dag nyid la shes pa'i gzhi rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyi sgo nas ni gzhi zhi bcu rtsa bzhi po de dag nyid la shes pa'i gzhi rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: The wisdom that arises from the contact of consciousness with its object is called ‚Äúthe foundations of wisdom‚Äù in regard to those very fourteen foundations.

original: de la tha ma na 'dug pa'i rga shi ni 'bras bu kho nar zad do //
analyzed: de la tha ma na 'dug pa'i rga shi ni 'bras bu kho nar zad do //
translated: The last of the twelve members, aging and death, is only the result.

original: dang po'i ma rig pa ni rgyu kho nar zad do //
analyzed: dang po'i ma rig pa ni rgyu kho nar zad do //
translated: The first ignorance is only a cause.

original: lhag ma rnams ni rgyu yang yin la 'bras bu yang yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams ni rgyu yang yin la 'bras bu yang yin no //
translated: The remaining members are both causes and effects.

original: gzhan yang dus gsum du yongs su shes pa'i bye brag dang / snga ma bzhin du nor pa'i sa med pa yongs su shes pa'i bye brag dang / chos gnas pa'i shes pas bsdus pa'i 'dzin pa'i shes pa mi rtag pa'i bye brag gis ni shes pa'i gzhi bdun cu rtsa bdun du 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang dus gsum du yongs su shes pa'i bye brag dang / snga ma bzhin du nor pa'i sa med pa yongs su shes pa'i bye brag dang / chos gnas pa'i shes pas bsdus pa'i 'dzin pa'i shes pa mi rtag pa'i bye brag gis ni shes pa'i gzhi bdun cu rtsa bdun du 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the basis of knowledge should be understood as having seventy-seven aspects, by means of the distinctions of the knowledge of the three times, the distinctions of the knowledge of non-error as before, and the distinctions of the knowledge of grasping impermanence, which is included in the knowledge of the stability of the Dharma.

original: des ni bden pa brtag pa'i rnam pa thams cad bstan te /
analyzed: des ni bden pa brtag pa'i rnam pa thams cad bstan te /
translated: This teaches all the aspects of the investigation of the truths.

original: de'i rjes la bden pa mngon par rtogs par 'gyur la rim gyis dgra bcom pa'i bar @269a * //üîΩdu yang 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes la bden pa mngon par rtogs par 'gyur la rim gyis dgra bcom pa'i bar @269a * // du yang 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: After that, one will realize the truths and gradually attain the state of an arhat.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'du byed rnams ni rnam pa gsum gyis rim gyis 'jug par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i 'du byed rnams ni rnam pa gsum gyis rim gyis 'jug par rig par bya ste /
translated: The formations that arise in dependence should be understood as proceeding gradually in three ways.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

analyzed: de lta mod kyi de'i rgyud la kun nas nyon mongs pa de'i bag la nyal gnas te /

translated: Since he focuses on that, his mind becomes defiled in the abodes of consciousness, and he establishes the rebirth that is a new existence.

original: mi slob pa'i ni tshe 'di la kun nas nyon mongs pa gnyi ga'i kun nas dkris pa dang / bag la nyal spangs pas na phyi ma la rnam par shes pa'i gnas rnams la sems kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bcas pas yang srid par skye ba mngon par 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni 'das pa'i dus nas bzung ste /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpar gyur pa na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba 'di nyid tshul bzhin du yid la byed pas /

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: They have attained the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood.

original: dper na da ltar gyi bcom ldan 'das lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na da ltar gyi bcom ldan 'das lta bu'o //
translated: They are like the present Bhagavat.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas kyang /
translated: Having attained the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de nyid la lugs su 'byung ba dang lugs su 'byung ba ma yin pa'i tshul gyis dmigs pa bcas nas tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa'i sbyor ba la brtson zhing bde ba la reg par gnas te /

translated: they have focused on dependent origination itself through the method of forward and reverse progression, and they have applied themselves to the practice of abiding in happiness in this life and have touched the bliss of abiding in happiness.

original: dper na da ltar gyi bcom ldan 'das lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na da ltar gyi bcom ldan 'das lta bu'o //
translated: They are like the present Bhagavat.

analyzed: de dag kyang tshad med de 'jig rten na shug gnyis kyis bdun brgyud bstan pa dang 'dra ba'i sgo nas ni bdun kho nar bstan to //
translated: Those are also immeasurable, but they are taught to be only seven in terms of the teaching of the seven lineages in the world through two causes.

original: de ltar na bla na med pa'i byang chub lta bu yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas ma rtogs pa ni rtogs par 'gyur la rtogs zin pa ni tshe 'di la bde bar gnas par 'gyur na dma' ba'i
analyzed: de ltar na bla na med pa'i byang chub lta bu yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas ma rtogs pa ni rtogs par 'gyur la rtogs zin pa ni tshe 'di la bde bar gnas par 'gyur na dma' ba'i
translated: Thus, even the unsurpassed enlightenment is realized by knowing dependent origination just as it is, and what has been realized is the state of bliss in this life.üîΩ

original: byang chub lta ci smos /
analyzed: byang chub lta ci smos /
translated: Thus, even the unsurpassed enlightenment is realized by knowing dependent origination correctly as it is, and having realized it, one abides in this life with ease, so what need is there to mention the lower enlightenments?

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par bya ba'i thabs ni yan lag lngas yongs su zin pa yin te spong ba yin te snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par bya ba'i thabs ni yan lag lngas yongs su zin pa yin te spong ba yin te snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The method for fully and perfectly realizing dependent origination correctly as it is is fully grasped by five factors, which should be understood as before.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de'i bsdus pa'i don yang @270a * //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de'i bsdus pa'i don yang @270a * //
translated: The summarized meaning of dependent origination is as follows.

analyzed: 'jug pa'i phyogs kyi sgo nas ni sdug bsngal rgyu dang bcas pa'o //
translated: From the perspective of engagement, it is suffering together with its cause.

original: ldog pa'i phyogs kyi sgo nas ni zag pa med pa'i chos rnams rgyu dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: ldog pa'i phyogs kyi sgo nas ni zag pa med pa'i chos rnams rgyu dang bcas pa'o //

analyzed: sdug bsngal rgyu dang bcas pa'i rgyu ni zag pa rnams so //

original: zag pa de rnams kyi rten du gyur pa ni ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: zag pa de rnams kyi rten du gyur pa ni ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'o //
translated: The basis of the contaminants is the feeling that arises from contact with ignorance.

analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa'i chos rnams gnas pa'i rgyu ni tshe 'di la nyon mongs pa spangs pa'i phung po tsam gyis rkyen to //
translated: The cause of the abiding of dharmas together with their causes is the mere aggregates of the abandonment of the defilements in this life.

original: rim gyis yang dag par grub pa'i rnam par dag pa bdun gyi sgo nas nye bar len pa med pa'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir rten 'di pa nyid kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba lugs su 'byung ba'i yan lag ni zab mo'i gtam yinüîΩpar rig par bya ste /

translated: The forward order of dependent origination is the profound teaching in this very life, for the sake of the nirvana without appropriation, through the seven purities that are gradually accomplished.

original: bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdun gang zhe na /

translated: Pure morality, pure mind, pure view, pure transcendence of doubt, pure knowledge and insight into the path and what is not the path,

analyzed: lam gyi shes pa mthong ba rnam par dag pa dang / lam spong ba'i shes pa mthong ba rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: pure knowledge and insight into the path, and pure knowledge and insight into the abandonment of the path.

analyzed: rnam par dag pa 'di rnams ji ltar rim gyis yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur zhe na ;

analyzed: 'di na dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan par gnas shing so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams pa zhes bya ba nas rgyas par 'di lta ste /

analyzed: nyan thos kyis las 'byung ba bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: up to knowing and seeing as it is the arising and cessation of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, just as it is said for the shravaka.

translated: Having thus become endowed with morality and free from regret, up to the point of attaining the four meditative concentrations,

analyzed: de de ltar sems mnyam par gzhag pa nas drang por gyur cing las su rung bar gnas la mi g-yo ba'i bar du thos nas zag pa zad pa shes pa mngon sum du bya ba'i mngon par shes pa las sems mngon par 'jog par byed pas des 'phags

analyzed: pa'i bden pa bzhi mngon par rtogs par 'gyur te //

analyzed: gtan spangs pas rnam par rgal bar yang 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de the tshom las brgal bas yang dag pa'i lta ba sngon du 'gro ba'i lam la yang lam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes la /
