original: des dang po ril dang / gnyis kyis phyogs gcig spangs nas mngon par shes pa myur ba sla ba yang dag par bsgrubs te de la brten nas de'i 'og tu zag pa rnams zad pas tshe 'di la len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: des dang po ril dang / gnyis kyis phyogs gcig spangs nas mngon par shes pa myur ba sla ba yang dag par bsgrubs te de la brten nas de'i 'og tu zag pa rnams zad pas tshe 'di la len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur te /
translated: Having first eliminated the first and second difficulties, he accomplishes the easy superknowledge that is quick. Relying on that, he subsequently eliminates the defilements and attains nirvana without clinging in this life.

original: lus dang bral nas kyang phung po'i lhag ma med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dang bral nas kyang phung po'i lhag ma med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And after separating from the body, he attains nirvana without any remainder of the aggregates.

original: de ltar na rnam par dag pa bdun po de dag la brten cing rim gyis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par dag pa bdun po de dag la brten cing rim gyis 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus, in this way, he gradually accomplishes all the seven purities,

original: len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i bar du yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: up to the attainment of nirvana without clinging.

original: de la gang gi phyir rim gyis rnam par dag pa thams cad tshang @271a * //
analyzed: de la gang gi phyir rim gyis rnam par dag pa thams cad tshang @271a * //
translated: In this regard, the reason why all the purities are accomplished in sequence is as follows.

original: bas len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bas len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yang dag par 'grub par 'gyur gyi /
translated: and the accomplishment of nirvana without grasping.

original: gang yang rung ba 'ga' ma tshang bas ni ma yin te de bas na thams cad kyi don gyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du tshangs par spyad pa spyod kyi 'ga' tsam gyi phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba 'ga' ma tshang bas ni ma yin te de bas na thams cad kyi don gyi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi thad du tshangs par spyad pa spyod kyi 'ga' tsam gyi phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: But if any one of them is missing, it is not. Therefore, they practice pure conduct in the presence of the Lord for the sake of all, not for the sake of any one of them.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyang thams cad kyis len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar brda sprod par mdzad kyi 'ga' tsam ma gtogs pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyang thams cad kyis len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar brda sprod par mdzad kyi 'ga' tsam ma gtogs pas ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Lord also teaches nirvana without remainder for the sake of all, not for the sake of any one of them.

original: de de ltar na 'dir re re'i sgo nas de 'ba' zhig gis kyang len pa med par mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur la de med par yang ma yin pa 'di ni 'dir rkyen 'di pa nyid kyi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab mo yin par
analyzed: de de ltar na 'dir re re'i sgo nas de 'ba' zhig gis kyang len pa med par mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur la de med par yang ma yin pa 'di ni 'dir rkyen 'di pa nyid kyi rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zab mo yin par
translated: Thus, in this context, nirvana without remainder does not occur through any one of them alone, nor does it not occur without them. This is the profound dependent origination of this conditionality.

original: rig par bya'o /
analyzed: rig par bya'o /
translated: This should be understood as it is taught in the scriptures.

original: // / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las gzhi bsdu ba /
analyzed: // / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las gzhi bsdu ba /
translated: The Compendium of Bases in the YogƒÅcƒÅrabh≈´mi says:

original: bam po bco lnga pa /
analyzed: bam po bco lnga pa /
translated: The summary is:üîΩThe presentation, the causes,üîΩthe permanent object, the disadvantages,

original: sdom ni / rnam par gzhag dang rgyu rnams dang // don rtag pa dang nyes dmigs dang // kun nas nyon mongs tha ma yin //
analyzed: sdom ni / rnam par gzhag dang rgyu rnams dang // don rtag pa dang nyes dmigs dang // kun nas nyon mongs tha ma yin //
translated: and the final is the afflictions.

original: chos bzhi po 'di dag ni tshe 'di la dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rgyas par byed pa ste /
analyzed: chos bzhi po 'di dag ni tshe 'di la dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rgyas par byed pa ste /
translated: These four dharmas increase the great elements of the faculties in this life.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /üîΩstobs dang / bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / sdug pa'i dngos po la re ba dang / stobs dang / bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / re ba rnams kyi rten du gyur pa'i dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po tshe dang bcas /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na / stobs dang / bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / sdug pa'i dngos po la re ba dang / stobs dang / bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / re ba rnams kyi rten du gyur pa'i dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po tshe dang bcas /
translated: What are the four?

original: drod dang bcas pa rnams gnas shing 'jig par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: drod dang bcas pa rnams gnas shing 'jig par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The great elements of the faculties that are the basis of strength, happiness, mental pleasure, and hope for desirable things, and the great elements of the faculties that are the basis of strength, happiness, mental pleasure, and hope, along with heat and life, remain and do not perish.

original: chos bzhi po de dag gso ba'i zas kyang go rims bzhin du bzhi yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: chos bzhi po de dag gso ba'i zas kyang go rims bzhin du bzhi yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: The food that heals those four dharmas should be understood as existing in four ways, in order.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows.

original: kham gyis za ba dang bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa zag pa dang bcas pa dang / yid la sems pa dang / dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po len par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: kham gyis za ba dang bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa zag pa dang bcas pa dang / yid la sems pa dang / dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po len par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: mental volition, and consciousness.

original: de la kham gyis za ba ni tshe 'di la stobs gso bar byed de stobs las ni dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la kham gyis za ba ni tshe 'di la stobs gso bar byed de stobs las ni dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Morsel food sustains the body in this life, for the great elements of the sense faculties are nourished by it.

original: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa zag pa dang bcas pa ni bde ba dang yid bde ba gso bar byed de /
analyzed: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa zag pa dang bcas pa ni bde ba dang yid bde ba gso bar byed de /
translated: Contact that produces pleasure sustains pleasure and mental satisfaction.

original: bde ba dang yid bde ba las ni dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang yid bde ba las ni dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The great elements of the sense faculties are nourished by pleasure and mental satisfaction.

original: yid yul dang phrad par byed pa'i sems pa la ni yid la sems pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yid yul dang phrad par byed pa'i sems pa la ni yid la sems pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Mental volition is the intention that brings about the contact of the mind with its object.

original: de ni 'dod pa'i @271b yul la re ba gso bar byed de /
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa'i @271b yul la re ba gso bar byed de /
translated: It sustains hope for the objects of desire.

original: re ba las ni dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: re ba las ni dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rnams rgyas par 'gyur ro //
translated: The great elements of the sense faculties are nourished by hope.

original: dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po len par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa ni dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po tshe dang bcas pa dang drod dang bcas pa de rnams kyi gnas pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po len par byed pa'i rnam par shes pa ni dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po tshe dang bcas pa dang drod dang bcas pa de rnams kyi gnas pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The consciousness that appropriates the great elements of the sense faculties is the cause of the duration of the great elements of the sense faculties, together with life and heat.

original: gnas pa de ni rnam par shes pa lus dang mi 'bral ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa de ni rnam par shes pa lus dang mi 'bral ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: That duration is the cause of consciousness not being separated from the body.

original: stobs dang / bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / re ba de rnams kyi gnas kyang de la brten nas 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: stobs dang / bde ba dang / yid bde ba dang / re ba de rnams kyi gnas kyang de la brten nas 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: Strength, happiness, mental pleasure, and hope all occur in dependence on that, and they are the cause of the duration of consciousness.

original: de ltar na sems can 'byung ba rnams gnas par byed pa ni zas bzhi yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sems can 'byung ba rnams gnas par byed pa ni zas bzhi yin no //
translated: Thus, the four nutriments are what causes the duration of sentient beings who have come into existence.

original: de la kham gyis za ba las ni stobs 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la kham gyis za ba las ni stobs 'byung ngo //
translated: Among them, strength arises from the nutriment of edible food.

original: stobs las ni dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rgyas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: stobs las ni dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po rgyas par 'gyur te /
translated: From strength, the great elements of the sense faculties increase.

original: de bas na lus dang srog la lta ba'i byis pa gang yin pa ni don de yongs su tshol ba na dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyang byed cing sogs la nyon mongs pa gsar yang 'phel bar byed de /
analyzed: de bas na lus dang srog la lta ba'i byis pa gang yin pa ni don de yongs su tshol ba na dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las kyang byed cing sogs la nyon mongs pa gsar yang 'phel bar byed de /
translated: Therefore, the childish who view the body and life as real, when seeking the meaning of those, create virtuous and nonvirtuous karma and increase the afflictions.

original: kham gyi zas ci lta ba bzhin du reg pa dang / yid la sems pa yang ci rigs par de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kham gyi zas ci lta ba bzhin du reg pa dang / yid la sems pa yang ci rigs par de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Contact and intention should be understood in the same way as food by the mouthfuls, as appropriate.

original: des gsum po de dag gi sgo nas yang srid par skye ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa bsgrubs nas tshe 'di la rnam par shes pa de las dang nyon mongs par nye bar 'gro ba dang / len pa dang bcas pa dang / phyi ma la yang srid par skye ba la phan 'dogs par byed do //
analyzed: des gsum po de dag gi sgo nas yang srid par skye ba'i las dang nyon mongs pa bsgrubs nas tshe 'di la rnam par shes pa de las dang nyon mongs par nye bar 'gro ba dang / len pa dang bcas pa dang / phyi ma la yang srid par skye ba la phan 'dogs par byed do //
translated: Having established karma and affliction for rebirth through those three, in this life consciousness is accompanied by karma and affliction and is accompanied by appropriation and it benefits rebirth in the next life.

original: de ltar na zas bzhi po 'di dag ni 'byung ba tshol zhing yang srid par skye ba 'dod pa yang srid par skye ba ma spangs pa rnams kyi yang srid par skye ba sdud pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na zas bzhi po 'di dag ni 'byung ba tshol zhing yang srid par skye ba 'dod pa yang srid par skye ba ma spangs pa rnams kyi yang srid par skye ba sdud pa dang / yongs su 'dzin pa dang / phan 'dogs par byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, these four nutriments are the accumulation, the appropriation, and the assistance of the new existence for those who have not abandoned the desire for the new existence, who seek the elements, and who desire the new existence.

original: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams kyi ni kham gyis za ba che phra ba yin no //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams kyi ni kham gyis za ba che phra ba yin no //
translated: Among the gods of the realm of desire, the nutriment consisting of gross or subtle morsels is the most important.

original: bar mdo'i srid pa rnams dang / ma'i mngal na 'dug pa rnams kyi yang de dang 'dra'o //üîΩ'dod pa'i khams kyi de ma yin pa'i bar skabs rnams kyi kham gyis za ba ni rags par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bar mdo'i srid pa rnams dang / ma'i mngal na 'dug pa rnams kyi yang de dang 'dra'o // 'dod pa'i khams kyi de ma yin pa'i bar skabs rnams kyi kham gyis za ba ni rags par rig par bya'o //
translated: The same is true for those in the intermediate existence and for those in the mother's womb.üîΩThe nutriment consisting of gross morsels should be understood as the most important for those in the realm of desire who are not in the above mentioned states.

original: reg pa dang yid la sems pa dang / rnam par shes pa rnams ni gzugs med pa rnams kyi ni cha phra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: reg pa dang yid la sems pa dang / rnam par shes pa rnams ni gzugs med pa rnams kyi ni cha phra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The nutriments consisting of contact, mental will, and consciousness are the most important for those in the formless realm.

original: de ma yin pa'i ni gzugs la brten pas brtag sla ba dang yongs su gcad par sla ba'i phyir rags pa yin no //üîΩ'di ni zas cha phra ba dang / rags pa'i rnam grangs tha @272a * //
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i ni gzugs la brten pas brtag sla ba dang yongs su gcad par sla ba'i phyir rags pa yin no // 'di ni zas cha phra ba dang / rags pa'i rnam grangs tha @272a * //
translated: The other three are gross because they are easy to examine and easy to discriminate, since they are based on form.

original: dad pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dad pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: This is the difference in the classification of the subtle and gross nutriments.

original: sems can byung ba rnams gnas par byed pa gang yin pa de dag ni rags pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can byung ba rnams gnas par byed pa gang yin pa de dag ni rags pa yin no //
translated: The nutriments that maintain sentient beings who have already arisen are gross.

original: 'byung bar 'dod pa rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa gang yin pa de dag ni cha phra ba yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'dod pa rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa gang yin pa de dag ni cha phra ba yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The nutriments that benefit those who desire to arise are subtle.

original: 'di ni zas bzhi po rnams rnam par gzhag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zas bzhi po rnams rnam par gzhag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the presentation of the four nutriments.

original: dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po de dag ni sngon gyi sred pa kun 'byung ba'i bde bas bsdus pas bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: dbang po'i 'byung ba chen po de dag ni sngon gyi sred pa kun 'byung ba'i bde bas bsdus pas bskyed pa ste /
translated: The great elements of the faculties are generated by the prior arising of craving and the arising of pleasure.

original: de dag 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir zas bzhi yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag 'phel bar bya ba'i phyir zas bzhi yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: In order to increase them, one seeks the four nutriments.

original: de bas na rnam grangs 'dis sems can 'byung zhing mngon par grub pa rnams gnas par 'gyur ba'i zas bzhi gang yin pa de dag kyang sred pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin te /üîΩsred pa dang bcas pas tshe 'di la lus dang zas rnams la rnam pa gsum gyi sgo nas las dang nyon mongs pa rgyas par byas nas tshe 'di la yang srid par skye ba la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa las dang nyon mongs par nye
analyzed: de bas na rnam grangs 'dis sems can 'byung zhing mngon par grub pa rnams gnas par 'gyur ba'i zas bzhi gang yin pa de dag kyang sred pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin te / sred pa dang bcas pas tshe 'di la lus dang zas rnams la rnam pa gsum gyi sgo nas las dang nyon mongs pa rgyas par byas nas tshe 'di la yang srid par skye ba la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa las dang nyon mongs par nye
translated: Therefore, by this method, the four foods that cause sentient beings to come into existence and that cause those who have come into existence to remain are also produced from the cause of craving.

original: bar 'gro ba dang / len pa dang bcas par byed do //
analyzed: bar 'gro ba dang / len pa dang bcas par byed do //
translated: Because of craving, one increases karma and afflictions in this life in three ways with regard to the body and food. Then, one makes consciousness proceed toward karma and afflictions and one makes it grasp a new existence in the next life.

original: de bas na 'byung ba tshol ba'i sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i zas bzhi po gang yin pa de dag kyang sred pa'i rgyu las byung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na 'byung ba tshol ba'i sems can rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i zas bzhi po gang yin pa de dag kyang sred pa'i rgyu las byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the four foods that benefit sentient beings who seek existence are also produced from the cause of craving.

original: sred pa de yang tshe 'di nyid la ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'i rkyen gyis skye'o //
analyzed: sred pa de yang tshe 'di nyid la ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba'i rkyen gyis skye'o //
translated: Craving arises from the condition of feeling that arises from the contact of ignorance in this very life.

original: des ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba de yang ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis skye'o //
analyzed: des ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las byung ba'i tshor ba de yang ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis skye'o //
translated: That feeling which arises from the contact of ignorance is born from the condition of the contact of ignorance.

original: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa de yang sngon goms pas ma rig pa'i khams dang ldan pa'i skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis skye'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa de yang sngon goms pas ma rig pa'i khams dang ldan pa'i skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis skye'o //
translated: That contact of ignorance is born from the condition of the six sense bases that are endowed with the element of ignorance due to previous habituation.

original: de bas na tshe 'di la skye mched drug las gud na rgyu gzhan med de /
analyzed: de bas na tshe 'di la skye mched drug las gud na rgyu gzhan med de /
translated: Therefore, in this life, apart from the six sense bases, there is no other cause.

original: skye mched drug po de nyid gcig la gcig brten par zad de /
analyzed: skye mched drug po de nyid gcig la gcig brten par zad de /
translated: Those very six sense bases are mutually dependent.

original: rnam par shes pa ni gzugs can gyi dbang po la brten to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni gzugs can gyi dbang po la brten to //
translated: Consciousness is based on the physical sense faculties.

original: rnam par shes pas zin pa'i gzugs can gyis dbang po rnams kyang ming la brten te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pas zin pa'i gzugs can gyis dbang po rnams kyang ming la brten te /
translated: The physical sense faculties that are conjoined with consciousness are also based on name.

original: de bas na skye mched drug las gud na med ces bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na skye mched drug las gud na med ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that apart from the six sense bases, there is no other.

original: gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi yan lag gi stobs dam pa'i chos thos pa la brten nas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi yan lag gi stobs dam pa'i chos thos pa la brten nas /
translated: When, based on hearing the excellent Dharma with the power of external limbs,

original: nang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i rgyus yang dag pa'i lta ba bskyed de /
analyzed: nang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i rgyus yang dag pa'i lta ba bskyed de /
translated: The cause of proper mental attention is the correct view.

original: de bas na ma rig pa ni spong @272b la rig pa ni bskyed do //
analyzed: de bas na ma rig pa ni spong @272b la rig pa ni bskyed do //
translated: Therefore, ignorance is eliminated and knowledge is generated.

original: gnas yongs su gyur cing de'i nang gi gnas ngan len shin tu sbyangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnas yongs su gyur cing de'i nang gi gnas ngan len shin tu sbyangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the basis is completely transformed and the negative tendencies within it are thoroughly refined,

original: tshe 'di la de'i ma rig pa'i khams dang ldan pa'i skye mched drug gang yin pa de ni 'gag la rig pa'i khams dang ldan pa ni skye'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di la de'i ma rig pa'i khams dang ldan pa'i skye mched drug gang yin pa de ni 'gag la rig pa'i khams dang ldan pa ni skye'o //
translated: in this life, the six sense spheres that possess the element of ignorance cease, and those that possess the element of knowledge are generated.

original: de'i skye mched drug 'gags pas rim gyis sred pa'i bar du 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i skye mched drug 'gags pas rim gyis sred pa'i bar du 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because those six sense spheres cease, craving ceases in sequence.

original: srid pa 'gags pas zas 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid pa 'gags pas zas 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because existence ceases, sustenance ceases.

original: yang srid par skye ba la phan 'dogs pa'i zas rnams 'gags nas kyang rigs pa dang ldan zhing 'byung ba mi tshol ba de'i yang sred par skye ba 'gag par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang srid par skye ba la phan 'dogs pa'i zas rnams 'gags nas kyang rigs pa dang ldan zhing 'byung ba mi tshol ba de'i yang sred par skye ba 'gag par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: When the sustenance that benefits the birth of existence ceases, one should understand that the birth of existence ceases, because one does not seek out what is logical and what occurs.

original: chos la zas de dag za ba dang / gang gis de dag la zas zhes bya bar 'gyur ba'i chos skyes nas gnas pa de gang yang med la bdag kyang med de 'on kyang chos rnams nyid ma skyes pa skye ba'i rkyen gyis tshul gyis chos rnams nyid kyis chos rnams gso ba 'di ni zas kyi
analyzed: chos la zas de dag za ba dang / gang gis de dag la zas zhes bya bar 'gyur ba'i chos skyes nas gnas pa de gang yang med la bdag kyang med de 'on kyang chos rnams nyid ma skyes pa skye ba'i rkyen gyis tshul gyis chos rnams nyid kyis chos rnams gso ba 'di ni zas kyi
translated: However, the meaning of food is that phenomena themselves are nourished by phenomena through the process of arising conditions for that which is unborn.

original: don te kun rdzob tu chos kyi brdas rnam par shes pa la gang zag tu btags nas zas bzhi po rnams za ba'i gang zag ces bya bar zad de /
analyzed: don te kun rdzob tu chos kyi brdas rnam par shes pa la gang zag tu btags nas zas bzhi po rnams za ba'i gang zag ces bya bar zad de /
translated: In terms of the conventional, the designation of consciousness as a person is made through the symbol of phenomena, and it is simply said that the person consumes the four foods.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i don yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su tha snyad gdags pa'i don yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: it is for the sake of conventional designation, not for the sake of the ultimate.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gal te rnam par shes pa skyes nas gnas shing gang zag gi tshul gyis yongs su grub ste /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa skyes nas gnas shing gang zag gi tshul gyis yongs su grub ste /
translated: If consciousness were to arise and endure and be established in the manner of a person,

original: za ba por gyur na ni rnam par shes pa zas su 'gyur du mi rung ste /
analyzed: za ba por gyur na ni rnam par shes pa zas su 'gyur du mi rung ste /
translated: and if it were to become the consumer, then it would not be suitable for consciousness to be food.

original: nam yang gang zag nyid gang zag la za bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: nam yang gang zag nyid gang zag la za bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: The person is never the consumer of the person.

original: rgyud gcig la rnam par shes pa gnyis cig car gnas pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud gcig la rnam par shes pa gnyis cig car gnas pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And two consciousnesses do not occur simultaneously in the same stream of consciousness.

original: de bas na gang zag gi tshul gyis yongs su grub ste /
analyzed: de bas na gang zag gi tshul gyis yongs su grub ste /
translated: Therefore, the person is not substantially real in the sense of being independent.

original: gnas nas rnam par shes pa za ba por 'gyur du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gnas nas rnam par shes pa za ba por 'gyur du mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not tenable that the person is the consumer of the consciousness that is its support.

original: de ltar mi rung bzhin du gang 'di skad du su zhig rnam par shes pa'i zas za zhes dri ba 'dri bar byed na ni tshul bzhin ma yin par 'dri ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mi rung bzhin du gang 'di skad du su zhig rnam par shes pa'i zas za zhes dri ba 'dri bar byed na ni tshul bzhin ma yin par 'dri ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: If someone were to ask, ‚ÄúWho consumes the food of consciousness?‚Äù this question should be recognized as improperly formulated.

original: gal te 'di skad du /
analyzed: gal te 'di skad du /
translated: If someone were to ask,

original: rnam par shes pa'i zas de gang gi rkyen yin zhes 'dri na ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la yang zhugs pa yin pas na tshul bzhin du 'dri ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i zas de gang gi rkyen yin zhes 'dri na ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la yang zhugs pa yin pas na tshul bzhin du 'dri ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is the condition of the food of consciousness?‚Äù this question should be recognized as properly formulated, because it is consistent with dependent origination.

original: srid pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: srid pa ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of existence:

original: skye ba'i srid pa dang / las kyi srid pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i srid pa dang / las kyi srid pa'o //
translated: existence as birth and existence as action.

original: de la phyi ma'i yang srid pa skye ba'i skye ba'i srid pa mngon par 'grub cing 'byung bar @273a * //
analyzed: de la phyi ma'i yang srid pa skye ba'i skye ba'i srid pa mngon par 'grub cing 'byung bar @273a * //
translated: The latter is the actualization and arising of the birth existence that is the rebirth existence.üîΩ

original: 'gyur ba la ni da ltar tshe 'di la las dang nyon mongs par nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de phyi ma la skye ba'i srid pa de 'phen pa ste /
analyzed: 'gyur ba la ni da ltar tshe 'di la las dang nyon mongs par nye bar 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de phyi ma la skye ba'i srid pa de 'phen pa ste /
translated: The consciousness that is projected by karma and the mental afflictions in this life is the consciousness that is the support for the arising of the intermediate existence and the birth existence in the next life.

original: de de'i sngon du 'gro ba'i tshul gyis byung ba la ni las kyi srid pa zhes bya'o //üîΩtshe 'di nyid la srid pa de byung bar gyur na phyi ma la de'i yang srid pa skye ba /
analyzed: de de'i sngon du 'gro ba'i tshul gyis byung ba la ni las kyi srid pa zhes bya'o // tshe 'di nyid la srid pa de byung bar gyur na phyi ma la de'i yang srid pa skye ba /
translated: The existence that is projected by karma is the existence that occurs prior to the intermediate existence and the birth existence.üîΩThe existence that occurs in this life is the birth existence that is included in the next life because it is the existence that arises after death.

original: skye ba'i srid pas bsdus pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'chi ba'i dus byas nas sngon gyi mtha'i skye mched drug 'gags pa las phyi ma'i mtha'i skye mched drug skyes pa la ni skye ba'i srid pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i srid pas bsdus pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'chi ba'i dus byas nas sngon gyi mtha'i skye mched drug 'gags pa las phyi ma'i mtha'i skye mched drug skyes pa la ni skye ba'i srid pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The six sense spheres of the prior end are severed and the six sense spheres of the later end arise.

original: rnam par shes pa de ni skye mched drug po de'i sngon du 'phen pa yin pa'i phyir yang rkyen yin la nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe yang rkyen yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de ni skye mched drug po de'i sngon du 'phen pa yin pa'i phyir yang rkyen yin la nying mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe yang rkyen yin te /
translated: Consciousness is a condition of the six sense spheres because it impels them prior to their arising. It is also a condition at the time of rebirth.

original: 'di ltar ma'i mngal du rnam par shes pa zhugs pa las ni ming dang gzugs 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma'i mngal du rnam par shes pa zhugs pa las ni ming dang gzugs 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, name and form arise from the entry of consciousness into the mother‚Äôs womb.

original: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis ni ma rig pa'i khams dang ldan pa'i skye mched drug 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis ni ma rig pa'i khams dang ldan pa'i skye mched drug 'byung ngo //
translated: The condition of name and form is the arising of the six sense spheres that possess the element of ignorance.

original: de nas de'i rkyen gyis de dang 'dra ba'i reg pa'i rim pas len pa'i rkyen gyis yang phyi ma'i mtha'i las kyi srid pa'i bar du 'byung ste /
analyzed: de nas de'i rkyen gyis de dang 'dra ba'i reg pa'i rim pas len pa'i rkyen gyis yang phyi ma'i mtha'i las kyi srid pa'i bar du 'byung ste /
translated: Then, due to that condition, the continuum of contact that is similar to that arises. Due to the condition of grasping, the continuum of karma that is the cause of future existence arises.

original: chos 'di dag thams cad kyang med pa las rang rang gi rkyen gyis skye bar 'gyur gyi de dag gis reg pa po nas srid pa po'i bar gang reg par byed pa nas srid par byed pa'i bar du gang yang med do //
analyzed: chos 'di dag thams cad kyang med pa las rang rang gi rkyen gyis skye bar 'gyur gyi de dag gis reg pa po nas srid pa po'i bar gang reg par byed pa nas srid par byed pa'i bar du gang yang med do //
translated: All of these phenomena arise from nonexistence due to their individual conditions. There is no one who contacts them up to the one who exists, that is, from the one who contacts them up to the one who exists.

original: chos 'di dag ni de ma yin pa dag gis gso zhing de ma yin pa rnams kyis bza' bar zad de /
analyzed: chos 'di dag ni de ma yin pa dag gis gso zhing de ma yin pa rnams kyis bza' bar zad de /
translated: These phenomena are nourished by what is not those phenomena and are consumed by what is not those phenomena.

original: de bas na rgyu dang 'bras bur gtogs pa'i 'du byed kyi rgyud rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug ste /
analyzed: de bas na rgyu dang 'bras bur gtogs pa'i 'du byed kyi rgyud rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug ste /
translated: Therefore, the continuum of the series of formations that are included in cause and effect occurs without interruption.

original: snga ma'i las kyi srid pa las phyi ma'i mtha'i skye ba'i srid pa 'byung ba ni 'gro ba yin no ;
analyzed: snga ma'i las kyi srid pa las phyi ma'i mtha'i skye ba'i srid pa 'byung ba ni 'gro ba yin no ;
translated: The arising of the subsequent existence of birth from the prior existence of karma is migration.

original: / phyi ma'i mtha'i las kyi srid pa las yang snga ma'i skye ba'i srid pa de nyid phyir ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: / phyi ma'i mtha'i las kyi srid pa las yang snga ma'i skye ba'i srid pa de nyid phyir ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: From the subsequent existence of karma, the prior existence of birth arises again.

original: de ltar na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i 'khor lo 'di ni 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol dang / 'jig rten pha rol nas 'jig rten 'dir 'khor ro //
analyzed: de ltar na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i 'khor lo 'di ni 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten pha rol dang / 'jig rten pha rol nas 'jig rten 'dir 'khor ro //
translated: Thus, this wheel of dependent origination turns from this world to the next world and from the next world back to this world.

original: de bas na chos rnams gso ba'i don ni zas kyi don du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na chos rnams gso ba'i don ni zas kyi don du rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of nourishing phenomena should be understood as the meaning of food.

original: zas rnam pa gsum gyi rgyu las byung ba'i nang gi sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum skye ba skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zas rnam pa gsum gyi rgyu las byung ba'i nang gi sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum skye ba skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: The three kinds of internal suffering arise from the three kinds of causes that are the three kinds of food.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: khams ma snyoms pa las byung ba'i nad kyi sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pas phongs pa'i @273b sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: khams ma snyoms pa las byung ba'i nad kyi sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal dang / 'dod pas phongs pa'i @273b sdug bsngal lo //
translated: the suffering of disease arising from an imbalance of the elements, the suffering of desire, and the suffering of the frustration of desire.

original: de la dang po ni kham gyi zas kyi rgyu las byung ngo //
analyzed: de la dang po ni kham gyi zas kyi rgyu las byung ngo //
translated: The first arises from the cause of material food.

original: gnyis pa ni reg pa'i zas kyi rgyu las byung ngo //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni reg pa'i zas kyi rgyu las byung ngo //
translated: The second arises from the cause of the food of contact.

original: gsum pa ni yid la sems pa'i zas las byung ngo //üîΩdge slong gi kham gyi zas kyi rgyu las nang gi nad kyi sdug bsngal du 'gyur bar mthong nas kham gyi zas za ba na bu'i sha la bab pa bzhin du mngon par chags pa med do //
analyzed: gsum pa ni yid la sems pa'i zas las byung ngo // dge slong gi kham gyi zas kyi rgyu las nang gi nad kyi sdug bsngal du 'gyur bar mthong nas kham gyi zas za ba na bu'i sha la bab pa bzhin du mngon par chags pa med do //
translated: The third arises from the food of mental pleasure.üîΩThe monk, seeing that the cause of material food is the suffering of disease within, is not attached to eating material food, as if he were eating the flesh of his own son.

original: dge slong gi bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa'i rgyu la nang gi 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal yin par yang dag par mthong bas reg pa'i skye mched drug po rnams pa lang ko ba bshus pa dang 'dra bar mthong nas /
analyzed: dge slong gi bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa'i rgyu la nang gi 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal yin par yang dag par mthong bas reg pa'i skye mched drug po rnams pa lang ko ba bshus pa dang 'dra bar mthong nas /
translated: The monk, seeing that the cause of the food of contact is the suffering of desire within, sees the six sense bases as being like a flayed cow.

original: de 'di snyam du sems te gal te bdag reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di dag dang 'dod cing sred pa'i kun tu chags pa rnams kyis gzugs rnams la brten te gnas par gyur na ni gzugs rnams la brten pas bdag sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams
analyzed: de 'di snyam du sems te gal te bdag reg pa'i skye mched drug po 'di dag dang 'dod cing sred pa'i kun tu chags pa rnams kyis gzugs rnams la brten te gnas par gyur na ni gzugs rnams la brten pas bdag sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams
translated: He thinks: ‚ÄúIf I were to live in dependence on forms, supported by the six sense bases and by the attachments and cravings of desire, then, living in dependence on forms, I would be subject to the conceptual thoughts of bad, unwholesome dharmas.

original: kyi rtog pa dag gis ba lang ko ba bshus na srog chags rnams kyi bza' ba dang / za ba na yang sdug bsngal zhing mi bde bar gnas pa bzhin du 'gyur ro snyam mo //
analyzed: kyi rtog pa dag gis ba lang ko ba bshus na srog chags rnams kyi bza' ba dang / za ba na yang sdug bsngal zhing mi bde bar gnas pa bzhin du 'gyur ro snyam mo //
translated: Just as when the skin of a cow is flayed, the living creatures that live in the skin suffer and are in pain.‚Äù

original: des de ltar mthong nas dang po'i reg pa'i skye mched la nyes dmigs su mthong bas kun nas nyon mongs pa mi spyod do //
analyzed: des de ltar mthong nas dang po'i reg pa'i skye mched la nyes dmigs su mthong bas kun nas nyon mongs pa mi spyod do //
translated: Having seen this, he does not engage in the defilements, because he has seen the danger in the first sense base.

original: gzugs rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams kyang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams kyang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: As with forms, so it is with sounds, smells, tastes, tangibles, and dharmas.

original: dang po reg pa'i skye mched ji lta ba bzhin du drug pa'i reg pa'i skye mched kyi bar gyi nyes dmigs pa'i mthong bas kun nas nyon mongs pa med par gnas so //
analyzed: dang po reg pa'i skye mched ji lta ba bzhin du drug pa'i reg pa'i skye mched kyi bar gyi nyes dmigs pa'i mthong bas kun nas nyon mongs pa med par gnas so //
translated: First, he abides without afflictions by seeing the disadvantages of the six sense bases from the sense base of contact up to the sixth sense base of contact.

original: dge slong gi yid la sems pa'i rgyu las nang gi 'dod pas phongs pa'i sdug bsngal yin par yang dag par mthong nas yid la sems pa la ma dag me'i 'obs dang 'dra bar mthong ste /
analyzed: dge slong gi yid la sems pa'i rgyu las nang gi 'dod pas phongs pa'i sdug bsngal yin par yang dag par mthong nas yid la sems pa la ma dag me'i 'obs dang 'dra bar mthong ste /
translated: A monk sees the cause of mental intention as the suffering of inner poverty and sees mental intention as like a fire pit.

original: 'dod pas phongs pa las byung ba'i lus dang sems kyi yongs su gdung ba chen po skyed pa yin pa'i phyir des de ltar yang dag par mthong nas chos gos dang bsod snyoms la sogs pa la re bar mi byed par khyim rnams su 'jug par byed do
analyzed: 'dod pas phongs pa las byung ba'i lus dang sems kyi yongs su gdung ba chen po skyed pa yin pa'i phyir des de ltar yang dag par mthong nas chos gos dang bsod snyoms la sogs pa la re bar mi byed par khyim rnams su 'jug par byed do
translated: Because it generates great physical and mental torment arising from poverty, seeing it in this way, he enters the houses without hoping for Dharma robes, alms, and so on.

original: // de bas na 'dod pas phongs pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyis kyang gos par mi 'gyur la bde ba la reg par gnas par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: // de bas na 'dod pas phongs pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyis kyang gos par mi 'gyur la bde ba la reg par gnas par yang 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore he is not tainted by the suffering arising from poverty and he abides in contact with bliss.

original: de ltar na des kham gyi zas dang / reg pa dang yid @274a * //
analyzed: de ltar na des kham gyi zas dang / reg pa dang yid @274a * //
translated: Thus, he properly examines the three types of nutriment:

original: la sems pa'i zas rnam pa gsum tshul bzhin du brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: la sems pa'i zas rnam pa gsum tshul bzhin du brtags pa yin no //
translated: morsel food, contact, and mental volition.

original: des zas rnam pa gsum gyi rgyu de las nang gi rnam par shes pa la mdung thung sum brgyas btsugs pa bzhin du ji skad bstan pa'i sdug bsngal skye bar yang dag par mthong ngo //
analyzed: des zas rnam pa gsum gyi rgyu de las nang gi rnam par shes pa la mdung thung sum brgyas btsugs pa bzhin du ji skad bstan pa'i sdug bsngal skye bar yang dag par mthong ngo //
translated: From the cause of these three nutriments, he sees that the internal consciousness is generated with the suffering that has been explained, as if it were being pierced by three hundred spears.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ltar kham gyi zas kyi rgyu las kyang nad kyi sdug bsngal rnam pa du ma sna tshogs mang po rnam par shes pa la skye bar 'gyur la reg pa'i rgyu las kyang de'i 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal lhag par 'byung ba dang / yid la sems pa'i rgyu las kyang 'dod pas phongs pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar kham gyi zas kyi rgyu las kyang nad kyi sdug bsngal rnam pa du ma sna tshogs mang po rnam par shes pa la skye bar 'gyur la reg pa'i rgyu las kyang de'i 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal lhag par 'byung ba dang / yid la sems pa'i rgyu las kyang 'dod pas phongs pa'i sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because from the cause of morsel food, many different kinds of the suffering of disease are generated in the consciousness; from the cause of contact, the suffering of the loss of what is desired arises; and from the cause of mental volition, the suffering of not obtaining what is desired arises.

original: des de ltar rnam par shes pa'i zas la yang dag par mthong nas lus dang srog la mi lta bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des de ltar rnam par shes pa'i zas la yang dag par mthong nas lus dang srog la mi lta bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having seen the food of consciousness in this way, he will not be concerned with body and life.

original: de ltar na des zas bzhi po rnams tshul bzhin du brtags pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na des zas bzhi po rnams tshul bzhin du brtags pa yin te /
translated: In this way, he correctly investigates the four foods.

original: brtag pa de la brten nas tshe 'di la spong bar byed do //
analyzed: brtag pa de la brten nas tshe 'di la spong bar byed do //
translated: On the basis of this investigation, he abandons them in this life.

original: spangs nas kyang phyi ma la sdug bsngal mthar thug pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spangs nas kyang phyi ma la sdug bsngal mthar thug pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having abandoned them, he attains the ultimate cessation in the future.

original: zas bzhi po de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma mthong ba ni dga' ba dang 'dod chags gnyis kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: zas bzhi po de dag yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ma mthong ba ni dga' ba dang 'dod chags gnyis kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: One who does not see the four foods as they are in reality becomes afflicted by both delight and passion.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa de la ni tshe phyi ma dang / tshe 'di'i nyes dmigs rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa de la ni tshe phyi ma dang / tshe 'di'i nyes dmigs rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that for one who is afflicted, there are two kinds of misfortune, in this life and in the future.

original: de la zas bzhi po rnams las yid la sems pa'i rgyu las re ba dogs pa dang bcas pa'i yid bde ba nyon mongs pa can ni dga' ba yin no //
analyzed: de la zas bzhi po rnams las yid la sems pa'i rgyu las re ba dogs pa dang bcas pa'i yid bde ba nyon mongs pa can ni dga' ba yin no //
translated: Among the four nutriments, mental satisfaction that is defiled, accompanied by hope and fear, and the cause of mental intention is delight.

original: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa'i rgyu bde ba dang yid bde ba'i gnas kyi zas rnams la lhag par zhen pa ni 'dod chags so //
analyzed: bde ba myong bar 'gyur ba'i reg pa'i rgyu bde ba dang yid bde ba'i gnas kyi zas rnams la lhag par zhen pa ni 'dod chags so //
translated: Attachment is the excessive adherence to the nutriments that are the cause of contact that is experienced as pleasure and mental satisfaction.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa 'di gnyis kyi tshe 'di la rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa 'di gnyis kyi tshe 'di la rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs pa can du 'gyur te /
translated: In this life, consciousness becomes defiled by these two defilements.

original: rnam par shes pa'i gnas rnams la gnas nas phyi ma la yang srid par skye ba'i sa bon gyi tshul gyis skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i gnas rnams la gnas nas phyi ma la yang srid par skye ba'i sa bon gyi tshul gyis skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having been established in the abodes of consciousness, it arises in the future in the manner of a seed.

original: skyes nas yang srid par skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyes nas yang srid par skye ba'i skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Having arisen, the suffering of birth and so on is actualized in the next existence.

original: 'di ni tshe phyi ma'i nyes dmigs dga' ba dang 'dod chags kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa las byung ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni tshe phyi ma'i nyes dmigs dga' ba dang 'dod chags kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa las byung ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the misfortune of the next life that arises from the defilement of delight and attachment.

original: de yang de ltar zas bzhi po rnams la dga' ba dang 'dod @274b chags gnyis kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gnas pas tshe 'di la rdul dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang de ltar zas bzhi po rnams la dga' ba dang 'dod @274b chags gnyis kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gnas pas tshe 'di la rdul dang bcas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, since one dwells in a defiled state with regard to the four nutriments through both fondness and passion, one is accompanied by dust in this life.

original: de de ltar rdul dang bcas par gyur pas zas de rnam par 'gyur zhing gzhan du gyur bas mya ngan byed cing ngal la yid mi bde bar gnas te /
analyzed: de de ltar rdul dang bcas par gyur pas zas de rnam par 'gyur zhing gzhan du gyur bas mya ngan byed cing ngal la yid mi bde bar gnas te /
translated: Since one is accompanied by dust in this way, one grieves and is tormented and unhappy when the nutriments change and are transformed.

original: tshe 'di la mya ngan dang bcas par 'gyur ba 'di ni dga' ba dang 'dod chags las gyur ba'i tshe 'di'i nyes dmigs yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di la mya ngan dang bcas par 'gyur ba 'di ni dga' ba dang 'dod chags las gyur ba'i tshe 'di'i nyes dmigs yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This grief in this life should be understood as the misfortune in this life that arises from fondness and passion.

original: gang su yang rung ste zas bzhi po rnams la dga' ba dang 'dod chags ma spangs pa gang yin pa de'i rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus skye mched drug gis bsdus pa ni khang pa brtsegs pa lta bu yin te /

translated: The speaker is one who speaks by means of the conventions of hearing,üîΩunderstanding,üîΩor consciousness.üîΩOr else, the speaker is one who, by means of the conventions of subsequent designation,üîΩspeaks to a group of dependents such as sons, wives, male and female servants, etc.,

original: yang na bu dang chung ma dang / bran dang bran mo la sogs pa bu smad kyi tshogs rnams la ci rigs par gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i khyad par rnams las mchid stsol ba ni smra ba po yin no //
analyzed: yang na bu dang chung ma dang / bran dang bran mo la sogs pa bu smad kyi tshogs rnams la ci rigs par gnas dang gnas ma yin pa'i khyad par rnams las mchid stsol ba ni smra ba po yin no //
translated: about the distinctions between what is possible and impossible.

original: yang na phyi ma la las kyi 'bras bu skyes pa ni tshor ba po'o //
analyzed: yang na phyi ma la las kyi 'bras bu skyes pa ni tshor ba po'o //
translated: Or else, the experiencer is one who experiences the results of actions in a future life.

original: tshe 'di la skyes bu'i byed pa'i 'bras bu yang dag par skyes pa ni nyams su myong ba po'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di la skyes bu'i byed pa'i 'bras bu yang dag par skyes pa ni nyams su myong ba po'o //
translated: The one who experiences is one who experiences the results of human action that are produced in this life.

original: des 'das pa'i dus nas bzung ste tshe rabs de dang der dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las byas so cog gi rnam par smin pa da ltar tshe 'di la nyams su myong ba dang / des tshe'i tshad ji srid yod pa zad par byas nas 'chi ba'i dus byas te /
analyzed: des 'das pa'i dus nas bzung ste tshe rabs de dang der dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las byas so cog gi rnam par smin pa da ltar tshe 'di la nyams su myong ba dang / des tshe'i tshad ji srid yod pa zad par byas nas 'chi ba'i dus byas te /
translated: It is the one who, from the past, in this life, experiences the ripening of all the virtuous and nonvirtuous actions that he has done in this and that life.

original: phung po 'di yang 'dor la gzhan yang nyid mtshams sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: phung po 'di yang 'dor la gzhan yang nyid mtshams sbyor bar byed do //
translated: It is the one who, having exhausted the life span that he has, dies and abandons this body and connects with another.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If it were not so,üîΩwhere would all these things that have been taught come from?

original: bdag med du zin na ji skad bstan pa 'di dag @276b thams cad ga las 'byung zhes bya ba ni 'di ni tshul ma yin pa yid la byed pas bsdus pa'i lta ba'i gnas drug pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag med du zin na ji skad bstan pa 'di dag @276b thams cad ga las 'byung zhes bya ba ni 'di ni tshul ma yin pa yid la byed pas bsdus pa'i lta ba'i gnas drug pa yin no //
translated: This is the sixth abode of the view, which is included in the attention that is not the method.

original: de yang rang bzhin gyis ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin gyis ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba yin no //
translated: It is the view of the transitory collection by nature.

original: de ma yin pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba'i lta bar gyur pa rnams skye ba'i phyir ni lta ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba'i lta bar gyur pa rnams skye ba'i phyir ni lta ba'i gnas so //
translated: It is the abode of the view because other views that arise from the root of the view of the transitory collection arise from it.

original: de kho nar 'dzin pa'i shes rab la sgrib pas na lta ba tshang tshing ngo //
analyzed: de kho nar 'dzin pa'i shes rab la sgrib pas na lta ba tshang tshing ngo //
translated: It is a thicket of views because it obscures the wisdom that grasps reality.

original: dge ba'i chos las phongs par byed pas na lta ba'i dgon pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos las phongs par byed pas na lta ba'i dgon pa'o //
translated: It is a wilderness of views because it causes one to be deprived of the wholesome dharmas.

original: gzhan gyi dring 'jog pas na lta ba'i 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring 'jog pas na lta ba'i 'da' ba'o //
translated: It is a bondage of views because it causes one to be led by others.

original: 'dod pa dang srid pa tshol ba rnam par spyod pas na lta ba rnam par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang srid pa tshol ba rnam par spyod pas na lta ba rnam par spyod pa'o //
translated: It is a practice of views because it causes one to engage in the search for desire and existence.

original: gzhan gyis klan ka btsal zhing skur ba 'debs pa las thar par bskyod pas na lta ba rnam par bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis klan ka btsal zhing skur ba 'debs pa las thar par bskyod pas na lta ba rnam par bskyod pa'o //
translated: It is a disturbance of views because it causes one to be agitated by the accusations and refutations of others.

original: yang srid par skye ba'i sdug bsngal kun du sbyor bar byed pas na lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: yang srid par skye ba'i sdug bsngal kun du sbyor bar byed pas na lta ba'i kun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: It is a fetter of views because it causes one to be fettered by the suffering of rebirth.

original: de ltar log par zhugs pa de'i ni tshe 'di la zag pa mngon sum du ma gyur pa ni mngon sum du skye bar 'gyur ro //üîΩmngon sum du gyur pa chung ngu la brten nas 'bring du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar log par zhugs pa de'i ni tshe 'di la zag pa mngon sum du ma gyur pa ni mngon sum du skye bar 'gyur ro // mngon sum du gyur pa chung ngu la brten nas 'bring du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, for one who has entered wrongly, the defilements that have not become manifest in this life will become manifest.üîΩRelying on the small, they become medium.

original: 'bring po la brten nas chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bring po la brten nas chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: Relying on the medium, they become great.

original: de'i rgyus kyang phyi ma la rga shi mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i rgyus kyang phyi ma la rga shi mngon par 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: And on account of that, in the future, aging and death will be actualized.üîΩThus, one should understand that the affliction that arises from the truth of suffering and the truth of origination is due to not knowing correctly and in accordance with reality what is correct and incorrect.

original: de ltar na tshul bzhin dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes pas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / kun 'byung ba'i bden pa las gyur pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na tshul bzhin dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes pas sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang / kun 'byung ba'i bden pa las gyur pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of that is the affliction that arises from the truth of cessation and the truth of the path.

original: de las bzlog pa dam pa'i chos mnyan pa la mos shing tshul bzhin la tshul bzhin du phyin ci ma log par 'du shes shing tshul bzhin dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes nas yid la bya bar 'os
analyzed: de las bzlog pa dam pa'i chos mnyan pa la mos shing tshul bzhin la tshul bzhin du phyin ci ma log par 'du shes shing tshul bzhin dang tshul bzhin ma yin pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes nas yid la bya bar 'os
translated: One who is inclined to listen to the sublime teaching, who understands correctly and without error what is correct and incorrect, and who knows correctly and in accordance with reality what is correct and incorrect, is fit to take mental note of the following.

original: pa'i chos rnams yid la byed pa'i rgyus dus gsum gyi 'du byed rnams gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bdag med pa dang / bdag gi med par yang dag par mthong nas bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i mdo las mthong bas spang par bya ba'i zag pa rnams las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i chos rnams yid la byed pa'i rgyus dus gsum gyi 'du byed rnams gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bdag med pa dang / bdag gi med par yang dag par mthong nas bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i mdo las mthong bas spang par bya ba'i zag pa rnams las rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The S≈´tra on the Clear Realizations says that one becomes liberated from the defilements that are to be abandoned by seeing by correctly seeing, through the cause of attending to the dharmas of the three times, that the grasped and grasper are, as they are in reality, without a self and without a self‚Äôs property.

original: de ltar gyur nas kyang gong du bsgom pas spang par bya ba'i zag pa rnams ma lus par spang par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de ltar gyur nas kyang gong du bsgom pas spang par bya ba'i zag pa rnams ma lus par spang par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: Having become like that, in order to completely abandon the defilements that are to be abandoned by cultivation,

original: rgyu bzhis sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: rgyu bzhis sbyor bar byed de /
translated: one applies oneself through four causes.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: lus legs @277a * //
analyzed: lus legs @277a * //
translated: One guards the body well,

original: par bsrungs pa dang / dbang po legs par bsdams pa dang / dran pa legs par gnas pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'jig rten gyis 'byung ba dang / med par 'gyur ba'i shes rab ji ltar thob pa lan mang du byed pa'o //
analyzed: par bsrungs pa dang / dbang po legs par bsdams pa dang / dran pa legs par gnas pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'jig rten gyis 'byung ba dang / med par 'gyur ba'i shes rab ji ltar thob pa lan mang du byed pa'o //
translated: one restrains the sense faculties well, one establishes mindfulness well, and one frequently cultivates the supramundane wisdom that one has attained, which is the cause of transcending the world and becoming non-existent.

original: de la lus legs par bsrungs te /
analyzed: de la lus legs par bsrungs te /
translated: then you will be able to abandon the angry elephant of the body,

original: gnas pa ni glang po che khro bo rgyang ring du spong ba nas rgyas par nyan thos kyi sa las 'byung ba bzhin du sbyar te yongs su spangs na /
analyzed: gnas pa ni glang po che khro bo rgyang ring du spong ba nas rgyas par nyan thos kyi sa las 'byung ba bzhin du sbyar te yongs su spangs na /
translated: and so on, as explained in detail in the ≈örƒÅvaka Levels.

original: zag pa zad par bya ba la bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zag pa zad par bya ba la bar du gcod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If you abandon these, they will not obstruct the exhaustion of the contaminants.

original: dbang po legs par bsdams te /
analyzed: dbang po legs par bsdams te /
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, if you are able to restrain the sense faculties well,

original: gnas pa ni chags par 'gyur ba'i yul mngon sum du gyur pa la tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i sdug ba'i mtshan ma spangs nas mi sdug pa'i mtshan ma yid la byed do //
analyzed: gnas pa ni chags par 'gyur ba'i yul mngon sum du gyur pa la tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i sdug ba'i mtshan ma spangs nas mi sdug pa'i mtshan ma yid la byed do //
translated: then you will be able to abandon the signs of the pleasant in the presence of objects that arouse attachment, and you will bring to mind the signs of the unpleasant.üîΩ‚ÄúMonks, if you are able to establish mindfulness well,

original: dran pa legs par gnas pa de ni gnas bzhi la gnas par 'gyur te /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: dran pa legs par gnas pa de ni gnas bzhi la gnas par 'gyur te /üîΩ'di lta ste /
translated: then you will be able to establish the four establishments of mindfulness.üîΩ‚ÄúMonks, if you are able to cultivate the four establishments of mindfulness well,üîΩthen you will be able to cultivate the seven factors of awakening.

original: chos gos la sogs pa brtags te yongs su longs spyod pa dang / lkog na rtog pa ngan pa kun du spyod pa sel bar byed pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa las byung ba'i ngal ba dang / 'khrug pa dang / yongs su 'dzag par byed pa'i sdug bsngal dang /
analyzed: chos gos la sogs pa brtags te yongs su longs spyod pa dang / lkog na rtog pa ngan pa kun du spyod pa sel bar byed pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa las byung ba'i ngal ba dang / 'khrug pa dang / yongs su 'dzag par byed pa'i sdug bsngal dang /
translated: He uses his robes and so on after examining them, and he endures the suffering that arises from the bad thoughts of others, from the fatigue that arises from the exertion of beginning an action, from the suffering of agitation and dissipation, and from the suffering of sexual intercourse.

original: gzhan gyi ngag rtsub po las byung ba dang / khams ma snyoms pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang du len pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ngag rtsub po las byung ba dang / khams ma snyoms pa las byung ba'i sdug bsngal dang du len pa'o //
translated: He endures the suffering that arises from the harsh words of others and the suffering that arises from imbalance of the elements.

original: de ltar lam bsgom pa la bag yod pa'i sgo nas mi 'dre bar gnas pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar lam bsgom pa la bag yod pa'i sgo nas mi 'dre bar gnas pa ni /
translated: Thus, he who abides in non-intercourse through heedfulness in the cultivation of the path,

original: dran pas legs par gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dran pas legs par gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: abides well through mindfulness.

original: de de ltar lus legs par bsrungs pa dang / dbang po legs par bsdams pa dang / dran pa legs par gnas pa dang / ji ltar thob pa'i lam bsgom pa las brten nas bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i zag pa rnams las kyang rnam par grol bar 'gyur la gtan du mthar thug pa yang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de de ltar lus legs par bsrungs pa dang / dbang po legs par bsdams pa dang / dran pa legs par gnas pa dang / ji ltar thob pa'i lam bsgom pa las brten nas bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i zag pa rnams las kyang rnam par grol bar 'gyur la gtan du mthar thug pa yang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, by properly protecting the body, properly restraining the faculties, properly establishing mindfulness, and cultivating the path as attained, one becomes liberated from the defilements to be abandoned by cultivation, and attains the ultimate final stage.

original: la la 'di skad ces zer te /
analyzed: la la 'di skad ces zer te /
translated: Some say:

original: 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi yin te /
translated: These are the four noble truths.

original: bdag gam sems can gang yang rung ba 'dis ni bden pa 'di rnams la dmigs pa dang bcas nas dge ba'i chos rnams sgom par byed do zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: bdag gam sems can gang yang rung ba 'dis ni bden pa 'di rnams la dmigs pa dang bcas nas dge ba'i chos rnams sgom par byed do zhes zer ba la /
translated: Whether it is the self or a sentient being, one cultivates virtuous dharmas by observing these truths.

original: de skad ma zer cing ces smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: de skad ma zer cing ces smra bar bya'o //
translated: One should say, Do not say that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i chos rnam pa du ma gang ci yang rung ba @277b skye ba de dag thams cad ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po 'di dag nyid kyi nang du 'du bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dge ba'i chos rnam pa du ma gang ci yang rung ba @277b skye ba de dag thams cad ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po 'di dag nyid kyi nang du 'du bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Whatever wholesome mundane and supramundane dharmas arise, all of them are included in these four noble truths.

original: 'di ni gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di ni gnyis te /
translated: This is twofold:

original: shes pa dang / shes bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang / shes bya'o //
translated: knowledge and the object of knowledge.

original: shes pa de yang shes byar 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes pa de yang shes byar 'gyur te /
translated: That knowledge becomes the object of knowledge.

original: de bas na dge ba'i chos shes pa dang ldan pa de dag ni bden pa rnams su 'du bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de bas na dge ba'i chos shes pa dang ldan pa de dag ni bden pa rnams su 'du bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: Therefore, those who possess the knowledge of wholesome dharmas are included in the truths.

original: / de dag kyang lus su gtogs pa'i dran pa bsgom pa'i lhag mthong gi phyogs dang mthun pa rnams dang / zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang mthun pa rnams ni mdor na yongs su sbyang ba'i sa dang / byas pa bsrung ba'i sa la skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: / de dag kyang lus su gtogs pa'i dran pa bsgom pa'i lhag mthong gi phyogs dang mthun pa rnams dang / zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang mthun pa rnams ni mdor na yongs su sbyang ba'i sa dang / byas pa bsrung ba'i sa la skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, those that are conducive to the insight of cultivating mindfulness belonging to the body and those that are conducive to serenity arise in brief on the stage of thorough preparation and the stage of guarding what has been accomplished.

original: lus su gtogs pa'i dran pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: lus su gtogs pa'i dran pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is mindfulness belonging to the body?

original: yongs su sbyang ba'i sa la nang dang phyi rol gyi 'byung ba chen po'i gzugs la dmigs pa gang yin pa'am /
analyzed: yongs su sbyang ba'i sa la nang dang phyi rol gyi 'byung ba chen po'i gzugs la dmigs pa gang yin pa'am /
translated: On the stage of complete preparation, the object is the internal and external form of the great elements.

original: gzhan dag gis sdug pa dang mi sdug ba'i tshig bla dags dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis kun du spyod pa na tshul bzhin gyis 'dus te reg pa'i tshor ba dang ; 'du shes pa dang / 'du byed dang /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis sdug pa dang mi sdug ba'i tshig bla dags dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa'i 'dus te reg pa dag gis kun du spyod pa na tshul bzhin gyis 'dus te reg pa'i tshor ba dang ; 'du shes pa dang / 'du byed dang /
translated: Or else, when one is engaged in the pleasant and unpleasant words of others, the object is the feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions and consciousness that arise from contact that is accompanied by resistance, and which are in conformity with the correct state of contact.

original: rnam par shes pa rnams la dmigs pa dang / byas pa bsrung ba'i sa la rgyu las byung ba'i gzugs la dmigs pa'am //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnams la dmigs pa dang / byas pa bsrung ba'i sa la rgyu las byung ba'i gzugs la dmigs pa'am //
translated: On the stage of guarding what has been done, the object is form that has arisen from causes.

original: yid la byed pa dang bcas pa'i de las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnams la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa dang bcas pa'i de las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa rnams la dmigs pa ste /
translated: Or else, the object is the feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions and consciousness that have arisen from that, together with the mental activity.

original: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni gzugs kyi lus la dmigs pa dang / ming gi lus la dmigs pa'i lus su gtogs pa'i dran pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus pa ni gzugs kyi lus la dmigs pa dang / ming gi lus la dmigs pa'i lus su gtogs pa'i dran pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: All of these are included in the mindfulness belonging to the body, which has as its object the body as form and the body as name.

original: de la lhag mthong ni gang lhag mthong gi phyogs dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la lhag mthong ni gang lhag mthong gi phyogs dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i chos rnams ni gang zhe na /
translated: What is insight? What are the wholesome roots that are favorable to insight?

original: 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi nang dang phyi rol rnams dang de ma yin pa'i phung po rnams shes rab kyis yang dag par rab tu rnam par 'byed pa gang yin pa 'di ni lhag mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi nang dang phyi rol rnams dang de ma yin pa'i phung po rnams shes rab kyis yang dag par rab tu rnam par 'byed pa gang yin pa 'di ni lhag mthong ngo //
translated: Insight is the discernment of the internal and external elements and of the aggregates other than the elements, by means of wisdom.

original: thog ma kho nar ril po'i 'du shes rnam par dbye ba gang yin pa dang / phyi rol gyi 'byung ba chen po rnams la 'jig pa las gyur ba'i zag pa yang dag par mthong ba'i sgo nas mi rtag par 'du shes pa dang / nang gi 'byung ba chen po'i lus la kha zas ran pas khad kyis khad kyis gso ste /
analyzed: thog ma kho nar ril po'i 'du shes rnam par dbye ba gang yin pa dang / phyi rol gyi 'byung ba chen po rnams la 'jig pa las gyur ba'i zag pa yang dag par mthong ba'i sgo nas mi rtag par 'du shes pa dang / nang gi 'byung ba chen po'i lus la kha zas ran pas khad kyis khad kyis gso ste /
translated: First, the perception of the whole is distinguished, and the perception of impermanence is from seeing the destruction of the external great elements.

original: de mi gtsang bar yang dag par mthong nas mi sdug par 'du shes pa dang / @278a * //
analyzed: de mi gtsang bar yang dag par mthong nas mi sdug par 'du shes pa dang / @278a * //
translated: The perception of foulness is from seeing the body as impure.üîΩThe perception of suffering is from seeing the body as arising from craving.üîΩThe perception of impermanence is from seeing the body as subject to death in the future.

original: sred pa las byung bar yang dag par mthong ba dang / phyi ma'i mthar 'chi ba'i chos can yin pas mi rtag par 'du shes pa dang / mi rtag pa la yang sdug bsngal bar 'du shes par 'gyur ro //üîΩbyis pa mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes nas lus gang la nga'o snyam pa'am /
analyzed: sred pa las byung bar yang dag par mthong ba dang / phyi ma'i mthar 'chi ba'i chos can yin pas mi rtag par 'du shes pa dang / mi rtag pa la yang sdug bsngal bar 'du shes par 'gyur ro // byis pa mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mi shes nas lus gang la nga'o snyam pa'am /
translated: The perception of suffering is from seeing the impermanent as suffering.

original: bdag gi snyam pa'am //
analyzed: bdag gi snyam pa'am //
translated: The fool, not knowing impermanence and suffering as they really are, thinks of the body as ‚ÄúI‚Äù or ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: bdag snyam du sems pa'i lus de nyid la /
analyzed: bdag snyam du sems pa'i lus de nyid la /
translated: The noble disciples who possess learning do not grasp the body as ‚ÄúI‚Äù or ‚Äúmine‚Äù because they have thorough knowledge.

original: thos pa dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos ni rab tu shes pas de ltar mi 'dzin la de'i 'du shes de ni sdug bsngal la bdag med par 'du shes pa dang ; bdag ma yin par 'du shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: thos pa dang ldan pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos ni rab tu shes pas de ltar mi 'dzin la de'i 'du shes de ni sdug bsngal la bdag med par 'du shes pa dang ; bdag ma yin par 'du shes par 'gyur te /
translated: Their perception is the perception of the selflessness of suffering and the perception of the absence of a self.

original: lus la khams tsam du zad par 'du shes par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de ltar 'du shes pa de ni gzhan dag gis sdug pa dang / mi sdug pa'i tshig bla dags kyi 'du shes te / reg pa dag dang / mi sdug pa'i lag pa dang / dbyug pa dang / bong ba'i 'dus te reg pa dag gi kun du spyod pa byas kyang de ni rgyu dang bcas pa'i tshor ba la sogs pa gzugs can ma yin pa'i 'du shes byed de dag la yang mi rtag par yang dag par mthong bas rjes su chags par yang mi

analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rnam pa bzhir rig par bya'o //
